The funding is going to help with costs of living and working exclusively on these projects, it will go to travel, research, food, rental of instruments and payment to musicians and other artists working with me on this project. It will offset my living expenses from being away from home and my daughter who is staying with my parents on their horse ranch. The core funding from this Indiegogo campaign will allow me that freedom to create and thus give you a product that will be available first to YOU the funder and then available this fall to public audiences. I have always had the best reputation of putting 120% into my projects and pushing those projects to be available at good cost to audiences not just private collectors or institutions. The fact that this will be my first Indiegogo crowd source funding makes me excited that fans of my work can directly impact this new direction for me. As a pledge I have offered up for the first time postcards of my highly sought after work, mainly the URBAN INDIAN series, so for the first time this will be available with a $100 contribution. I have my wonderful full colour photo poster set of National Indian Leg Wrestling League of North America available which is definitely a collectible. Also for the first time I have my iinniiwahkiimah Vinyl Decal 12 inch (dipping black buffalo vinyl decal) up for grabs.I have forged a career out of working hard, touring as much as I can and putting everything I have into producing unique and personal work. My track record speaks for its self from my website and my CV with shows and work all over the world consistently touring in solo and group shows. I am an accomplished award winning artist and I am PROUD to have forged a close tie to my audiences and reach out directly to YOU to help continue these amazing works.The challenge with this project is my venture into music fully; I have always loved music and audio works. When my daughter was born 10 years ago I took up the guitar as a hobby and singing so I can share the music I loved with Neko. Ten years later I have finally decided to challenge myself with yet another direction. Learning music over the years and collaborating with amazing friends and colleagues has pushed me to make my own music. Please FUND this project. YOU the audience will never regret being part of a great project with Haunting effects.

story:
You speak English?, read below:

Vous parlez Français?, lisez plus bas, après le texte anglais.

A dream, fulfilled.

In April of 2001, I quit my job, left my apt. put my belonging in storage and fulfilled a long time dream to bicycle and sketch my way around the world.  A solo adventure that would take me through 16 countries in Southern Europe, the Middle East, the Sub-Continent, South East Asia, New Zealand and the US , pedaling 14,000 miles during a span of 14 months. 

I came back in June 2002 with seven sketchbooks full of watercolors and stories. 

What better way to share this adventure but with a book telling the tale of my journey with the very images drawn “in situ” and the journal entries.

After ten years going through my memories, the book is finished and after printing a prototype I do have a sense of completion, indeed.

284 pages, more than 600 hundred sketches and watercolors, the tale is told in words yet mostly in images, each drawing “hiding” it own story.

But a book is nothing without readers, and after studying my options I decided to self publish and print a limited edition of a 1000 books, 500 in English, 500 in French.  I am very excited to be able to share this story in both the language of my roots and that of my adoptive land.

Sharing

Self-publishing is another exciting adventure, but yes it involves funds and my hope is to use this campaign to allow you to pre-order the book, therefore allowing me to get some money upfront to go to print.  Printing 1000 books, full color with almost 300 pages (13 x 11) is quite an investment, but I am confident I can reach my goal with a little help.
 
I also would like to donate 5% of the sale of each book to the UNHCR, the UN Refugee Agency helping families fleeing violence in Syria, a country now torn apart, where I experienced the greatest hospitality, and the most gentle people.
http://www.unrefugees.org/site/c.lfIQKSOwFqG/b....

Your help in "writing the last chapter"

I hope to go to print towards the begining of the summer.  The amount I am trying to raise is not the full cost of the print run, but that would definitely help a lot for this project to see the light, and for the last chapter of this dream to be finally written.

I am planning to go to print in June for a book release in the Fall.

Feel free to share this with anyone you want, and Thank You in advance!


Un rêve, réalisé.

Le titre français:
Le monde au bout des rayons, le monde au bout du crayon.

En avril 2001, j'ai plié bagages.  Mes affaires dans la cave d'une amie, je suis partie réaliser un rêve: un tour du monde en bicyclette, carnets de croquis dans les sacoches.  Cette aventure en solitaire me verrait traverser 16 pays de part le sud de l'Europe, le Moyen Orient, l'Asie, la Nouvelle Zélande et les Etats Unis. 22.000 kilomètres pendant 14 mois.
Je suis revenue en juin 2002, avec 7 carnets remplis d'aquarelles et d'histoires.

Une autre aventure commençait alors: rassembler toutes ces mémoires, ces images, sous la forme d'un livre, et partager l'aventure.  Après 10 ans de travail, j'ai enfin un prototype, un sens d'avoir finalement écrit le dernier chapitre.

284 pages, plus de 600 dessins et aquarelles, c'est un carnet de voyage qui vous raconte cette histoire.

Un livre n'est rien sans ses lecteurs, et après bien des recherches, j'ai décidé de publier le livre moi-même en une édition limitée de 1000 livres, 500 en français, 500 en anglais.  Je me réjouis de pouvoir partager mon histoire dans ma langue natale et celle de mon pays adoptif.

Partage.

La publication à compte d'auteur est une autre aventure, et oui cela engage un petit capital!  J'espère pouvoir utiliser cette campagne comme pré-commande du livre, ce qui me permettrait d'avoir quelques fonds pour l'impression.  Un tirage de 1000 livres (33cm x 28cm - format à l'Italienne), de presque 300 pages, en quadrichromie, est un investissement, mais avec votre aide je suis sûre de pouvoir atteindre mon but.  

Je voudrais aussi donner 5% de la vente de chaque livre à une association humanitaire l'UNHCR, une organisation des Nations Unies aidant les familles syriennes à fuir la violence de leur pays maintenant déchiré, une terre où l'hospitalité et la gentillesse de ses habitants m'a profondément émue.

http://www.unrefugees.org/site/c.lfIQKSOwFqG/b....

Votre aide pour "l'écriture du dernier chapitre".

J'espère pouvoir lancer le tirage au début de l'été.  Le montant que j'essaie d'obtenir n'est pas le coût total du tirage, mais serait déjà une aide fabuleuse dans l'accomplissement de ce projet, et oui, l'écriture de ce "dernier chapitre".

Je compte lancer le tirage en juin, pour une parution à l'automne.

Partagez ceci avec quiconque, et mille mercis d'avance!

story:
The Mantis Garden

The Mantis Garden is a sacred art installation that merges both the importance of creative process and sense of community. Originally a single wooden mantis sculpture, the installation has been given a new, evolving life due to a pivotal moment when the daughter of the artist’s friend asked to paint it's tail.

The joy and sense of bringing people of unique backgrounds together that was experienced in that very moment sparked a whole new path for the single mantis, affectionately named "Mantis Greatburn".
The piece was immediately relocated for the sole purpose of being painted by everyone and anyone:
artist, non-artist, lawyer, single mother, barista… The list goes on and on.

Over 100 participants gave the sculpture a new “skin” at the Painted Bride Art Center in Philadelphia during a month long residency in December 2011. This inspiring process drove a natural evolution from a standalone art piece to a vision of a touring, ever-evolving, community-driven garden of participation.

 

This is Phase 1

The Installation of the Mantis Garden.

Build-Paint-Transport

Build five mantises of varying sizes, ranging from 12’ to 18’ tall made of Birch and steel.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Once cut the Mantis will travel to numerous events and festivals this Spring/Summer 2012 to be painted with UV reactive paint by the community

                                              (http://photobucket.com/Mantis-Garden)

The Mantis will visit numerous Art collectives, Burner  and recreational/outreach groups. Once the Mantis are completed they will be shipped to Black rock city for a Deep Playa installation at this years Burning Man Festival. In Mantis Garden phase 1 of this vision, five very uniquely “skinned” mantises will surround the two story tall “Egg Chamber” (http://tinyurl.com/mantisgardenphotos)(Recipient of a PEX 2011 summer festival Art grant and made possible through extensive collaboration with Franks Kitchens-philla) bringing years of new friendships, creations,
participation and travel to its destination in DEEP Playa.

 

The aim is to transport the installation to the Black Rock Desert in late August to be showcased as a tribute to community, artistic process and a living memorial to the artist’s father who recently passed away. “My father loved to share the beauty of art with everyone, and that is the goal of this Mantis Garden.”

 





             

                           In memory of

                         Gary Lee Spurgin

                            1938-2012


The Artist


My resume reads as diversely as the community The Mantis Garden aims to bring
together. From clothing designer, to musician, to producer, to production engineer, my list of interests and goals are wide ranging. I was born in Belgium, and currently live in Philadelphia . I work as the Technical Director for The Painted Bride Art Center, a not-for-profit theater where I creates innovative dance, theater and world music productions with my amazing team. With a background in event production, I began designing large scale installations four years ago after going to my first Burning Man festival. I started combining aspects of multi-media, sculpture and projection mapping with the original Mantis I made in 2010.
My friends and I share a warehouse space called "Chemical Cove" that we use to build installations for different events throughout the year. We host weekly art parties and invite the public to come create with us. I Love the process. The creation. Through art I have been able to create one of the strongest community of friends anyone could ever imagine. I want to give this gift to others.

We have an open door policy and we regularly get to meet new people that "Needed This", Just to know that late at night somewhere  someone is making the world a little more magical. Part of the funds we are rasing are going to create field kits of paint that we can bring to different events consisting of Paints, Brushes, Floor matts and UV lighting.

I strongly believe that participation in creative collaboration makes a better community and thus a better world.
Please help me bring this to your community and beyond.

 

After the initial installation comes back from Black rock city we shall begin Phase 2.

PHASE 2 -"The Mantis Garden -Continued outreach"


Beyond the Mantis Garden, Beyond Black rock City
The dream for the future of the Mantis Garden is to collaborate with public parks, children’s hospitals and senior living communities in an effort to involve even more people in the arts. Many more mantises can easily be made and installed in far reaching places as a visual representation of the communities that helped beautify them. There is no end in sight as long as there are willing contributors.

Phase 2 is scheduled to begin in September 2012 when The Mantis Garden returns from its Black rock Installation

Get Involved

During Phase 1 funding is needed to purchase the wood, Special UV reactive stage paint, Brushes, Steel and welding supplies, UV lighting, transport costs to BM and to cover the cost of CNC cutting.

Any contribution is greatly appreciated by both the artist and his core team of volunteers. As a thank you for your donation,
the following levels of contribution will be rewarded as a token of gratitude:

-Donation of $10: Recieve a Mantis Garden Sticker Designed and created by Philadelphia Artist Doug Crissman

-Donation of $25: free entry to 1 fundraiser event in New York City/Philadelphia that is artist produced.

-Donation of $45: Free tarot reading by Katy Finello

-Donation of $50: free limitededition/numbered Mantis t-shirt designed by Philadelphia artist Doug Crissman

-Donation of $75: Receive a hand Blown Holiday Ornatment By Glass/Metal Artist Kort Walsh

-Donation of $100 Receive one hour massage from Justin Ziegler

-Donation of $150: Mantis Garden wooden plaque of support. Taken to Black Rock and photographed with The Mantis Garden

-Donation of $500: custom 6' mantis made in your name to be painted by community.

-Donation of $750: Receive A Private Dinner for 6 at The Painted bride theater surrounded by Mantis. Your meal will be prepared by Hells Kitchen star Siobhan Allgood for this intimate dinner for you and 5 of your friends in your very own Private theater.

-Donation of $1000: Custom 12-15' Mantis made in your honor or Organization's name



 Would you like to get involved but don’t have the funds to contribute monetarily? There are many other ways you can help! After all, this entire project is fueled by community effort!

- Spread awareness! Share this project with anyone you think would like to contribute either monetarily, artistically or otherwise
-Host a Mantis Garden art party! Want to bring your community together? How about bringing a mantis to your event or backyard to be painted by your friends, family and beyond?
-Have contacts for hospitals or outreach programs that may want to get involved?
-Know someone who works for a parks department? The mantises need a permanent home once they are done touring!
-Have access to CNC machines (computerized milling machines)?
-Interested in helping to transport the mantises to events?Safe driver?We need you!
-Have connections to local, regional or national press? Let’s get these mantises out to many different communities to be painted!

story:
ThreadWritten Textiles is a home decor and women's accessories business that combines contemporary design with ethnic textiles, created in collaboration with international artisans.

My campaign will fund the production of my first line (a pillow, apron, table runner, and bag), using embroidery from Hungary and Romania. Incorporating Hungarian embroidery is a natural choice, drawing from the inspiration of the traditional costumes I saw while in Budapest on an artist’s residency in 2009. I am working with Kalotaszeg style “written” embroidery (table runner pictured above at left) that originated in a region of Transylvania, Romania, part of Hungary until 1922. My first products will include a pillow, table runner, apron, and bag-- all with the red tulip-based design pictured above on tracing paper and all in natural linen, staying true to the original form. The first bag prototype is also shown above, beneath the leather strapping and the tulip drawing.  The design has a great twist to it-- to be revealed this summer during sample production!

ThreadWritten has grown out of my photography and mixed media work, traveling in Europe, sewing bags for friends, taking a small business class, a love of design and art in everyday life, and connecting with people through service as a massage therapist. After researching PhD programs in textiles in 2011, I realized I could accomplish the same goal of traveling and studying textiles, independently, with the mission of creating a business, supporting the artisans I meet, and sharing their cultural heritage.

As a designer I strive for a balance between traditional motifs and contemporary forms. I encourage viewing textiles as cultural, social, and historical documents to “read”, as well as to live with and take comfort. I value simple beauty, art in everyday life, the joy of vibrant colors and patterns, and evidence of the artist’s hand.

Watch and contribute to the process at www.facebook.com/ThreadWritten!

Gifts for You

I have created a limited edition silkscreened tote bag and tea towel, currently for sale on etsy (www.etsy.com/shop/threadwritten), specifically for fundraising for my first line.

For larger donations you will also receive a photograph from my trip or a small edition photograph from the trip with hand-stitching, similar to the mixed media work on www.sarahpedlow.com/category/mixed-media/.

Here's where your contribution will go:

Sample Production costs in San Francisco for bag and apron: $500...  Airfare, SFO-BUD: $1,000... Lodging in Budapest and Transylvania (4 weeks): $800...  Bus/Metro/Train Travel: $250...  Fabric and supplies for samples in HU/RO: $100... Estimated artisans' wages for first samples: $100...   Materials and artisans' wages + SF productions costs for first line: $4,000.

These costs are above the $5,000 for which I'm asking.  Savings and extra massage work over the last several months will make up the difference.

The most important step in moving forward is taking the trip to Hungary and Romania. Partial funding on indiegogo will enable me to start cultivating relationships and find high quality materials and craftsmanship.

The Impact

ThreadWritten aims to support women artisans, their communities and cultures, by paying fair trade wages, preserving the integrity of traditional styles and techniques, and educating consumers about lesser-known crafts that are disappearing.

Building relationships with people through design, supporting traditional textile work, and helping women create a sustainable livelihood are the most exciting parts of the business!

Other Ways You Can Help

I need your help spreading the word! Please post on Facebook and Twitter! Tell your friends and family and encourage them to pass it along! 

Feel free to copy and paste:

On Facebook:
Sarah Pedlow of ThreadWritten Textiles is going to Hungary to make hand-stitched aprons, bags, and pillows! She needs your help to make it happen! http://bit.ly/launchTWT

On Twitter:
@sarahpedlow is going to Hungary to make hand-stitched home decor and bags! She needs your help to make it happen!  http://bit.ly/launchTWT

Love ethnic textiles + modern design? Help @sarahpedlow launch her line of home decor made with artisans in Hungary! http://bit.ly/launchTWT

Help @sarahpedlow launch her line of embroidered home decor hand-stitched by women in Hungary and Romania! http://bit.ly/launchTWT

Stay up to date and see a growing selection of images from my travels and my process in the studio: "like" www.facebook.com/ThreadWritten and go to www.threadwrittentextiles.com.

THANK YOU so much for your support!

The first bag prototype is also shown above, beneath the leather strapping and the tulip drawing.  The design has a great twist to it-- to be revealed this summer during sample production!
ThreadWritten has grown out of my photography and mixed media work, traveling in Europe, sewing bags for friends, taking a small business class, a love of design and art in everyday life, and connecting with people through service as a massage therapist. After researching PhD programs in textiles in 2011, I realized I could accomplish the same goal of traveling and studying textiles, independently, with the mission of creating a business, supporting the artisans I meet, and sharing their cultural heritage. As a designer I strive for a balance between traditional motifs and contemporary forms. I encourage viewing textiles as cultural, social, and historical documents to “read”, as well as to live with and take comfort. I value simple beauty, art in everyday life, the joy of vibrant colors and patterns, and evidence of the artist’s hand.
Watch and contribute to the process at www.facebook.com/ThreadWritten!


Gifts for You
I have created a limited edition silkscreened tote bag and tea towel, currently for sale on etsy (www.etsy.com/shop/threadwritten), specifically for fundraising for my first line.
For larger donations you will also receive a photograph from my trip or a small edition photograph from the trip with hand-stitching, similar to the mixed media work on www.sarahpedlow.com/category/mixed-media/.
Here's where your contribution will go:
Sample Production costs in San Francisco for bag and apron: $500...  Airfare, SFO-BUD: $1,000... Lodging in Budapest and Transylvania (4 weeks): $800...  Bus/Metro/Train Travel: $250...  Fabric and supplies for samples in HU/RO: $100... Estimated artisans' wages for first samples: $100...   Materials and artisans' wages + SF productions costs for first line: $4,000.
These costs are above the $5,000 for which I'm asking.  Savings and extra massage work over the last several months will make up the difference.
The most important step in moving forward is taking the trip to Hungary and Romania. Partial funding on indiegogo will enable me to start cultivating relationships and find high quality materials and craftsmanship.
The Impact


ThreadWritten aims to support women artisans, their communities and cultures, by paying fair trade wages, preserving the integrity of traditional styles and techniques, and educating consumers about lesser-known crafts that are disappearing.
Building relationships with people through design, supporting traditional textile work, and helping women create a sustainable livelihood are the most exciting parts of the business!


Other Ways You Can Help
I need your help spreading the word! Please post on Facebook and Twitter! Tell your friends and family and encourage them to pass it along! 
Feel free to copy and paste:
On Facebook:Sarah Pedlow of ThreadWritten Textiles is going to Hungary to make hand-stitched aprons, bags, and pillows! She needs your help to make it happen! http://bit.ly/launchTWT
On Twitter: @sarahpedlow is going to Hungary to make hand-stitched home decor and bags! She needs your help to make it happen!  http://bit.ly/launchTWT
Love ethnic textiles + modern design? Help @sarahpedlow launch her line of home decor made with artisans in Hungary! http://bit.ly/launchTWT
Help @sarahpedlow launch her line of embroidered home decor hand-stitched by women in Hungary and Romania! http://bit.ly/launchTWT
Stay up to date and see a growing selection of images from my travels and my process in the studio: "like" www.facebook.com/ThreadWritten and go to www.threadwrittentextiles.com.
THANK YOU so much for your support!

story:
EMBODY

turn your smell into an aura.

EMBODY the spirit of great historic leaders.

for:

  • Everyday inspiration

     

  • Unique gifts

     

  • Prize winning Halloween costumes

    FAQ

    How do I let you know my sticker and cologne selections?

    Just email me (lefulche@email.unc.edu) with your name and selections.

    What if my favorite historic figure isn't listed?

    There is a perk option where I will make you a custom cologne for any historical figure, as long as they lived before the 1900's so there's no issue with copyrights.

    -

    What comes with each cologne?

    RIGHT   2.66 oz. bottle of cologne (4" tall)-with scent designed specifically around that historic figure

    &

    LEFT  clear box, cotton cloth front, and stuffing :)

    LEFT  color pamphlet -with facts and scent description

    &

    RIGHT  two color stickers -one collage sticker and one sticker with the name of the historic figure, each made specifically for that person

     

    -

    Collage Art Sticker Sets For the Poets, Prophets, Warriors, and Queens

     

                                                             POETS

    Emily Dickenson- bird's nest/"hope is the thing with feathers"

    Walt Whitman- American weave/"blades of grass"

    Edgar Allan Poe- "The Bells" and "The Raven"

    Aristotle- Greek Inspiration

    William Shakespeare- Windowpane Poetry flows

    Hans Christian Anderson- Enchanted Ivy

     

                                                         WARRIORS

    Geronimo-Saguaro Cactus flowers

    Miyamoto Musashi-the grip of a Kabuki sword

    Temujin/Genghis Khan-horses*

    Napoleon Bonaparte-toupee'd fox and bicorne'd lion

        "I am sometimes a fox and sometimes a lion" - Napoleon Bonaparte

    Odysseus-fish scales

    Suleyman the Magnificent-prayer mats in the Suleymaniye Mosque

     

    *this is a section of a common domain painting from the 14th century depicting Mongol Cavalry; you can see the full image here- (http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/File:DiezAlbumsArmedRiders_I.jpg)

     

     

                                                         PROPHETS

    Gautama Buddha-the eternal knot

    Muhammad-light ray and roses

    Rama-blue and arrow

    Sitting Bull-South Dakota hills

    Moses-the waters

    John the Baptist-honey, locusts, wool and clouds

     

                                                           QUEENS


    Amina of Zaria- Discovery of Kola

    Marie Antoinette- Lavender wool

    Makoata/Pocahontas- the colors of the earth

    Makeda, Queen of Sheba- Camel caravan

    Cleopatra- Mother of the pearl bet- (http://news.discovery.com/history/ancient-egypt/cleopatra-pearl-cocktail.htm)

    Jeanne Du Arc- Fleur-de-lis of the day-long queen

    -

    Examples from the 24 Name Stickers

     

     -

    About Me

    I'm a college student at UNC Chapel Hill studying history and Arabic. I got the idea for EMBODY from a reading for a class on Islamic History.

    The book was called Memories of Muhammad. In a chapter about the Islamic Prophet Muhammad, the author mentioned how rosewater is a popular ingredient in deserts in Turkey, because many people view the rose as a symbol of the prophet Muhammad. So to consume the rose is to connect with the prophet, and in a way, is to embody the spirit of the prophet.

    I was fascinated by this concept, because I love history, and especially the idea of living history (Williamsburg, Old Salem, Jamestown, UNC...NC/VA is a great area to visit if you're a history geek :)

    Also, I love making things. I've learned a lot making this campaign.

     

    Why 5,000?

    Most of the contributions will cover the overhead for all the essential oils, the glass bottles, the perfumer’s alcohol, the stickers, the pamphlets, and the packaging materials. If the goal of 5 thousand is met, there will be enough funds after overhead so that I can prepare my next Indiegogo project idea, which I’m REALLY excited about.

    It’s a product called “Mobi” that redefines everyday meditation. I’ll be WWOOFing this summer, but I hope to bring “Mobi” to Indiegogo by the end of the year with your help :)

    Also,

    Here’s something to meditate on today if you need it:

    http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=AnrM4UjaQmY

     

     

     

    Credit

     --

    I filmed the whole video in the Forest Theatre and the picnic table area of Battle Park in Chapel Hill, NC.

    Picture Citation for Image at Beginning of Video:

     

    North Carolina Collection Photographic Archives, Wilson Library, University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill; Student Supply Store, U. of N.C., Chapel Hill; University of North Carolina at Chapel Hill; ca. 1937

    The Forest Theatre of The Carolina Playmakers, University of North Carolina Chapel Hill Published by Student Supply Store, U. of N.C. Chapel Hill Post Cards of Quality. - The Albertype Co., Brooklyn, N.Y.
    http://dc.lib.unc.edu/cdm/ref/collection/nc_post/id/2978

    ---

     Music:

    Circus Marcus - "Les crocodiles mangent aussi les bonshommes"

    ----

story:
CRITICAL. 

Hello! my name is Mars, and I’m hoping to raise money for a cause close to my heart and many others. I’ve created a hard pin series called Critical, which showcases dozens of different endangered or critically endangered animals that I’ve drawn up and hand chosen for this series as beautiful hard enamel pins. If this project is funded, I will be donating all profits to wildlife conservations and funds to help save these amazing animals. Please help me reach my goals and help make a difference! 

These pins are all priced at a discount! If I surpass my funding goal and am able to have more made, the extra pins will be sold at normal price of $10 per pin plus $4 shipping. 

-This is a Fixed funding campaign. Its all or nothing. Meaning, the rewards will only be earned if we'd reach the initial goal and the other stretch goals. If we don't reach the initial goal, all funds will be returned.

-Surveys will be sent after the campaign ends so you can select which pins youd like! 

-If funded, Pins will be put into production late september. Pins will take about a month to be made, and expected to be sent to me in October. Pins are expected to ship Late October/Early November 2019. 

-Funds from this campaign will be used to pay for pin production + shipping first, anything remaining will be donated to multiple wildlife conservations and funds. I will be working with https://twitter.com/DrWildlife to chose which to donate to. 

There are over 30 stretch goals to unlock! I will update this as we reach them!

Current pin lineup:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

This is my first time ever crowdfunding and I can only hope it will be a success! While I am not new to making enamel pins and have had multiple designs created already, this will be my first time working with this many pins. As we all know, when it comes to manufacturing pins there can be issues especially with an order this size. There is the possibility of delayed shipping dates, manufacturers error on a design, etc. I will be sure to update this campaign the moment I’m aware that anything might delay the process. I will keep all backers regularly updated!

story:
If you want to understand the secrets of the universe, think in terms of energy, frequency, and vibration.-Tesla 

The intention of this piece is a tribute to create awareness for suicide prevention. This is an conceptual image of a giant tear drop frozen in the position at the point it impacts water. 

The peak of the structure reaches 20′ tall by 42′ wide in diameter.The scale represents the amount of tears people left on earth shed when someone takes their own life. Fuze the drop with a snowflake creating dimensional angels to represent the unique individuality of each person. 

The octagon footprint creates a fungshui feeling.A chakra rainbow of stairs surround the center tower, representing the peaks and valleys of life as you enter the structure. Inside the portal entry is a chakra of color. 

Second story window seats can be climbed up on, to look out from a higher view. Musical frequencies played inside will all be of a vibration of the 432 or 528hz creating a vibrational healing chamber amplified with crystals. 

This structure is dedicated and inspired to the artist's little sister that took her life and will burn on Friday at 6am, 17 years to the day that she took her life at 17 years old. 

The goal is to create awareness that it's possible to heal yourself from depression using vibrations and musical frequencies. By interacting with frequencies of a higher vibration, our vibration is in turn elevated.


This project hasn't been granted, so support has come from the artist, the team, and the community. Generous donations have already been arriving, and we appreciate all the support to come.
For those of you heading up north for the big event, please come find us out in deep playa.

Love. Respect. Reflect.

story:
We sell shawls & scarves in order to provide shelter to disaster-struck villages in Nepal. The monsoon rains are coming, so its a race against time to provide temporary shelter. We are working with locals as well as the NGO Children and Youth First.

We buy directly from local shop owners in Kathmandu. The profits are given to Nepali groups who are working to clear the rubble in destroyed villages like Kalinjor.

All non-profit, all directly to those in need. Support Nepal with a shawl!

Supported organisations:

http://cyfnepal.org

http://www.lwhnepal.com/earthquake-aid/

http://www.wehelpnepal.org


Project banner by artist Wolfe Girardin

story:
About the Project

COR is a large-scale, interactive art installation that the Barcelona Burning Man community is aiming to bring to Nowhere 2014, a Burning Man regional event taking place from the 8th to 13th of July in the Monegros region of Spain. In the spirit of the CORE (Circle of Regional Effigies) projects for Burning Man, this piece will serve to represent Catalonia at the international gathering.

We have been working with local artists, designers, techies, and creators to produce this installation. Our goal is to create something that captures the intersection of Burning Man culture with the spirit of Catalonia, bringing both of these cultures together and sharing them with more people through Nowhere and the neighbouring community where the festival is held. After the event, the piece will be installed in a public space in the Monegros region, to be shared with the broader local community.

The full title of the piece is "COR Pur Trencat Bategant", meaning “Pure Broken Beating Heart” in Catalan. 

The design is based on the concept of deconstruction, which challenges the traditional assumption of certainty, identity and truth. While to deconstruct can be a frightful process if one resists it, it can also bring us closer to our very essence. Thus the sanctuary-like space filled with reassuring heart beats in the interior of the installation. Once one surrenders to the process, they are on their way to once again reconstruct, re-create, play, and evolve.

The video below, produced by team member Aleix, beautifully illustrates the concept behind the piece as well as providing glimpses of the Nowhere environment that will surround it.


One of the things that makes Burning Man so different from most festivals is the art; art that is not limited by the constraints of a museum, but instead is made for an outdoor space. This allows us to create art that can be larger than a building; art that evokes a different experience from day to night, or with wind or rain; art that can be touched; art that interacts with its users and challenges their understanding of reality; art that brings people together both to create it, and to experience it in interesting and unexpected ways once it's complete.

We are excited to create and share such an installation on this scale here in Europe.  In the daytime, the sheer size of it will create shade from the hot sun. People will be able to spend time inside and write on the interior walls. At night, the piece will come alive with the sound of a heartbeat and illumination. There will be touch points and other interactive elements that enable participants to alter the heartbeat.

We invite you to help make this project a reality.

We have a small group of dedicated volunteers and have some funds raised, but we'll need more of both to bring this project to life.


What We Need

To create a piece of this scale with interactive technology, we need a total of 7000€. That will pay for:

  • Building materials - this is the bulk of our costs. Includes purchasing and cutting the wood for the structure, hardware (bolts & screws) to assemble it, and paint.
  • Technology needed for interactive elements such as microcontrollers, LED strips, sensors and speakers.
  • Transportation to get the materials to the site, and then to transport the piece (partially disassembled) to its final home in a neighbouring community in the Monegros region.

With the precision drafting software used for the design, we have created a very precise calculation of the cost of materials. The modular design allows us to construct it on site at Nowhere without needing a warehouse space here in Barcelona. Once we have completed our fundraising in May, we will purchase the materials to construct the piece on site.

We have already raised the amount needed to create the interactive technology for the installation, through donations from project volunteers as well as an art grant from Nowhere.  We have a team of talented makers and engineers who have started working on developing the interactive sound and light elements.  The funds we have raised so far will enable them to work on the technology while our fundraising campaign is still going on.

Now we need to raise funds for the materials to build the structure.

We are planning several local fundraisers in addition to the online fundraising that will take place over the next month and a half to cover the cost of materials.  (Join our mailing list to learn about upcoming events if you're in or near Barcelona.)  We're also looking into some ways to scale down the piece or other ways to cut costs if we are unable to raise the full 7000€.  We are confident that with 3900€, we can at least create a smaller version of the installation, but we would love your help to reach our 7000€  goal so we can realize the project in its full glory!


What You Get

We are offering several perks to thank you for your contribution to the project:

  • We will love you forever if you donate at least 5€ ! Redeem your group hug at a local COR event or at Nowhere.

  • Contributors of 10€ or more will get a color sticker with the COR logo.

  • In addition to the color sticker, contributors of 20€ or more will have their name engraved on a plaque that will be placed on the installation. You will literally become a part of the piece !

  • In addition to the color sticker and your name on the piece, contributors of 50€ will receive a laser cut pendant with the project logo, made with love and recycled wood by team member Ugo Riboni. The pendant diameter is 46mm.

    Note: we can only mail stickers and pendants within Europe. If you are going to Nowhere, please help us save postage by picking it up on site. Items that are not distributed at nowhere will be mailed in late July or early August.

  • In addition to the perks above, contributors of 100€ will receive a private tour of the piece at Nowhere with the designers on hand to show you exactly what went into the concept and design.

  • In addition to the perks above, the first four contributors of 250€ will receive one Tier-1 ticket to the BBB: the Barcelona Burning Bash Weekend, on May 9-11. This is Barcelona's regional Burning Man event, a weekend for the burner community to come together to play, share our talents, and inspire each other.  The event is likely to sell out, and the Tier 1 tickets provide the nicest sleeping quarters available. These tickets normally sell for 97€ each. 

    Note: this event takes place before the end of the campaign, and is only available through May 5 - we will contact you to make arrangements so you can attend or gift the ticket to someone else.

  • In addition to the perks above (sticker, pendant, name, tour, and BBB ticket), the first contributor to donate 500€ will receive a one-of-a-kind laser-cut wooden scale model of the piece, which has working lights and interactivity similar to what the final installation will have. This model - called a maqueta - is now touring different events to show people the design.

    Note: due to its size, 100x70cm, we cannot cover the shipping costs of the maqueta. It would need to be picked up locally in the Barcelona area, or at Nowhere, or we could discuss how to ship it to you at your expense.


The Impact

While we have put a lot of effort into designing a meaningful, interactive installation for Nowhere, our intention for this project has always been for more than those who will be able to interact with the piece directly.  Though we are far away from Burning Man, which takes place once a year in the desert of Nevada, USA, we are inspired by it as more of a movement and culture that is infused into our daily lives.  This is something that we hope will inspire others by engaging with local community members throughout the project.

We invite you to volunteer if you'd like to get involved in the project, and we are planning fundraisers that will include workshops teaching new skills to people.  We also want to share the piece itself with the community in the Monegros region of Spain where the festival is held. As part of the Growing Nowhere project, we are working with local leaders to have it placed permanently in a nearby town after the festival is over for the community to experience.

Other Ways You Can Help

Aside from contributing to this fundraiser, there are several other ways you can get involved:

Spread the word:

  • Please share this campaign with your social media and email networks.  You can find us on Facebook
  • Tell your friends and family in person, especially those who don’t spend much time on social media

Volunteer:

We will need people on site at Nowhere to help with the build, translators to help us with materials (English to Spanish, English to Catalan), and other tasks. See our volunteer spreadsheet or contact us at volunteers@burn.cat to learn more about ways to get involved.


Thank you for reading!!  We hope to see your smiling face at an upcoming event.

<3, 

The COR Project Team

We have been working with local artists, designers, techies, and creators to produce this installation. Our goal is to create something that captures the intersection of Burning Man culture with the spirit of Catalonia, bringing both of these cultures together and sharing them with more people through Nowhere and the neighbouring community where the festival is held. After the event, the piece will be installed in a public space in the Monegros region, to be shared with the broader local community.The full title of the piece is "COR Pur Trencat Bategant", meaning “Pure Broken Beating Heart” in Catalan. The design is based on the concept of deconstruction, which challenges the traditional assumption of certainty, identity and truth. While to deconstruct can be a frightful process if one resists it, it can also bring us closer to our very essence. Thus the sanctuary-like space filled with reassuring heart beats in the interior of the installation. Once one surrenders to the process, they are on their way to once again reconstruct, re-create, play, and evolve.The video below, produced by team member Aleix, beautifully illustrates the concept behind the piece as well as providing glimpses of the Nowhere environment that will surround it.One of the things that makes Burning Man so different from most festivals is the art; art that is not limited by the constraints of a museum, but instead is made for an outdoor space. This allows us to create art that can be larger than a building; art that evokes a different experience from day to night, or with wind or rain; art that can be touched; art that interacts with its users and challenges their understanding of reality; art that brings people together both to create it, and to experience it in interesting and unexpected ways once it's complete.
We are excited to create and share such an installation on this scale here in Europe.  In the daytime, the sheer size of it will create shade from the hot sun. People will be able to spend time inside and write on the interior walls. At night, the piece will come alive with the sound of a heartbeat and illumination. There will be touch points and other interactive elements that enable participants to alter the heartbeat.
We invite you to help make this project a reality.
We have a small group of dedicated volunteers and have some funds raised, but we'll need more of both to bring this project to life.What We NeedTo create a piece of this scale with interactive technology, we need a total of 7000€. That will pay for:
Building materials - this is the bulk of our costs. Includes purchasing and cutting the wood for the structure, hardware (bolts & screws) to assemble it, and paint.

Technology needed for interactive elements such as microcontrollers, LED strips, sensors and speakers.
Transportation to get the materials to the site, and then to transport the piece (partially disassembled) to its final home in a neighbouring community in the Monegros region.


With the precision drafting software used for the design, we have created a very precise calculation of the cost of materials. The modular design allows us to construct it on site at Nowhere without needing a warehouse space here in Barcelona. Once we have completed our fundraising in May, we will purchase the materials to construct the piece on site.We have already raised the amount needed to create the interactive technology for the installation, through donations from project volunteers as well as an art grant from Nowhere.  We have a team of talented makers and engineers who have started working on developing the interactive sound and light elements.  The funds we have raised so far will enable them to work on the technology while our fundraising campaign is still going on.Now we need to raise funds for the materials to build the structure.We are planning several local fundraisers in addition to the online fundraising that will take place over the next month and a half to cover the cost of materials.  (Join our mailing list to learn about upcoming events if you're in or near Barcelona.)  We're also looking into some ways to scale down the piece or other ways to cut costs if we are unable to raise the full 7000€.  We are confident that with 3900€, we can at least create a smaller version of the installation, but we would love your help to reach our 7000€  goal so we can realize the project in its full glory!What You GetWe are offering several perks to thank you for your contribution to the project:
We will love you forever if you donate at least 5€ ! Redeem your group hug at a local COR event or at Nowhere.

Contributors of 10€ or more will get a color sticker with the COR logo.

In addition to the color sticker, contributors of 20€ or more will have their name engraved on a plaque that will be placed on the installation. You will literally become a part of the piece !
In addition to the color sticker and your name on the piece, contributors of 50€ will receive a laser cut pendant with the project logo, made with love and recycled wood by team member Ugo Riboni. The pendant diameter is 46mm.



Note: we can only mail stickers and pendants within Europe. If you are going to Nowhere, please help us save postage by picking it up on site. Items that are not distributed at nowhere will be mailed in late July or early August. 
In addition to the perks above, contributors of 100€ will receive a private tour of the piece at Nowhere with the designers on hand to show you exactly what went into the concept and design.

In addition to the perks above, the first four contributors of 250€ will receive one Tier-1 ticket to the BBB: the Barcelona Burning Bash Weekend, on May 9-11. This is Barcelona's regional Burning Man event, a weekend for the burner community to come together to play, share our talents, and inspire each other.  The event is likely to sell out, and the Tier 1 tickets provide the nicest sleeping quarters available. These tickets normally sell for 97€ each. 


Note: this event takes place before the end of the campaign, and is only available through May 5 - we will contact you to make arrangements so you can attend or gift the ticket to someone else.


In addition to the perks above (sticker, pendant, name, tour, and BBB ticket), the first contributor to donate 500€ will receive a one-of-a-kind laser-cut wooden scale model of the piece, which has working lights and interactivity similar to what the final installation will have. This model - called a maqueta - is now touring different events to show people the design. 


Note: due to its size, 100x70cm, we cannot cover the shipping costs of the maqueta. It would need to be picked up locally in the Barcelona area, or at Nowhere, or we could discuss how to ship it to you at your expense.

The ImpactWhile we have put a lot of effort into designing a meaningful, interactive installation for Nowhere, our intention for this project has always been for more than those who will be able to interact with the piece directly.  Though we are far away from Burning Man, which takes place once a year in the desert of Nevada, USA, we are inspired by it as more of a movement and culture that is infused into our daily lives.  This is something that we hope will inspire others by engaging with local community members throughout the project. We invite you to volunteer if you'd like to get involved in the project, and we are planning fundraisers that will include workshops teaching new skills to people.  We also want to share the piece itself with the community in the Monegros region of Spain where the festival is held. As part of the Growing Nowhere project, we are working with local leaders to have it placed permanently in a nearby town after the festival is over for the community to experience.Other Ways You Can HelpAside from contributing to this fundraiser, there are several other ways you can get involved:Spread the word:

Please share this campaign with your social media and email networks.  You can find us on Facebook


Tell your friends and family in person, especially those who don’t spend much time on social media

Volunteer:We will need people on site at Nowhere to help with the build, translators to help us with materials (English to Spanish, English to Catalan), and other tasks. See our volunteer spreadsheet or contact us at volunteers@burn.cat to learn more about ways to get involved.Thank you for reading!!  We hope to see your smiling face at an upcoming event.<3, The COR Project Team

story:
Aye Inspired is guerilla art exhibition in  Scotland inspired by the Scottish independence campaign.

Over 30 artists have submitted artwork including fine art, graphic art, sculptures and mixed media, all inspired by the drive to make Scotland an independent country.

Initially Aye Inspired was going to exhibit in Aberdeen and we already have an amazing city centre venue there but so many people have expressed a wish to see the exhibition travel further afield in Scotland, including our artists who come from all over the country (and abroad!), that we need funding to make this a reality.


What We Need

Due to Aye Inspired being a partisan exhibition for the yes campaign we have found it impossible to get council run free gallery space. We are political and we refuse to budge from our ethos of supporting the goal of independence for Scotland, so we haven't compromised or diluted our message in the drive to get people to host us. We want to spread the message and engage in the national conversation as artists for yes. This does mean that we may have to rent gallery space in towns that we want to go to. We'll also need travel costs to get the exhibition to wherever we go. This will mean hiring a large van to transport the exhibits and petrol costs. We also want to publicise the event wherever we go, so we will need printing costs to be covered for posters, flyers and our brochure. If at the end of our exhibition we have any surplus we will donate to other yes campaigns who are struggling for funding to help them get their message out.


In short, the more funding we get, the more places we can take Aye Inspired before September the 18th.


What You Get

ALL contributors will have their name (unless they wish to remain anonymous) on a piece of art exhibited in the exhibition as a thank you regardless of the size of their donation. Those who donate above certain amounts will get a range of perks if they choose to take them, including invites to our launch and prints of certain art works.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute financially but that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Spread the word about Aye Inspired amongst your tweeps and your facebook friends. Send them this link.

And if you are an artist who thinks you can contribute then get in touch via the blog contact form here at Aye Inspired

We also need venues all over Scotland. Do you run a gallery or a run a venue that hosts art and want Aye Inspired to come to town, then please get in touch. You'd be making a huge difference to the scale of our event. And we'd love you forever. Again get in touch via the blog contact form here at Aye Inspired


Thank you everyone.See you in the Summer of Yes!

story:
BUY THE BOOK NOW

Summary

We know the Easter story, don't we? But when we're reading it, what do we picture? Do we really imagine it?

Like the difference between hearing and listening,
do we really see it?

Reflecting on the tragedy of the Easter story has the power to reorient our lives. We want to fund this project, because we want more books like this that bring over-familiar or misunderstood stories back to vivid reality. 

We believe good illustration can give new life to tired stories.

What We Need & What You Get

When we fund this campaign, our new publishing collective, Fish Coin Press can print “New Stations of the Cross” in time for Easter. You essentially get to pre-order the book to guarantee a copy of the limited edition is yours. 

The book has 32 fully illustrated pages alongside the story of Jesus’ final hours. Broken up into 13 segments, it mirrors the the Stations of the Cross, but is reimagined to follow the Gospel of Mark, starting right before Jesus' arrest and culminating with the empty tomb. The images strive for tastefulness, yet brutal historicity.

Our minimum goal of $1200 USD makes possible collector's quality production—lush paper and the beautiful Risograph printmaking process (new to Riso? watch this!). The money will go mainly towards printing costs and funding the artists involved in this campaign.

Additionally, we have options for bulk quantities just in case anybody wants to use these in a ministry or give them to friends. (Speaking of which, let us know if you're interested in some digital assets for your ministry! We got some!)

The Impact

Last year, we launched Fish Coin Press with the release of a series of mini-comics based on parables by Jesus. And in the coming months, we have several other projects planned.

Depending on how successful the campaign becomes, some money will be reserved for future Bible adaptations coming from Fish Coin Press. Ultimately your contributions go toward our dream to make reading biblical literature a visual experience.

Risks & Challenges

This is a tight schedule. We have to send files to the printer by March 22 to get them back in time to ship out for delivery the week of Easter. Artwork will certainly be ready, but there is a narrow print production window to ensure timely delivery. We can afford no delays.

Additionally, if we don't hit out minimum goal, funding is cancelled and refunded to everyone. We’ll be forced to order a smaller quantity, sacrifice some printing materials and recoup orders starting March 22.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand not everyone can contribute financially as much as they would like, but we invite anyone who believes in this work to help spread the word. Make some noise! Be our ambassadors!

  • Join our email list.
  • Follow us on Instagram, Facebook and Twitter.
  • Use the tools here on Indiegogo to post our campaign around.

Share this with your friends. Share it with family. Share it with ministry leaders who can share it with their communities.

And do it now, because we have a small window to make this happen!

THANK YOU THANK YOU THANK YOU!

story:
CONCEPT

With the hyper-globalization felt in every corner of the world, a new generation of artists have emerged, eager to express the contemporaneity they have experienced in their everyday lives. Contemporary Dissonance is an exhibition like that of an experimental laboratory and artist playground, inviting young and emerging artists to showcase their own understanding of contemporaneity. No longer do these artists see histories of art and narratives as just intersecting and crossing over, but rather as a fluid and dynamic exchange that almost erases all sense of established identities and locales. They question the “East/West” dichotomy but moreover, they question the establishment of multiple narratives and histories: how do you separate one cultural identity from the other when the world you have experienced is fluid and dynamic?

The four artists in this exhibition, Katusha Jin, Eric Lau, Yvonne Kwok, Jessica Zheng, all from different backgrounds and upbringings, question the very narrative of art and experience in their own works. Through the different media of painting, fashion and photography, there seems to be this common thread that links these artists together -- a rejection of pre-existing labels and identities while also a sense of uneasiness as they fail to find an identity they can associate with. The result is an exhibition of works from these artists that seem to voice a contemporary dissonance to the currently established narratives and identities.  

HISTORICAL EXPLANATION

Under the increasing awareness of the interconnectivity and globalization of the 21st century, art historians have begun to critically examine our much traditional and out of date view on the history of art. No longer are they adopting the Euro-American centric model that delineates a singular narrative of art history, which perhaps excluded and ignored much of the rest of the world. Scholars are now identifying that there exists and have existed multiple narratives that lie in conjunction with the Euro-American model.

Arts coming from the region outside of Euro-America were contextualized and decontextualized into a western narrative. Countries such as China were perceived in a strictly “East/West” dichotomy that emphasized the West’s modernity and the East’ s tradition. Chinese art, especially the arts coming from mainland, were seen as stuck in the past and even China ‘s modern artists were perceived as derivatives of their western counterparts. Scholarship nowadays, have given light to the histories and narratives of each region and culture while highlighting the equally modern and contemporary efforts of artists around the world. No longer do we see China ‘s modern movement as a derivative of the Euro-American one, which came at a much later time than the latter.

 

TEAM

Katusha Jin

Katusha Jin is a New York based filmmaker, painter, and music designer from the U.K. She is a graduate from NYU Tisch, and is a co-founder of Art Avenue. During the past few years she has worked with a variety of artists in many parts of the world, including Hong Kong, Moscow, Beijing, Los Angeles, and New York. Her goal now is to continue to discover and share international stories through collaborations with artists around the globe.

 

Kadi Tsang

Kadi Tsang is a graduate from NYU Tisch and a co-founder of Art Avenue. She is a trilingual artist with interests in both Arts and Sciences, global development and conflicts of human nature. Kadi has worked on various types of live and motion picture productions, and has experience working in different departments.  Being open-minded and taking the initiative on each of her projects, she devotes herself to creating an inspirational world that facilitates cultural exchange.

 

Cindy Qi

Cindy Xingyi Qi is a second-year art history master student at the Institute of Fine Arts, NYU. She is interested in the development of Chinese art since the late 20th century and the narratives that are used to systematize and retrace this emergence. As an independent curator , she wishes to highlight the multi-faceted identities of emerging and up-and-coming artists today and to encourage a broader and more encompassing idea of identity in the arts.

 

PROGRAMMING

1. Artist Exhibition

    4 International artists will showcase their work focusing on global cultural identities

2. Contemporary Dissonance short documentary

   Curator, Artists, and Academics will discuss cultural identity and its relevance to the theme of Contemporary Dissonance in society today.

 

ARTISTS

Eric Lau

Eric is a multi-disciplined Creative Director & Art Director based in New York and raised in Hong Kong. He was first hooked with photography after an advertising photo shoot, and studied studio photography while pursuing communication design.

His photographs have garnered around 50K followers on Instagram; featured in the NY Times, TimeOut New York, PSFK, South China Morning Post, Perspective Magazine,  held numerous sharing about his anti-gear approach for photography, and been shown in 14 exhibitions in NYC, HK, and Taipei.

 

Katusha Jin

Katusha is a New York-based filmmaker, painter, and music designer from the U.K. Having participated in her first New York art exhibition in 2018, she now focuses on exploring the cultural identity of international artists.

Fascinated and inspired by her past collaborations with international artists, Katusha has chosen these culturally diverse artists as the subject of her work. Through art films and paintings, she documents her inspirations gathered from working with these artists and understanding their process of artistic creation and expression.

 

Yvonne Kwok

Yvonne is a Hong Kong born, New York City based freelance visual artist. She aims to connect martial arts and visual arts through her artwork as she has discovered many similarities and connections between the two art forms.

Yvonne Kwok grew up practicing Chinese calligraphy and received her BFA at Hunter College where she discovered her passion in Western painting. With her multicultural background and as a martial artist specialized in traditional Taekwondo and Practical Wing Chun, her works often merge Eastern and Western aesthetics and philosophies.

 

Jessica Zheng

Jessica is an Art and Design graduate from the University of Leeds, UK. She currently lives and works in London as an image maker and designer.  Jessica has exhibited across the UK, including OVADA and Royal Photographic Society

Jessica Zheng has worked on various projects within the Art and Design discipline. Her subjects of interests survey the interaction between fashion and art to the practical aspect. Along with her bilingual background, her oil paintings have been strongly influenced by the mix of cultures to showcase the reinterpretation of images.

 

PRODUCTION TEAM

Myka Cue

Myka Cue is an actor, producer, and director originally from the Philippines. Since moving to New York to pursue an undergraduate degree at NYU, Myka has appeared in numerous theatre productions including The Crucible (Mary Warren), Antigone (Ismene), Helene Cixous' Portrait of Dora (Dora), among others. As a producer, Myka has spearheaded the production of "After Orlando ", an international theatre action in response to the Pulse Orlando shooting, "Uncharted", a musical theatre cabaret and the "2018 Gallatin Arts Festival", a week-long interdisciplinary festival featuring works in the visual and performing arts. Myka is always seeking for opportunities to stage new works, hone her craft and collaborate with individuals who share a similar passion for storytelling.

Roza Melkumyan

Roza Melkumyan is a recent graduate of NYU s Gallatin School of Individualized Study. During her time at college, Roza created her own concentration entitled “Understanding & Misunderstanding through Narrative.” She preoccupied herself with the study of perspective: how we can exercise it when interacting with people of different cultures and backgrounds, how we can step out of our own ethnocentric mindsets, what sort of connections we can make with others, and how one comes to  “ other ” a member of a different culture. She especially focused on the power of empathy -- exercised through film, literature, and theatre -- and how this skill could in turn contribute to our understanding of different cultural perspectives.

 

VENUE & DURATION

Venue: Cafe on Broadway

Duration:  4 weeks

Exhibition Month: March

 

PERKS

Sponsor placements per request

story:
Short Summary

Train of Thought is a 20-stop, creative journey from Victoria to Halifax this spring. We will travel along our country’s train routes, both present and past, and collaborate and conspire with growing numbers of artists, communities and fellow travelers along the way.

Train of Thought will involve workshops, performances, feasts, symposia, constant art-making and more. Along the journey we will collect and share stories, uncover buried histories and explore imagined landscapes of the land where we live: as it might have been, as it is, as it could be. 

This traveling collaboration will have a focus on bringing together First Nations and settler/immigrant artists and communities across Canada.

Jumblies Theatre has raised funds to bring a team of core traveling artists - emerging and established - on this journey. However, we also have many colleagues who would love to travel on our Train of Thought and unfortunately our current funds can't extend to support them all. 

Many of our partners who are trying to fund or partially fund their trips are professional artists who for whom a train ticket, accommodation and other travel expenses are not possible without your help. 

Jumblies mandate is that "Everyone is Welcome!": Help us make that possible for Train of Thought! 

What We Need & What You Get

    • Taking a single person coast-to-coast costs about $5000, but with some travelers aiming to partially-fund the trip and many interested in traveling with us for only parts of the journey this campaign could raise enough to support 10+ artists and community leaders.

    • Accordingly, if we don't reach our goal the money we do raise will still be vital in supporting a smaller number of travelers.

    • Also, check out our perks! Most of them include original creations by Jumblies artists. Whatever gift you receive, it will be beautiful and lovingly crafted.

The Impact

    • Train of Thought will be the latest project in Jumblies' 15-year history of productions which combine high-calibre art with radical inclusion and meaningful social results. 

    • Train of Thought will bring together artists, leaders and community members to create alliances across barriers of both distance and difference.

    • We have a focus on uncovering the hidden histories of Canada, particularly those of groups who don't always get to share their stories.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not everyone is able to donate, but just spreading the word is amazing help, so...

  • Post this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr, etc. and help us spread the word about Train of Thought.
  • Tell your friends and family, coworkers and strangers about Train of Thought. 
  • And if you're free in May and June come to one of our Train of Thought events in 9 provinces (sorry Newfoundland and other northern realms and nations - next time we hope!) and take part! Details of where we will be stopping are on our website: trainofthought.co


We are grateful to Train of Thought's supporters, which includes The J.W. McConnell Family Foundation, Ontario Trillium Foundation, Canada Council for the Arts, Ontario Arts Council, Toronto Arts Council, InSpirit Foundation and VIA Rail.

story:
Hello,

I’m Travis Bundy, creator and illustrator of the comics “Gods of the new Empire” and “Jeff”... and I'm here to tell you about my newest project “Billy Love Nibbles”.

It’s a graphic novel about a simple-minded young man (Billy) who lives in a dilapidated part of the city with his Momma. His father left when Billy was very young, and now  they struggle day to day just to get by. But just because they’re poor, doesn’t mean that momma isn’t going to raise Billy right. He is imbued with the ideas of treating all things smaller  than himself with gentleness and compassion and , most importantly, if you make a mistake you should apologize and make it right. Ideas like that seem unrealistic when you’re surrounded by crime, drugs and junkies all day. Billy’s world is a scary and desperate place.

That is until fate drops in and delivers a cold and hungry pug puppy into their lives. Nibbles changes everything, and now Billy doesn’t feel so alone and the world around them isn’t so bleak.

But things can change fast in the city… one day a local drug dealer, while running from a rival gang, accidentally hits Nibbles with his car. Billy’s world shatters around him and he and momma have no idea where to get the money to fix it. Billy was always taught to make things right if you make a mistake, so he decides to ask the dealer (Bump) to do the same. But when he confronts Bump, it begins a chain reaction of violent encounters that could threaten not only Billy’s life, but the lives of those around him.

But Billy knows no fear and he is unrelenting in his quest to bring his little friend back home to him. He only knows “Billy Love Nibbles” and will stop at nothing to make things right.

Now this is a very personal project for me. I’m one of those weirdos you hear about who is never going to have children but will always have lots of animals. They’re like my kids and I wanted to tell a story about how I’d do anything, in any circumstance, to protect them. As long as we’re being honest here, I don’t mind telling you that I had a very difficult time writing and illustrating the pages where Nibbles is hurt or being hit by the car. They filled me with so much dread that I avoided drawing them for months. That’s how powerful this book is for me. Even looking back on them now, my heart stops just a little bit. But it’s an essential component of the story that needs to be told… and a fear that I felt I must face in order to do the story justice.

When I was working on my last book  “Jeff”,  I was trying my hand at comedy. It was a huge departure from the standard action comic books I had grown up making. Now I’m embarking on another journey, but this time into tragedy. And, based on my own reactions in actually making the book, I think I’ve achieved my goal.

But now is where you guys come in. I’ve started this campaign to raise the $2500 that will cover the printing costs for “Billy Love Nibbles”. Why so little, you ask? It’s because the book is done. It’s good to go. I don’t need to pay artists or colorists or letterers. I don’t need money to market it because it will be under the banner of Creator’s Edge Press, the small press company that I co-own. We will take it to conventions and pitch it to stores though the company channels. The only thing I need assistance with is the actual printing of the book. This is for a 500 copy run and we hope that, if all copies sell, that we’ll have more than enough for a second printing. The reason for this is simple: I’m not taking any money from sales of this book. This book is my gift to Creator’s Edge, and the other comics we will produce in the future. This book is a stepping stone to funding more interesting and original comics. To help people who have a great book and no means to get it printed and out to a bigger audience. That’s my vision of Creator’s Edge Press and this is the only way I feel that I can help .

Also, a percentage of every book sold will be donated to the ASPCA and the Humane Society. I care deeply about helping animals and if my art can get them some much needed funding, then I’m more than willing to do it.

But you definitely won’t be getting nothing but the satisfaction of helping indie comics and animals for your money… we’ve got some great perks lined up too.

At the $5 level, you get a digital copy of the book.

At the $15 level, you get a digital copy of the book and a hand drawn sketch card from me (any character you want – or I can think of something).

At the $25 level, you get a physical copy of the book, as well as the last 2 perks.

At the $50 level, you get the digital copy, the physical copy PLUS a 9x12 hand drawn piece (any character you want or I can draw something from the book).

At the $100 level, you get the digital copy, the physical copy PLUS an 11x17 hand drawn piece (again, any character you want or I can draw something from the book).

At the $150 level, you get all of that, but with any one page of interior art from the actual book (page requests will be on a first come, first served basis).

And finally, at the $250 level, you get a digital copy, a physical copy, an 11x17 piece of original art and ANY TWO pages of interior art from the book. PLUS… I’ll draw you into my next project and send you a copy of that book as well when it is produced.

**NOTE: for all perks claimed by people outside of the United States, you must provide me with adequate international shipping for all books and original art. These perks are only figured with postage for the continental US.**

I’m hoping that these are incentive enough to meet our goal… But, if we go over, ALL proceeds above the $2500 mark will be donated directly to the ASPCA and the Humane Society.

Sound good? Well, let’s get this book funded!

Thanks, everyone!

story:
What is Damanhur?  


Damanhur is a Federation of spiritual eco-communities, dedicated to diversity, action, solidarity, creating a joyful way of living together, and reawakening the divine spark of humanity. Nestled in the Alpine foothills in northern Italy between Turin and Aosta, it is a truly magical place. Click here to read more about What is Damanhur. 


What is the Open Temple?   

The Open Temple is a sacred space in Damanhur dedicated to freedom and openness, being open to different spiritual paths and philosophies. It is open to the sky and elements as a symbol of this openness of spirit. The Temple is available for individuals and groups who visit Damanhur from all over the world to express their unique connection with the sacred, in joy and harmonious union between humanity and divinity. 

The Open Temple is located on a very special energy point on the planet where four Synchronic Lines meet, so positive thoughts and actions resonate into the world. 



The project details

The Open Temple is located in the main center of Damanhur which is known as the Capital of Damjl. Everyone who visits Damanhur ascends on the Path of Hope entering into the Open Temple where the sky is the ceiling and the sun, moon and stars are the natural lighting. This sacred space was created by the citizens of Damanhur, who value collective art-making and expression as a way to bring everyone in the community together and accelerate our evolution. 

The objective of this project is to restore the floor of the Open Temple, which is the first part of a three-part project: floor, statues and columns. At the moment only the first two steps of seven have been completed, therefore, we just need your help to complete five more. They will be resurfaced using a technique known as terrazzo which makes it possible to use the area all year round despite weather conditions such as ice and snow.

As shown below, each step will be enhanced with circular spiral patterns as a symbol of life. A complex series of blue and white lines creating a walking meditation labyrinth will guide the pathway for spiritual exercises involving rhythmic steps and movements. The central mosaic will be created using an artistic technique with an aggregate of chips from red granite, carrara white and black marble. The predominant color will be red, like the original columns and terracotta sculptures. The spiral pattern in the center of each step is a recurring theme throughout the Open Temple.




Click here to read about What happens in the Open Temple.


What We Need

Funds raised will be used in the following ways...

  • Materials
  • Construction work
  • Indiegogo payments and fees
  • Administration expenses  What you get
  • One of the following gift options...
  • Our infinite gratitude for your participation 
  • Featured gift- Dinner with the artist and concert in the Open Temple
  • Magnet with an image of the Open Temple
  • Synchronic Lines - e-book
  • Stories of an Alchemist - book
  • The Book of Synchronicity - book
  • Reconnect with the plant world
  •  Power Shield  Pentacle
  •  Limited edition silver Credito  
  • Selfic painting print on a scarf
  •  Special dreaming experience in the Open Temple 


How you can support

  • Offer a donation
  • Share this campaign through your social networks, clicking on the Facebook, Twitter, etc. icons to the left of the video
  • Let the world know that you contributed to this campaign and encourage others to do the same! It’s very easy, use #dhopentemple
  • Forward this to your friends, sharing enthusiasm about this project

The Open Temple renovation will flourish not only with monetary contributions, but also through the energy of those who join us on this journey and send positive thoughts for its success.  

Thank you so much for your support!

                           

                                                             

Filming the video for the Open Temple Project was a lot of fun the two images below are a glimpse into our joy process.


When the Open Temple renovations are complete the image below illustruates how it will look.
