story:
Short Summary

FIRE IN THE BIRDBATH
A book of photography and poetry

I’m Peter (Mudman) Kinney, and I’m an artist, photographer and poet. When I’m not traveling to the Utah desert and other places to create art inspired by the land, I make photographs of the birdbath in my backyard in Pennsauken, New Jersey – improvising close-up tableaux out of water, flowers, berries, found objects and more.

Fire in the Birdbath will be a beautiful art-quality book showing a series of these photographs, following the birdbath through a one-year seasonal cycle. For this book, some of the birdbath images contain objects that are human throwaways, and the resulting images point to issues of nature and sustainability vs. our disposable culture. I’ve invited fifteen poets to join me in writing poems about the images that speak to them. Both the poems and the images are poignant, powerful, visually rich, filled with humor and surprise .

Fire in the Birdbath will be printed in a limited first edition as a 9 x 12” softbound book on high-quality photographic paper. It will include 84 full color images and 49 poems, making a book of 132 pages. We plan to make it available by December 15, 2015, in time for gift giving, if you wish.

Our fundraising goal is $7,000, to print 125 copies, a great and discounted price from a superb printer.  Cost roughly $30 per book for 125, plus roughly $10 shipping, and about $10 donation per book to Brigid's House. So for $50 you get a signed book shipped to you plus a donation.

It is not my goal to earn money from this book, but to cover expenses, and give something to Brigid's House. We hope you will want to be part of this effort to bring into being a gift to the art community,  a book that will be a wonderful and spiritual creation. And we’re offering some great perks to go with your contribution, including the book itself!

Hearty thanks for your support,
Peter


More about Fire in the Birdbath:

The poets include: Celeste Bonfanti, Michelle Caporale, Anne Carroll, Joyce Chan, Hara, Sue Hitchcock, Walt Howat, Peter (Mudman) Kinney, Cassie MacDonald, Joe McCullough, vox parvis, Miriam Seidel, Kim Stafford, B J Swartz, Rocky Wilson, and Dave Worrell.

The book will include an introduction by Lily Yeh, the noted community-based artist, creator of the Village of Arts and Humanities in North Philadelphia, and subject of the 2014 documentary The Barefoot Artist.


More about me and other projects I’ve done:

I’ve had many shows of my artwork using mud, clay, pigment and paint, bones, shells and more, at galleries and museums in Pennsylvania and New Jersey, and my work is in many private collections.

I have published four art books before now: Earth, Moon, and Sun (2008), and Sand and Sky (2010), including images of my art and related writing; and two previous Birdbath books:
Meet Me at the Birdbath (2012) and Searching for the Blue Nugget (2013).

All of these books featured a profusion of full-color photographs and poetry. I feel Fire in the Birdbath builds on the knowledge I’ve gained from the earlier books, and may be the best yet. This is the first time I’ve asked for donations to print my books.  This book is much larger, more ambitious, and more expensive to produce with high quality images.

A portion of our fundraising goal will go to Brigid’s House, in gratitude for the creative community that has been built and sustained there.  Brigid's House, the home of the Birdbath writers, is a place for writing, healing and hospitality in Camden, New Jersey.  Since 2008, the House has hosted readings, workshops, poetry mural projects and whatever our co-conspirators dream up!  A portion of your gift will help ensure that Brigid's House may continue to offer creative sanctuary in a wounded city.  To find out more, go to www.brigidshousecamden.blogspot.com.

We hope you will want to be part of this effort to bring into being a gift to the art community,  a book that will be a wonderful and spiritual creation. And we’re offering some great perks to go with your contribution, including the book itself! Hearty thanks for your support,PeterMore about Fire in the Birdbath:The poets include: Celeste Bonfanti, Michelle Caporale, Anne Carroll, Joyce Chan, Hara, Sue Hitchcock, Walt Howat, Peter (Mudman) Kinney, Cassie MacDonald, Joe McCullough, vox parvis, Miriam Seidel, Kim Stafford, B J Swartz, Rocky Wilson, and Dave Worrell.The book will include an introduction by Lily Yeh, the noted community-based artist, creator of the Village of Arts and Humanities in North Philadelphia, and subject of the 2014 documentary The Barefoot Artist. More about me and other projects I’ve done:I’ve had many shows of my artwork using mud, clay, pigment and paint, bones, shells and more, at galleries and museums in Pennsylvania and New Jersey, and my work is in many private collections. I have published four art books before now: Earth, Moon, and Sun (2008), and Sand and Sky (2010), including images of my art and related writing; and two previous Birdbath books: Meet Me at the Birdbath (2012) and Searching for the Blue Nugget (2013).All of these books featured a profusion of full-color photographs and poetry. I feel Fire in the Birdbath builds on the knowledge I’ve gained from the earlier books, and may be the best yet. This is the first time I’ve asked for donations to print my books.  This book is much larger, more ambitious, and more expensive to produce with high quality images.A portion of our fundraising goal will go to Brigid’s House, in gratitude for the creative community that has been built and sustained there.  Brigid's House, the home of the Birdbath writers, is a place for writing, healing and hospitality in Camden, New Jersey.  Since 2008, the House has hosted readings, workshops, poetry mural projects and whatever our co-conspirators dream up!  A portion of your gift will help ensure that Brigid's House may continue to offer creative sanctuary in a wounded city.  To find out more, go to www.brigidshousecamden.blogspot.com.

story:
Referral Contest


BLACK HISTORY MONTH A COMPETITION FOR YOUNG AND UP-COMING DESIGNERS, ARTISTS, DANCERS, AND SINGERS 

BRONZE MAGIC A FASHION/ART EXTRAVAGANZA

This is a competition for Fashion Designers, Artists, Singers and Dancers. They  will research the life of Josephine Baker and present their findings, their artistic visions to Fashion Alliance World, South Florida. This is a week long festival that will take place in the month of February, 2016. This will allow Fashion designers, Dancers, Artists and Singers to evolve in Fort Lauderdale Florida. This festival will take place at African American Research Library.  During this week's presentation Chef Mark Cameron will be teaching how to prepare healthy meals in 10 to 15 minutes.   

Who We Are

FASHION ALLIANCE WORLD (formally Fashion Alliance Intl) was founded in 1989. Fashion Alliance World Inc. was created to bring together fashion designers, merchandisers, illustrators, photographers and models, hair/make-up and stylist to join forces in promoting the growth of the fashion industry in South Florida, and to showcase the work of the Alliance members. Fashion Alliance World, South Florida will be actively involved in supporting and providing exposure for new and upcoming designers, through our shows, local boutiques and national and international marketing promotions. A variety of programs, and events, will be prepared to generate interest in the fashion industry, and to attract national and world interest in South Florida designers. Throughout the year Fashion Alliance will present at least four different fashion events. Some will be for members of the fashion/art industry only, and others will be geared towards retail buyers, to heighten their knowledge of the fashion/art industry. These events will be a potpourri of entertainment and business, even events within themselves. Every December the organization will kick off the holiday season with a glittering gala, which will provide an opportunity to showcase, and recognize, the talents of young, trendsetting and innovative designers from South Florida and beyond. We have done a number of events over the years and we are moving on hoping to continue the journey of love, “fashion.” Visiting our website you’ll find information on our previous and present projects at FASHIONALLIANCE.NET.  

Theme: Josephine Baker

THEME: Josephine Baker the first black superstar (June 3, 1906 – April 12, 1975) was an African-American, a Civil Rights Activist, dancer, singer, and actress who found fame in her adopted homeland of France. She was given such nicknames as the “Bronze Venus”, the “Black Pearl”, and the “Créole Goddess”. Josephine Baker became wildly popular as an American dancer and singer who brought the essence of the Jazz Age to Paris. Widely known for her daring costumes such as the banana skirt that she used to perform her famous “banana dance” and exotic cabaret performances; no wonder she was characterize and defined as the beauty of that period. She was also an early civil rights activist and the mother of 12 adopted children known as her “Rainbow Tribe.” In 1961, Josephine was awarded the Legion of Honor, France's highest award.


About This Project

Fashion Alliance is requesting fashion designers, artists, dancers and singers to research the life of Josephine Baker and present their findings in an artistic fashion. Designers, artists, Dancers and Singers who believed that they have what it takes to accentuate themselves, surrounded by the present yield of groundbreaking fashion designers and artists are being asked to send in two-sketched illustrations of their personally favorite from Josephine Baker; dancers and singers will send a one-minute DVD of their findings. For final year student designers/artist must submit a 300 words essay stating their position and why they believe that the style from their research has the cutting edge that makes their design unique and real must accompany your illustrations. The deadline for all entries is January 10, 2016. In your research please look at Josephine Bakers life be specific and use your "five-W" rule to sum up your findings: Who is the person, what made her important, when was her influence applicable, where was her influence practiced, why is this person important. Upon considering the “five W’s” Josephine will become dramatic to the eyes and mind. 

Prizes For Winners

The winners will receive $5,000 each OR a trip to Paris to visit fashion/art houses, art galleries and places where Josephine Baker performs and became famous as a Jazz singer/dancer.

Our Partners

With the help of Indiegogo and everyone including you our partner who are viewing, and reading about this project, and will be supporting it; we thank you because with your partnership we will be  able to show the world how talented and versatile these young fashion designers, artists, singers and dancers are.  All funds raised through our Indiegogo campaign will benefit “Different Faces, places and People” a non-profit organizations (501(c); also a Fraction of funds raised will be used for the production of this event operating costs. We are asking that you come on board and help to put their labels and signature on the map. In order to have the best crew to create an amazing week in February 2016, we need your support, be openhanded and help to make this happen.  This means that you will become a part of their prominence, and one day, or later on you could look back on a designer, artist, singer or dancer and be reminded “oh I've helped to make him/her dream come true.” So here you are take this journey with us and do whatever you can to make this happen BE PART OF THEIR BIG DAY! PUT SMILES ON THEIR FACES!  Thanks you all we hope to see you there; and Most of all THANK YOU INDIEGOGO!

story:
Fake Geek Girls Like Us aims to create a community space in which people who are made to feel unwelcome in geek culture because of their gender feel safe expressing themselves and sharing their artwork, thoughts and ideas.

(In case you didn't know, Fake Geek Girls Like Us is put on by one gal, Caitlynn Fairbarns, and I could really use your help!)

Icons & Idols is the debut publication is curated and edited by Fake Geek Girls Like Us. The 20 page 8x10 colour publication is full with beautiful art works and written pieces that explore our relationships with our idols. 

The launching event will be put on with Nerd Girl Burlesque at See Scape on April 22nd. Come by the event to pick up a copy of your zine and watch amazing performances!

By donating you get things, and who doesn't like getting things? You can preorder a copy of Icons & Idols and get copies of other Fake Geek Girls Like Us zines. You also get to feel awesome because you helped out a small business.  Help support local artists by donating.

Where is the money going?

$600 - Printing & Shipping Costs

$600 - Artist Honorariums

$200 - Promotional Needs (flyers, posters, videos etc)

$100 - Indiegogo Fees

Any additional earnings that we get will go straight to the artists and organizers.

Nerd Girl Burlesque

Nerd Girl Burlesque's mandate is to create burlesque routines and shows that showcase and highlight fandom in silly, thought-provoking, sexy, and engaging ways, while staying true to our values as intersectional feminists. Our group is comprised of queer, body diverse, mad, and disabled artists, and we strive to ensure that events we produce showcase further diversity in areas such as gender and race through connecting with and casting performers of colour, non-cisgendered performers, as well as other traditionally excluded groups. 

Through bringing fandom-based burlesque performances that are created by marginalized groups, we hope to show the faces of fandom that are often underrepresented. We also believe that the art created by people of diverse backgrounds will be all the more varied and rich, making it more enjoyable for audiences while also exposing them to something different. These may not be the people who normally get to represent what fandom is, but they are nonetheless an important part of fandom!

In many ways, burlesque has historically both capitalized on and become an escape for marginalized groups in the same ways comics, video games, and other mediums have. We seek to acknowledge the problematic histories of both and forge a new, more inclusive path. 

We seek to make sure that our shows are welcoming and positive, while still challenging you to think about fandom, sexuality, gender, body image and race. Burlesque may be new to many fans, and our warm host is ready to guide you through the show, where you'll see acts all done by true fans of the material, channeling their love of pop culture into performance art. The acts are always a fun and inspiring mixture of sexy, funny, and badass and our inspirations range from video games to science fiction, Shakespeare to history. 

Plus, there's glitter. 

Artists featured in this video are: (in order)

Introduction image by Christine Shepherd 

Carly Whitmore

Sophie Paas-Lang

Maria Vaas

Chloe MacPherson

D.C Nchama

Salini Perera

Deena Pagliarello

Video edited by:

David Sherren

When you share, please tag Fake Geek Girls Like Us on social media:

facebook: www.facebook.com/fakegeekgirlslikeus

instagram: www.instagram.com/fakegeekgirlslikeus

tumblr: www.fakegeekgirlslikeus.tumblr.com

story:
Our Story

A Webcomic with ambitious designs, it aims to tell the story of the World of Ascension. Populated by characters that range from the black and white, the demons and angels, to the grey toned characters that exist inbetween the two polar opposites in a world known only as Ascension.

Following the fortunes of a Paragon, an immortal being given great powers with a deathwish at her deepest core we see the world through her eyes to begin with, across a vast tapestry of time. The World changes, and she witnesses it all...


The Impact

I'm making this campaign as I have a set list of aims I desire to achieve;

1) I wish to be able to update and upkeep the webcomic ( The Condemnable ) with timely grace aside from my own full time job.
2) I am wanting to turn the World I am creating into a fully fledged roleplaying game, much like Exalted and DnD, with exciting classes, magic systems and a world fleshed out with impossible and wonderful things.


The impact of a funded campaign means I can ease off with working my fingers to the bone and look more closely at the needs of my webcomic and designed roleplaying system. I work a full time job and I care for my disabled family, leaving me little time between the two and my own personal life to achieve the dreams I've had since childhood.


What We Need & What You Get

I need time and money, it's as simple as that. I need to be able to afford the webspace for my webcomic as well as web advertising for it. I need to be able to ease up with work hours to make the webcomic a reality, as something I want to do as my career.

What you get is the satisfation of helping a young (well young-ish) artist achieve her dreams and goals despite heavy adversity. For anyone who contributes over £20 to my cause, I will give a free piece of artwork. Should my funded goal be met, I will update regularly, and offer additional services.

Planned in the works are;

1) A seperate side comic called 'Lvl Up Noob!' - there's a million and one gaming comics out there, so this is more of a freebie for my regular readers.
2) Livestreaming - I will set aside time to livestream artwork for my readers, as well as tips and tricks.

3) A gaming journal and forums - I want an interactive and friendly community where people of all types can come to showcase art, trade help and of course my biggest love, gaming.


Other Ways You Can Help

You can help me by putting the word out there! I need as much help as I can get to fund the time needed to make my dream a reality and hopefully add to the world I live in, with a world of my own.

NOTE: All sketches are done digitally, as I lack any capability to print off pictures etc, so note me with your perk price range and sketches/art will be done asap!!!


Much Love,

Bhryn xxx

story:
I am very excited to be writing to you all today.This project is an opportunity for you to make a statement in support of the arts and arts education at a time when everything in this country that is not seen as monetarily profitable is under great scrutiny. Before I present the details of this project let me give you some background detailing its genesis.


For those of you who might not know me, my name is Michael Markham. I am primarily an actor by trade. I trained at Juilliard several years ago. These days when I am not acting, I am also a photographer and filmmaker with a social justice background. As a Juilliard student, I watched several friends create an organization called Artists Striving To End Poverty (ASTEP). Soon after graduating, I began to volunteer with ASTEP and eventually found myself teaching at camps in Florida and South Africa. During this time I took thousands of pictures of the kids and volunteers involved with the camps. The pictures I took became an exhibition that was shown at 1359 Broadway in the summer of 2010 and again that fall in Homestead, Florida.


One of the pieces in the show is a 7x11 grid of 4x6 portraits entitled “Faces of ASTEP.” This year, I decided to adapt this work through the Inside Out Project, a creation of the street artist, JR, who won a TED Prize in 2011 for his photographic work. If interested you can watch JR's TED talk HERE. Visit his website HERE. Some of JR's work around the world HERE.


About the Inside Out Project.

The Inside Out Project is a large-scale participatory art project that transforms messages of personal identity into pieces of artistic work. Everyone is challenged to use black and white photographic portraits to discover, reveal and share the untold stories and images of people around the world. These digitally uploaded images are made into posters and sent back to the project’s co-creators for them to exhibit in their own communities. People can participate as an individual or as part of a group. Posters can be placed anywhere, from a solitary image in an office window, to a wall of an abandoned building, or in a full stadium. These exhibitions will be documented, archived, and made available online at www.insideoutproject.net.


About the TED Prize.

The first TED Prize was awarded in 2005 and was born out of the TED Conference, which holds a vision by the world's leading entrepreneurs, innovators, and entertainers to change the world – one Wish at a time. The reward: $100,000. What began as an unparalleled experiment to leverage the resources of the TED Community to spur global change has evolved into one of the most prestigious prizes. From Bono's the ONE Campaign ('05 recipient) to Jamie Oliver's Food Revolution ('10 recipient), the TED Prize is helping to combat poverty, take on religious intolerance, improve global health, tackle child obesity, advance education, and now inspire art around the world. For more information on the TED Prize, visit www.tedprize.org.


Now that you understand some of the background let me explain what I hope to do. The Inside Out Project requires its participants to make a personal statement with their photograph. This project is a group action started by me and my friends at ASTEP with the statement, “Arts education changes lives.” What we have done is re-purposed the images from my “Faces of ASTEP” piece into the format used by the Inside Out Project. They will be displayed on the side of Metro Baptist Church at 410 West 40th Street in Manhattan. Metro is located right at the exit to the Lincoln Tunnel so the project will be seen by thousands of people every day. Metro Baptist is a perfect place to host this work as they are avid supporters of and participators in arts education. Through their sister organization, Rauschenbusch Metro Ministries, they serve the Hell's Kitchen community through after-school arts and homework programs, English for non-native speakers classes, as well as a clothing closet and food pantry.


We are trying to raise $700 for this project to go forward. $150 will cover the supplies needed for posting the pictures. The rest, minus the fees associated here at Indie GoGo, will go to the Inside Out Project for the printing of the pictures at $6 per photography. Anything we have left over will be donated to Indie GoGo's fees are smaller if we meet our goal so please help us give as much to the Inside Out Project as possible.


If all goes as planned we will be mounting these pictures for all to see the weekend of October 15th. Weather will decide the specific day.


Please join us as we support arts education through the creation of art. Stand with us as we make a statement about who we are and what we believe in. We have a chance to stand up for our American culture and say that investment in our children, in the arts, in the creative process, and in building strong-minded individuals, not only revolutionizes our communities but our culture, our national identity and the world. If you agree with us and wish to support us in making this happen, please donate today.

Community to spur global change has evolved into one of the most
prestigious prizes. From Bono's the ONE Campaign ('05 recipient) to
Jamie Oliver's Food Revolution ('10 recipient), the TED Prize is
helping to combat poverty, take on religious intolerance, improve
global health, tackle child obesity, advance education, and now
inspire art around the world. For more information on the TED Prize,
visit www.tedprize.org.

Now that you understand some of the
background let me explain what I hope to do. The Inside Out Project
requires its participants to make a personal statement with their
photograph. This project is a group action started by me and my
friends at ASTEP with the statement, “Arts education changes
lives.” What we have done is re-purposed the images from my “Faces
of ASTEP” piece into the format used by the Inside Out Project. They will be displayed on the side of Metro Baptist Church at 410 West 40th Street in Manhattan. Metro is located right at the exit to the Lincoln Tunnel so the project will be seen by thousands of people every day. Metro Baptist is a perfect place to host this work as they are avid supporters of and participators in arts education. Through their sister organization, Rauschenbusch Metro Ministries, they serve the Hell's Kitchen community through after-school arts and homework programs, English for non-native speakers classes, as well as a clothing closet and food pantry.We are trying to raise $700 for this project to go forward. $150 will cover the supplies needed for posting the pictures. The rest, minus the fees associated here at Indie GoGo, will go to the Inside Out Project for the printing of the pictures at $6 per photography. Anything we have left over will be donated to Indie GoGo's fees are smaller if we meet our goal so please help us give as much to the Inside Out Project as possible.If all goes as planned we will be mounting these pictures for all to see the weekend of October 15th. Weather will decide the specific day.Please join us as we support arts education through the creation of art. Stand with us as we make a statement about who we are and what we believe in. We have a chance to stand up for our
American culture and say that investment in our children, in the
arts, in the creative process, and in building strong-minded
individuals, not only revolutionizes our communities but our culture,
our national identity and the world. If you agree with us and wish to support us in making this happen, please donate today.

story:
What is Across the ages?

This project is an art website containing a collection of illustrations on historical themes. Anyone will be able to travel back to any era and look at the Viking ships or pirates, enjoy the beautiful palaces and visit the battlefield. Also all images will be assembled into a digital artbook. Also in the future we plan to add a bit of video - small sketches on a historical theme.


The Impact

The project will be finished anyway, but with your help we can make it more qualitatively and faster. After the site will be started, anyone can visit online gallery absolutely free of charge.


What We Need & What You Get

The estimated cost to complete this project in full is $5,000 - a very small price to bring such beauty into the world. 

If we raise enough money, we will be able to pay for website development and for hosting, and we will be able to continue to create illustrations to complete the project.


Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate any feedback and advice. We are always available on social networks and like to be in contact with people because we create for people. 


We also ask that you spread the word about the project through your social networks and help us turn this project into reality. 


Check the project page on Facebook  http://www.facebook.com/pages/Across-the-ages/120386314756279

story:
Our Story

Coloring 4 Wellness was created by R. Andrews (Cartoonist/Illustrator) and Ms Traveler44, (Creative Writer); the two had many conversations about how art in some form had inspired them at a young age.  Ms. Traveler 44 has experienced herself, first-hand what coloring could do for a child that’s hospitalized. Feeling inspired, talk started about a coloring book for donation to the local hospitals, within a week the artists were at work. Coloring 4 Wellness was born September 14, 2009.

The Impact

As the name of the program states coloring for wellness is what we’re about. Our desire is to bring fun, awareness and education as well as self-esteem to children of all ages through coloring and art. We believe coloring promotes happiness which in-turn promotes wellness. When children are hospitalized it’s a scary time for them and some are not able to leave their rooms. We provide an activity (coloring) that most children are familiar with and enjoy. Coloring puts a smile on a child’s face. Each issue of coloring books targets either a disease that affects children such as Juvenile Diabetes, Childhood Obesity, Cancer, Heart Disease just to name a few.  In the last year it has become increasingly difficult to keep the program running due to the economic climate. If we are unable to raise money for the program it will become silent, which would be a disservice to all our sick children. Our vision is to one day have a facility to offer afterschool programs that include but not limited to art, music, dance and self esteem classes to the underprivileged children. It is our hope to have this program not only in our local community but Nationwide.        

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have come to the realization in this economy we need help to continue to purchase supplies and expand our territory. Our goal is to raise $2500.00. All monies donated will go toward the purchase of supplies i.e. (ink, paper, binding equipment and materials, printer, crayons, cutting fees). If our goal is not reached we will make as many coloring books with the funds donated as possible. We have been fortunate enough to receive funding from local businesses, family and friends. Please help us continue to make our vision a reality.  By making a simple donation in one of the amounts listed below, you may choose one from the two illustrations shown.   We thank you for allowing us to share our program; any and all donations are appreciated.

 

“Art saves lives, save a life today!”

Color 4 Wellness

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

You can also help by donating supplies (white paper, cardstock, crayons, ink, and paper cutter). Please tell your family and friends about Coloring 4 Wellness. Join the movement today! Feel free to visit us at Coloring 4 Wellness on Facebook, www.randrewdesigns.com or email us at color4wellness@yahoo.com .

story:
My name is Annette and I am an alternative jewelry designer.  My shop on Etsy is The Rusty Spiderweb.   I have been accepted into my first juried art event and I need help with expenses.  Along with the booth fee I also need a tent, tables, and displays.  

I need to get my name out there and I think doing art shows is a good start.  Most of my jewelry is one of a kind.  I like to upcycle vintage pieces and old hardware.  It's a great form of recycling and each piece has it's own story.  

Your help is greatly appreciated and will not go unrewarded.  There are PERKS! 

Thank you and please pass this among your friends and family,

Annette

story:
JOIN THE NOOK THANK YOU PROGRAM

Earn Refunds or Additional NOOKS for Free


MEET NOOK.

NOOK will fill any "nook"  you have, turning dead space into wine space.

We all have a "nook", what will you do with yours?


Sleek. Classy. Modern. Custom. Affordable. DIY. 

Store all your wine, utilizing that unused space inside a cabinet, against a blank wall, as a shape under your stairs or as a featured stand alone counter display system.


CUSTOM DIY TO FIT ANY "NOOK"

Standard or Custom Design, the opportunities are limitless.


CUSTOM NOOK

Create a customized design to fit any "nook", the options are really unlimited.


STANDARD NOOK

Here are just a few "standard"  configurations:

...the images above are straight. It is just an optical illusion created by the connector design.


NOOK IS SIMPLE & EASY

NOOK is made of just 2 pieces. It is brilliant.

With only 2 pieces, you can create your customizable wine rack masterpieces.

It is essentially Legos for wine storage.


GENIUS DESIGN

NOOK's unique and eye catching design has been created by Award Winning Industrial designer Craig Nottage.

He is well regarded in the design of high end game room products.


ANGLED DISPLAY DESIGN

More than just simple modular design.

In addition to it's modular design 2 piece design, NOOK also offers an Angled Display using the same pieces.


MOVING HOMES SOON?

Not a problem.

Disassemble. Re-Assemble to your new "nook's" shape.


START SMALL, BUILD UP

NOOK grows as your wine collection grows.

If your collection grows then simply purchase more NOOKs, there are no additional joining accessories or special tools required! 


AFFORDABLE LUXURY

Customization has never been so affordable.



The cost per bottle storage is very easy on the wallet when compared with traditional wine racks. NOOK is around 1/3 of the price of other modern modular wine racks. 


100 BOTTLES PER METER SQUARED

NOOK is compact.

Each NOOK "cell" is 3 and 1/4 inches squared, allowing for maximum storage per square foot.


AMAZING STRENGTH

NOOK can handle the heaviest of loads.

Your treasured wine collection is safe with NOOK.


HELP UNLOCK MORE COLORS AT $100K!


NOOK is currently available in Charcoal.  New colors Off White and Candy Red are in the works but we need your help!

Do not worry, we will ask you for your choice of color at the conclusion of the Indiegogo Campaign.


NOOK COMES IN MULTIPLE SIZES

3 NOOK Starter

CLICK HERE TO PLEDGE $25 FOR THE 3 NOOK STARTER

9 NOOK Small

CLICK HERE TO PLEDGE $38 FOR THE 9 NOOK SMALL KIT

25 NOOK Medium

CLICK HERE TO PLEDGE $79 FOR THE 25 NOOK MEDIUM KIT

50 NOOK Large

CLICK HERE TO PLEDGE $150 FOR THE 50 NOOK LARGE

TEAM


TIMELINE

*Notes on international shipping: We will use Hong Kong Post for standard international shipping, tracking is provided but no insurance. For express shipping, this will take 2-5 business days, tracking and insurance is provided. We strongly suggest using express shipping as Hong Kong post is slow and generally there are more hassles using them. This pricing is set for most countries, however if the shipping cost is significantly more expensive than the figure quoted so you may either opt out of your pledge or increase the pledge to cover the shipping. There are a few countries which unfortunately our shipper does not service.  Please note; Canada, Alaska, Hawaii and Puerto Rico are classified as international. 


FAQ

How do I get a Nook modular wine rack?

The only way right now is to order through this page. You will be the first people in the world to own a Nook wine rack at a price significantly below our RRP. After that, head on over to nookwineracks.com to order.

Why is your wine rack better than existing designs?

This is what inspired us to release Nook! We recommend doing your own research to see what we mean! Nook is sleek, modern and truly modular. Other solutions out there currently are as follows:

-  Timber/traditional style – Outdated look, inflexible configuration, limited capacity, expensive

-  Chrome metal wire style – Outdated looked, inflexible configuration, limited capacity

-  All plastic/low cost designs – Unattractive and cheap appearance, some with inflexible configuration

-  Traditional wood/steel – Outdated look, inflexible configuration, difficult assembly

-  Wall mount solutions – Expensive, require installation, limited capacity, potential safety risk

-  Custom/high end/designer racks – VERY EXPENSIVE, some require installation, inflexible configuration, often with limited capacity

I don’t know where to put it/I don’t know if I have space for one?

The beauty of Nook is you can put it virtually anywhere, you can build it to fit your space. You can even build multiple smaller wine racks and put them in a few places! Everyone has a nook such a cupboard that they could use!

Surely there is a wine storage system out there like Nook?

NO! That is why we created it!

How do I choose my colour?

If we reach 100k we will release off white and Candy Red colours. After the campaign finishes, we will send out a survey after the Indiegogo campaign has finished where you will select your colours. If you ordered more than one pledge level you can specify the colours of each.

I just want a normal wine rack… Can Nook do that?

Nook does everything that standard wine racks do. You can just build it into a square or rectangle shape if you wish.

How difficult is it to assemble?

There are only two pieces, it’s very simple. You assemble the rack loosely(on it’s back) to the size you need, check it will fit in the space and then knock the metal pieces in as far as they will go with a rubber or nylon mallet. Simple as that.

Who manufactures the wine rack?

We have a production company who are very experienced and highly professional in all aspects of manufacture and packaging.

Why is international shipping so expensive?

It is expensive to ship items internationally. We created the international pledge based on rates obtained from our shipper. In some rare instances with very expensive shipping, an additional surcharge may apply if the shipping is significantly above what you are paying! We will refund your money if you are not happy with the shipping surcharge.

You guys are in Australia, why is it classed as international to ship to Oz but free in the USA?

Based on our research, our USA orders will be around 2/3 of the total orders so it is viable to send a shipping container there and post from within the USA. The other 1/3 will go all over the world so we will post from our HK despatch facility.

I have kids, is this product safe?

Nook is a very safe and sturdy product, made from non-toxic materials, but like any item in your house if it’s in reach of kids or it’s built above 4’, we suggest attaching it to an adjacent wall with our wall mount bracket.

I’m a retailer/online seller/distributor and I’m interesting in selling Nook 

We would love to hear from you! Contact us directly to discuss reselling our product. We are keen to have Nook in shops soon.

story:
ABOUT THIS PROJECT

Hi, my name is Anne and I am an artist and ecologist, totally addicted to colour and patterns in nature. I currently live in Fiji where I volunteer for NatureFiji –MareqetiViti. I have enlisted the help of my fabulously talented arty daughter, Cathy, who lives half a World away in Scotland. Together, we want to raise awareness and funds for Fiji’s unique wildlife with our beautiful collection of hand drawn illustrations, Colour-in Paradise: a colouring book for all ages that will benefit species conservation.


WHY A COLOURING BOOK

Adult colouring books are hugely popular for their stress relieving properties and their ability to bring out our inner child. With 20 intricate drawings of Fiji’s beautiful flora and fauna printed on single sided quality paper Colour-in Paradise is perfect for anyone interested in wildlife or looking to make a difference. We hope that as people colour our beautiful hand drawn impressions of Fiji’s unique creatures, they will not only relax and have fun as they de-stress, but also fall in love with the animals and plants they are colouring.

WHY COLOUR-IN PARADISE IS DIFFERENT

All money raised in this campaign will pay for the costs of printing Colour-in Paradise books, limited addition prints and postcards. All profits from the sale of which will provide much-needed funding for NatureFiji-MareqetiViti to use for important species conservation. With your support, in addition to the benefits of ordinary colouring books, Colour-in Paradise will raise awareness and fund species conservation in Fiji.

Help us. Support our project and support Fiji’s wildlife.


IMPACT

Fiji really is a paradise. Its beautiful untouched forests and incredible wildlife can be found nowhere else on the planet, but it is under threat. NatureFiji-MareqetiViti are on a mission to protect it. They aim to enhance biodiversity and habitat conservation, to protect endangered species and create a sustainable use of natural resources throughout the Fiji Islands. Such conservation efforts require a huge amount of funding and they need our support.

If our project is successful, the money from the sale of our printed goods could go towards helping many of the creatures you will be colouring: the Fijian flying fox, red throated lorikeet, Fiji petrel and crested iguana to name a few. Perhaps even the acmopyle (a prehistoric mystery plant).  They all need funding to aid their conservation/recovery. That is where you come in…


WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET

We are very excited by the possibilities of our project but it won't succeed without the help of wonderful people like you! A total of £4000 will not only enable us to print copies of our colouring book, but a series of post-cards which people will be able to colour and send to friends. It would also include the printing of limited edition A3 prints of the same 6 postcard designs, hand-coloured by Anne. Think of the fun and awareness- raising your help will bring around the World! You will be supporting the conservation of some of the rarest creatures on Earth.

We have some really great perks on offer and hope we can tempt you to help us achieve success. Donations range from £2- £2000, each with fabulous rewards including signed copies of our colouring book, limited edition prints and postcards, specially commissioned artwork by Anne and a one off opportunity for sponsorship from a generous company/individual. You can also buy extra books and donate them to Nature-Fiji to help us raise awareness here as well.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can’t donate but would like to support us in another way, please get in touch. And, please, if you have read this far, share our project with as many people as possible. The more people we have on board, the more likely we are to achieve our goal! Share on social media, by word of mouth and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools.


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Although the printer is booked and every attempt will be made to meet delivery times, there may be unavoidable delays. We hope that orders of colouring books, postcards and limited edition prints will arrive in time for Christmas. We have the friendly post office staff on our side and will do our best.

We have opted for flexible funding. Although we would like to raise £4000 or more (printing costs reduce the more books etc. are printed), the minimum amount we need to be able to print and fulfil our perks is £2600.


We hope that lots of people will want to rokataka na veikabula kei Nature Fij-MareqetiViti (Colour wildlife with NatureFiji-MareqetiViti)

Thank you so much for supporting our campaign and helping to colour a brighter future for Fiji's wildlife. With best wishes Anne and Cathy and Fiji’s wildlife!

colouring books, Colour-in Paradise will raise awareness and fund
species conservation in Fiji.
Help us. Support our project and
support Fiji’s wildlife.
IMPACT
Fiji really is a paradise. Its
beautiful untouched forests and incredible wildlife can be found nowhere else
on the planet, but it is under threat. NatureFiji-MareqetiViti
are on a mission to protect it. They aim to enhance biodiversity and habitat
conservation, to protect endangered species and create a sustainable use of
natural resources throughout the Fiji Islands. Such conservation efforts require
a huge amount of funding and they need our support. 
If our project is successful,
the money from the sale of our printed goods could go towards helping many of the
creatures you will be colouring: the Fijian flying fox, red throated lorikeet, Fiji
petrel and crested iguana to name a few. Perhaps even the acmopyle (a
prehistoric mystery plant).  They all
need funding to aid their conservation/recovery. That is where you come
in…

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU GET
We are very excited by the
possibilities of our project but it won't succeed without the help of wonderful
people like you! A total of £4000 will not only enable us to print copies of
our colouring book, but a series of post-cards which people will be able to
colour and send to friends. It would also include the printing of limited
edition A3 prints of the same 6 postcard designs, hand-coloured by Anne. Think
of the fun and awareness- raising your help will bring around the World! You
will be supporting the conservation of some of the rarest creatures on
Earth.
We have some really great perks on
offer and hope we can tempt you to help us achieve success. Donations range
from £2- £2000, each with fabulous rewards including signed copies of our
colouring book, limited edition prints and postcards, specially
commissioned artwork by Anne and a one off opportunity for sponsorship from a
generous company/individual. You can also buy extra books and donate them
to Nature-Fiji to help us raise awareness here as well. 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
If you can’t donate but would like to
support us in another way, please get in touch. And, please, if you have read
this far, share our project with as many people as possible. The more
people we have on board, the more likely we are to achieve our goal! Share on
social media, by word of mouth and don't forget to use the Indiegogo share
tools.
RISKS AND CHALLENGES
Although the printer is booked
and every attempt will be made to meet delivery times, there may be unavoidable
delays. We hope that orders of colouring books, postcards and limited
edition prints will arrive in time for Christmas. We have the friendly post
office staff on our side and will do our best.
We have opted for flexible
funding. Although we would like to raise £4000 or more (printing costs reduce
the more books etc. are printed), the minimum amount we need to be able to
print and fulfil our perks is £2600.
We hope that lots of people will
want to rokataka na veikabula kei Nature Fij-MareqetiViti (Colour wildlife with NatureFiji-MareqetiViti)
Thank you so much for supporting
our campaign and helping to colour a brighter future for Fiji's wildlife. With
best wishes Anne and Cathy and Fiji’s wildlife!

story:
(Make sure to watch our rehearsal video up top to get an idea of what we are doing!)


What is the project?

 In a presentation that can be described as interactive therapy, “Recover” brings the artists’ healing process to their audience. Borne Dance Company has gathered a collective of musicians and movers of varying dynamics for an evening of artistic expression and inspiration. In the pursuit of art appreciation in all forms, the evening will also include original works of art from the realms of music, literature and photography. In the spirit of making art accessible to everyone in our communities, admission will be donation-based, so thanks to Indie Go-Go and sales of donated pieces of art from local collaborating artists, we are able to make this event happen.


Why we are doing it?

The presentation will take place February 28 in honor of the National Eating Disorders Association’s (NEDA)  Eating Disorder Awareness Week.  “Recover” celebrates all forms of recovery, progress, and personal growth.  This show will be a safe place for numerous artists to showcase their work based on their own personal recovery stories while simultaneously educating our community about eating disorders. This show will be donation based and all proceeds will be donated to NEDA.  


Who are we?

Borne Dance Company was founded in the summer of 2015 by New York based artists Katie Kilbourn and Kianna Moye.  This will be our debut show as a company and we are currently using this site to help us produce and fund this benefit show. The money donated to this site will go to theater rental, rehearsal rental, promotion costs, costuming and compensation for the artists involved with helping us create this performance.  You can get an idea of what we are working on by watching our rehearsal video up top! 


How you can help?

No contribution is too small, however we do understand that living off an artist's paycheck can be tough at times! If you are a broke and starving artist but would still like to contribute we're also accepting donated art pieces that fit the theme of "Recover"! For more information please contact us at BorneDanceCompany@gmail.com.  Broke but not an artist? You can help by spreading the word and sharing our Indie Go-Go campaign!

story:
(ENGLISH BELOW)

Bonjour!

Je suis Setsu (normalement vous savez déjà ça), et mon anniversaire est en Juin. Sauf que pour mon anniversaire je souhaite un tattoo qui va être assez cher (plus de 500€... oui). C'est un projet qui me tiens énormément à coeur! Du coup je commence maintenant une collecte, pour essayer d'avoir un peu, même si c'est 100€ ce sera vraiment beaucoup déjà (le site ne permet pas de mettre moins de 500)! Je fais de mon mieux de mon côté pour économiser, mais je me suis dis que si vous faisiez parti de mes proches et vouliez mettre un peu pour mon anniversaire, ce sera plus que bienvenue! Merci beaucoup!

Ps: Si vous ne pouvez pas utiliser Paypal mais souhaitez participer, je suis joignable sur Facebook ou par mail (setsu.porcelain@gmail.com) ou téléphone si vous avez :).

HELLO!

I'm Setsu (which you should already know), and my birthday is in June. Except for my birthday I want a tattoo that's going to be pretty expensive (more than 500€... yeah). It's a project which I really care about. So I'm starting now with this campaign to get a little bit, even if it's 100€ it'd be amazing (the website doesn't let me set the goal to less than 500)! I am of course going to get money on my own, working small jobs and stuff, but I thought if you're a friend of mine and was wondering what to get me for my birthday, you could maybe give a little here! It'd be amazing and so helpful! Thank you so much!

Ps: If you cannot use paypal but still wish to help, contact me on Facebook, mail (setsu.porcelain@gmail.com) or by phone if you have my number ;).

story:
Gorgeous Mortar seeks to create a vibrant local arts space which engages with the community via a diverse range of events and offerings. The project is a pop-up community arts hub: it is intended as a showcase of Canberra’s arts scene and Braddon’s changing cultural identity.

The Story of a Building

Once upon a time, in a small bakery space, three artists got together and decided to tell stories about a building, a community and about the arts. We are Zoe Anderson, Karina Bontes Forward and Dai Cameron. Poet, musician and artist, we’re passionate about the local arts scene and the community that make it the delicious kaleidescope that it is.

Gorgeous Mortar is intended to be a platform for the kaleidescope, for just a moment in time. Taking advantage of a building just before its demolition is not a new concept, but it’s not much done in our fine city (there are a few notable exceptions). So, the aim: to create a space where the arts can converge and muddle, mix and be themselves, be experimental, and most of all be spontaneous. Alternative spaces, quickly snapped up by development or new leaseholders, provide the perfect space to do this. There’s a buzz, a sense of urgency in interacting with art, and it must be done quickly.

We’ve got this all going - it’s already launching, it’s readysetgo. We want the community to join with us in making this a success. 

Ingredient: you. 

The Money Thing

We’ve navigated moneywaves, logistic nightmares and regulatory everything, and tried to do it all in the time it takes to boil an egg. And now we’re here and it’s all happening regardless! We think it’ll be super fun and that we’ll all enjoy it together, and financial sustainability is an important part of that. JOIN US!

It’s going to be music, art, installations, poetry, theatre, all rolled into a bundle of joy and served up in our gorgeous cafe/bar setup. We’ve got a local, simple menu food and drink. We’re doing minimum waste and doing all our composting. We’re including dollars for artists because we believe art should be valued. We’re doing Pay What You Want, so it’s accessible to all. We’re family friendly and inclusive. We’ve prettied the space, it’s a bar in a street art studio, a cafe in an old bakery.

What We Need Your Dollars For

We’re asking for $10,000. This will help us to cover a bunch of the boring stuff (insurance, licensing, etc), and ensure that we can cover our butts. We have some REALLY awesome gifts that we’re giving in exchange for your support... including your name on our special Gorgeous Mortar wall, poetry written for you, digital prints, or even an event in the space if you’re so inclined.

We’re running this campaign concurrently to our project. This is mostly because of the last-minute nature of it - we won’t get the cold hard cash till afterwards, but we will really need to pay bills. This is also why we’re doing it via flexible delivery rather than all-or-nothing - we really don’t need a set amount to ‘launch’, because we’re already doing it regardless. We just need the maximum support we can get to cover our way! And in joining us, you’re making the opportunity for an expansion of the artistic consciousness of Canberra, out of a box and into an explosion of colour in unexpected spaces.

For The Love of Art

We’re passionate about doing this, it’s definitely a risk, but it’s worth it. We’ve all got networks and/or experience in doing this kind of thing, and we believe it can work.

So, if you can help, join, collaborate with us, great! Thanks. Another way to support is to spread the word, come to hang out and have fun, play in the space, do a piece of whatever you do, and believe in local arts.

Thanks and see you at 40 Mort!

NOTE ABOUT PAYMENT:  All of our payments are going through PayPal, but you do not have to have a PayPal account to pay with a credit card!

Sponsors Make The World Go Round

The Green Shed

Bytes n’ Colours

Mac1

Eckersley’s

Blackett Development Group

CBD Limited

Bent Spoke Brewery

Nick O’Leary Wines

The Food Co-op Shop

Proudly supported by the Mandalay Bus & The Front Cafe & Gallery

story:
Short Summary

Ceno2 is one of the most successful and sought after graffiti artist in Singapore. He has developed his unique style of creating ‘lifelike’ portraits and landscapes that are all painted with using the humble SPRAY CAN. Ceno2 has developed and refined his ability to maneuver and render his pieces by use of spray paint solely without the help of sketches, outlines or block painting.

With a background in Fine Arts (graduated from Nanyang Academy of Fine Arts), Ceno2 decided to go against traditional painting methods of using a brush and challenged himself to learn the art of using spray paint to convey his art. Ceno2’s art has managed to capture the attention of small businesses to corporate levels. They have commissioned him to paint a wide range of paintings and sizes, ranging from: one office wall to the side of a six story building. He also has been commissioned for artworks in Chicago during his first visit. He made his way to Chicago, partly paid for by the Singapore International Foundation Arts Grants, to attend the Annual ‘Meeting Of Styles’ which is an international graffiti event. Attending the event allowed for more opportunities for Ceno2 as has has been invited to Gallery Bar, Chicago, for an upcoming solo showcase. 

What Ceno2 Needs

Any and every cent contributed to this fund will strictly go into lodging, transport and materials for Ceno2's solo showcase. Ceno2 doesn't believe in abusing funds or any contributions and so every cent counts. He also believes every cent is a form of support for him to evolve and take his Art movement of Graffiti Fine Art to the world. Please support the only Singaporean invited for his first SOLO showcase in Gallery Bar, Chicago!!

Introducing Graffiti Fine Art to the WORLD

Ceno2 would love to, with your funding support

  • Create awareness and spread the love of GRAFFITI FINE ART
  • Pushing the boundaries of Graffiti as an Art Form and not just a form of Vandalism
  • To demonstrate his skills and passion for Graffiti Fine Art to the public with different walks of life

Spread the love by contributing and sharing..

story:
The YEESAW is on it's way to Black Rock City!

Just some of the amazing souls that helped get this thing playa ready.

Step right up, folks! Step right up! Welcome to the YEE-SAW Carnival! Featuring the sentinel of all seesaws, the behemoth of balance beams, the giant of jungle gymnasiums, the monster of monkey bars, the YEEEEEEEE SAW!

<applause>

Standing at nearly 30 ft. tall with a 35 ft. wingspan, inner spinning merry-go-round seats (safety belted of course), springs, lights, monkey bars, dance platforms and ACTION! Fun for the kid in all of us. A menagerie of playground equipment that has outgrown the schoolyard and matured to cast glowing smiles on the child in all of us. Made out of wood, metal, and sweat this machine will launch you into the clouds of Black Rock City and bring you back down safely again and again.

Our goal is simple. We want to bring this machine to the West Coast BM Arts Festival as a representative of Houstonian interactive art culture. The contraption has already been contrapted. The construction is complete. We have practiced moving it and we have a seasoned crew that has field tested assembly and breakdown twice for a regional festival. Now, we just need to get it onto The Playa.

As you might think, transporting such a monstrosity across the country might be expensive. You would be right. This is where we beg you for money. We will try not to be too obvious about it.

What We Need & What You Get

The least expensive option of getting the YEE-SAW to Black Rock City is by contracting a semi to deliver it to our campsite, leaving the trailer there for the week of the festival, and returning it once we are done. This means we have a fun shade structure to play in also.

That costs 10K. We set the goal lower because the YEE-SAW only takes up half the space. Luckily, we are working with Houston CORE, the Sound Dome, Meditation Deathmatch, and a local art car to bring their setup in the same haul. Donating to us helps them as well.

You won't walk away empty handed. First and foremost you get to play on the YEE-SAW. Second to that we have fabulous perks and prizes to receive either in BRC when you find the YEE-SAW or at the fundraiser event on July 18-20 in Houston at Independence Art Studios (419 Janisch Rd). Of course there are stickers and t-shirts. An Indiegogo campaign has to have those. They are staples. But we are offering hard hats, tchotchkes, and screen-printed-while-you-wait, one-of-a-kind YEE-SAW prints as well as tickets to the limited invite Preview Party on July 18. You can only get tickets here on Indiegogo to that auspicious occasion filled with performances by aerialists, acrobats, fire wielders, live music, electronic dance music, and complimentary refreshments provided by Prego Houston, League of Extraordinary Brewers, and Real Ale. There will also be gourmet popcorn and peanuts. If you miss that night, we also have two more days of fun in store Saturday (the Opening) and Sunday (Family Day).

Risks & Challenges

But what happens if we don't raise the money? No worries. The money rolls over into the Get the YEE-SAW to Burning Man 2015 Fund. You can still get all of your perks at the Sound Dome.

Let's not dwell on those negative thoughts. Let's look at the fabulous perks you get for donating to the cause. This is the T-Shirt and Print design:

story:
Short Summary

My name is Ian Sherwin and I have been passionate about making art since I could remember.  It's simply what I was born to do! Even after a tragic accident in 2004 that left me blind in one eye, I did not let that stop me from continuing to create art and teach with fervor. I re-learned how to draw and paint and pressed on with my life's work. I am thankful every day for the ability to create and share art and thankful that my blindness has actually given me sight. My disability has helped me find innovative avenues of expression/teaching methods. 

If you haven't watched the video above - please take a look to learn a little more about me!

I have been a full-time fine art painter and teacher for the past 20 years and it's been such an exciting journey. As a young man, I had a clear vision for what I wanted my future to look like as an artist and have been immensely blessed to see those dreams come to life one by one as I've pursued my goals.

BUT, I DREAM BIG.... SO THERE'S STILL A LOT MORE TO COME 

AND THAT'S WHY I NEED YOUR HELP!

Going off of faith and a gut feeling, I made plans to leave all I knew in the Wrigleyville Gallery and find the perfect space to open my dream gallery in Humboldt Park in a neighborhood where I can continue my journey with:

  • Teaching and learning from autistic children, special needs children/adults through the beauty of visual art
  • Providing opportunities for young, aspiring artists to achieve their goals and dreams /showcase their work
  • Utilizing a space that is the perfect size to finally create all the classes I've dreamt of teaching

How I Want To Utilize The Space:

  • Teach classes to special needs children and adults in the Chicago area (I've been told by several people that I have an innate gift in the area of teaching those with special needs and I have been truly fulfilled in these experiences. I yearn for more! I would love the funding to create a full curriculum and weekly classes for this as well as the ability to offer free classes to those from low-income households who could benefit from my teaching. Those of you who love or know someone with special needs understand what a benefit it truly is when a special needs person is connected to a new means of communication with their beautiful minds)
  • Be able to offer affordable rentals and space to up-and-coming artists of all kinds - be it visual, theater, music, improv, or poetry - all art is beautiful and welcome -with a specific focus on Humboldt Park residents (For all you artists out there- I understand the challenges of being an artist and was once in your shoes! I want to help you get your careers going and share this vibrant space with you!)
  • Rent the space for all kinds of events  (I want the space to be used for memorable occasions for those in the neighborhood and city of Chicago to experience the gallery with us and to be exposed to new art while enjoying a special day or evening)

Classes I Want To Offer:

  • Art Therapy 
  • Art Therapy for Special Needs Children 
  • Art Therapy for Special Needs Adults
  • Children's Art Courses
  • PibSqueaks and Power Tools
  • BYOB Painting Classes
  • Origami Bouqet Building
  • And Many More Never Before Seen Classes (But shhhh! I don't want to give away ALL the mind blowing classes that I have planned! )


What We Need & What You Get

I have put a lot of time, money, blood, sweat, and tears into getting this space up and running. This has included hours upon hours of work - planning, painting, patching, cleaning, phone calls, emails, teaching, teaching, teaching, connecting, marketing, and sharing the space with low-income, local artists to showcase their work. 

The gallery is already proving successful and has had some phenomenal events (most recently the Field Work Exhibit). I've proudly given opportunities to young artists in Chicago and I've been blessed to teach and inspire numerous friends, clients, and strangers in this new space. As an added bonus, I've been fortunate enough to sell several pieces of up-and-coming artists' work. 

But, now I need your help! I really want to get the ball rolling  so I can expand the gallery and enhance what I've built here. I'm sure you all know what it's like to have a dream and have mapped out a plan to get there - and I would so appreciate your help! I need you. Yes YOU! To help me in getting the rest of the pieces into place so I can share my passion with those who can utilize it best. Let's take a look at how this $25,000 goal breaks down. Specifically, I need help paying for:

  • Art Supplies For Various Classes: Paints, Brushes, Canvas, Paper, Easels, Chairs, Aprons, Painting Boards, Lighting Fixtures, and more so that I can fully implement the classes I've dreamt up and designed.  $3,000
  • Art Materials for Art Therapy Classes: Enough materials to be able to stock up so I can provide these classes free of charge to those who can benefit from them. $4,300
  • Signage: Right now from the street our gallery looks like a black box. I need to spruce up the outside to help get local residents in this community aware of the gallery inside and invite them to take part in it! How else will they find me? $900
  • Web design and upkeep: I need to enhance our online presence by revamping our website and making sure that people like you can connect and find me! $2,000
  • Printed promotional material: I need cards, class information etc. so that when I meet the people who could benefit from a class, a rental, a space to show their work, I can empower them with knowledge. $650
  • General backing (rent, power): I'm a one man show here, and it's going to take a LOT of my time to get these classes and rental capabilities in place, so I will need help making sure the space is running on all cylinders for a couple of months while I put my ideas into action. $6,000
  • Marketing/PR: We all know that having this great space and these classes won't do any good if the people who want/need it can't find me! Getting the word out to artists, special needs children/adults, and others looking for their creative outlet is key and I'm going to need a specialist to help me do this. $4,000
  • A percentage of the money raised goes back to IndieGoGo and PayPal $1,500
  • And a percentage goes back into providing the Perks + Shipping the Perks to all you amazing people!  $2,650 (This monetary amount doesn't include the time it will take to produce all the perks)
For a grand total of $25,000 - TA DAA!

    What You'll Get As a Contributor:

    My expertise and passion are in painting and teaching. As a gracious contributor to this campaign, you will receive a one of a kind, limited edition print of my artwork entitled "Profusion". When people see you own this art work, they will know you were an integral part of making this dream gallery come true. Never again will this piece be available in any form in the future. 

    I've also put down some various perks available dependent upon your contributions. Take a look on the right hand side - I'd love to offer you a private class, an original piece, and more!

    And, by the way, the perks section is just a marker for various monetary contributions - you don't have to donate those exact amounts - and you can also choose to take a perk or not. Anything you can give will help! Just fill in whatever amount you like once you hit that hot pink button.

    The Impact

    • Funding the classes for the gallery will allow autistic, blind, and special needs students to unlock and explore the creative sides of their brain and let them function on a different plane with me.
    • This gallery will become a bright, positive spot for its residents to share their creativity
    • This gallery will allow me to continue inspiring people through my passion and help them connect to themselves and others through art.
    • This gallery is the end of my journey as a business man and artist. I have been an entrepreneur since the age of 6 when I started selling my first pieces of art work and my spirit/drive for success has been with me all these years. Help me make this my biggest success yet!

    Risks & Challenges

    One of the biggest challenges I currently face is getting the word out about the gallery and connecting to the people who want what we have to offer. I've always come through on all my ideas and plans over the years, now I just need some help getting the funding to bring in the right people to get this place on the map!

    I need a strategic plan to connect with these artists and students in order to best utilize the space and make all my ideas for expansion a reality.  My expertise and passion lie in creating, teaching, and making art- so I really need help bringing on an experienced PR or marketing firm to help propel the expansion  and get us moving toward my big dreams.


      Other Ways You Can Help

      • If you can't contribute financially, please make some noise about my campaign in other ways! We only have a limited number of days before the campaign is over.
      • Take a minute to share this - along with a personal message explaining why it's important to you - with anyone you know who might be interested in helping - whether it's your mom, a friend, your teacher, anyone who might be able or willing to help us.
      • You can share this via facebook, twitter, instagram or in an email, text, phone call - be sure to checkout/use the Indiegogo share tools.
      • Donate Art Supplies
      • Donate time to help us work in the gallery
      • Donate time as a marketing/public relations/advertising expert to help us expand and grow

My name is Ian Sherwin and I have been passionate about making art since I could remember.  It's simply what I was born to do! Even after a tragic accident in 2004 that left me blind in one eye, I did not let that stop me from continuing to create art and teach with fervor. I re-learned how to draw and paint and pressed on with my life's work. I am thankful every day for the ability to create and share art and thankful that my blindness has actually given me sight. My disability has helped me find innovative avenues of expression/teaching methods. 
If you haven't watched the video above - please take a look to learn a little more about me!
I have been a full-time fine art painter and teacher for the past 20 years and it's been such an exciting journey. As a young man, I had a clear vision for what I wanted my future to look like as an artist and have been immensely blessed to see those dreams come to life one by one as I've pursued my goals.

story:
This is not just about painting a wall painting on a daycare center, this is about inspiring and expanding the minds of township children through meetings with artists with bigger dreams and visions.



Artists who want to join the kids when we have money to buy paint:


Pastel heart:
Street artist.
http://pastelheartist.blogspot.com

SPOOK:
Mural, street and tattoo artist.

Rabbit Mahlatsi:
Cartoon artist and graphic designer.  http://themahlatsicreations.blogspot.com

Natasha Jacobs:
Student of fine art at Durban University of Technology.
She also wants to help with mural organization and other things for the kids.




Please share the link and help us join the artists to paint with the children.




More info?
If you want a longer more detailed text about this project please scroll down. We just put it further down to not let the long text discourage anyone.
































Encouraged mural themes

Everyone will paint whatever they want and we will try to inspire motives that have to do with friendship, helping people, freedom, health, sustainability, nature, motivation, equality, antiracism, fruits and greens, Ngilonde of course, and improving lives, local society and the world.



Some photos of the kids at Ngilonde:
http://www.worldimproving.org/ngilondephotos 


Filming the art initiative for DOTV

A new online TV channel called Durban Online TV channel will most likely make a program from some of the painting sessions as well, which the children will definitely think is very fun, since very few of them even has a camera in their family. https://www.facebook.com/DurbanOnlineTV 


What we need and how it will be spent:

We need paint and brushes for 75 USD to start the first day of painting (800 rand) and if I just see that some funding is starting to come in I can lend the money to buy paint for the project (since the funding money will be paid out much later).


That 75 USD does not include spray paint, and since that is Pastelheart’s “thing” and kids love spray painting we might buy that too bringing the price up a bit.


The rest of the 500 USD will be used for even more painting days until we are out of paint. We have a huge wall to cover.



Today there is not even a sign on the wall.
There is not even a Ngilonde sign on the walls ,due to lack of funding at the daycare center. Our first plan is to start by painting information about what Ngilonde does for the township and  surrounding community.We will be doing this by allowing the children the opportunity to paint the first mural, we believe that the children should be apart of the development process.

The priority at Ngilonde has been food and homework assistance but the kids must get the opportunity to learn creative arts and have fun too.

And who knows how many of the kids may turn out to be inspired to be artists themselves in the future, after meeting Ali, Natasha, Pastel Heart, Spooks, Rabbit and more that will probably follow.



About Ngilonde

The Zulu word Ngilonde has some different translations, one of which is "take care".

Ngilonde is a daycare center that assists local orphans and vulnerable children from the Chesterville community in Durban through offering care, free lunch, meals and help with homework,they give the opportunity for children to play sports and games thus giving them inspiration for life.

Most of the children at Ngilonde can't  afford shoes to play, so they play in their school shoes, but this doesnt stop them because they are usually full of life and optimism!

Due to their lack of money and parents (most live with poor grandparents or relatives) they have the same daily routine almost every day and can rarely afford to leave the township (poor suburb) that they live in.

To get more variation and inspiration in the kids’ lives we have introduced skateboarding, basketball, fruit picnics and fruit planting to the kids, and now we want to introduce painting!

Any nice people who would like to paint or offer some other fun activities to the kids are more than welcome to contact us.


You can read more about Ngilonde here: http://www.worldimproving.org/ngilondeinfo

story:
About The Project

Third Space Art Collective is a non-profit creative space in Davis, CA that began almost 3 years ago when a bunch of locals decided to create an affordable and accessible art space. We are a group of independent artists, performers, and educators that want to enrich the culture of our community by making art and music accessible to people regardless of age or economic standing.

We really believe in the DIY philosophy, which means do it yourself and we wanna empower people by providing access to the tools, materials, and knowledge they need to become active participants in their creative community.

Our goal is threefold: One: to maintain a space to be used as a shared and dedicated art studio space for members. Two: to provide a space where members can learn, practice, and share ideas and skills. Three: to operate as a venue where art and music are showcased.

We host all sorts of events like concerts, art shows, workshops, plays, and other events too. We’ve done so much in the past 3 years and wanna continue being an inspiring community organization for future generations to come.

We provide a physical space for people in our community to come together, create, collaborate, and network.  We’ve slowly become an essential part of the Davis art and music scene, offering a space for both touring and traveling musicians, along with helping foster emerging artist with the ability to play and experiment.


What We Need & What You Get

Third Space Art Collective is a volunteer run organization so we're asking the community to help keep our doors open. Our current budget which is funded entirely by membership dues and events we host, help pay for basic operating expenses like rent, utilities, and insurance.

With your donations we could hire grant writers, buy art supplies, tools, PA gear, and make building and safety improvements so we're complying with the city of Davis. We’d also love to introduce small stipends for our administrative staff who currently volunteer their time and energy to keep this project afloat.

We are a non-profit organization, so donations are tax-deductible for those that are able to contribute. We understand that not everyone can financially support our fundraiser, but you can still help us by spreading the word about our project and sharing it with your family and friends.

We’d like to give a special thanks to everyone that’s ever been involved with us and help made this project possible. With your help, we hope to continue making a positive impact to the community of Davis and beyond.

The Impact

Read about the impact we've had in Davis and hope to continue doing.
http://www.thirdspacedavis.com/community/


Other Ways You Can Help

Your financial donations are greatly appreciated but we understand a lot of you are probably starving artists like ourselves. If you can't donate financially please share this around on your social media accounts.

thirdspacedavis.com

facebook.com/thirdspaceartcollective
instagram.com/thirdspaceartcollective


Non-Profit Status

Third Space Art Collective is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Third Space Art Collective must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.
