story:
PICTURE THIS:

An event that represents various fields - art, architecture, photography, culinary, film, literature, music, performance, fashion...all with one common thread.

The common thread is a conversation that we can all engage in, and subsequently, be exposed to disciplines we've always wanted to explore.

This begins in our new exhibition space on Commercial Street, and we're partnering with our neighbors to stimulate the San Francisco art scene.


SO WHO ARE WE?

We’re ELL | San Francisco, an arts collective, formed from local artists, designers, performers, fabricators, architects, curators, and alike. We're creating the next art and architecture movement in San Francisco, by developing a Cross-Disciplinary Gallery + Exhibition + Meeting Space for the arts and local business. 

In effort of supporting emerging artists, and pushing the limits of exhibition, we've united local business and the arts community. We’ve designed this space to flex from a conference room, to a more communal event area, allowing additional revenue to fund the creation of rigorous work. The goal is to foster creativity in all forms, from and, more uniquely, for those in all statures of life.

THE TEAM:

Jason Campbell - architecture and photography
Rafael Vizcaino - culinary
Tajai Massey - music
Francisco Fernández - film
Hana Bittner - mixed media
Sam Holtzman - writing
Peter Suen - emerging technologies
Andrew Manuel - fashion


WHY?

When we talk about the arts, we find common ground in our need for more...more creatives, more discussion, more exhibition, and more space to create and facilitate societies encounter with rigorous work. 
The thing is: art and design need to position themselves in our communities. We need to demonstrate that they are valuable and accessible, and that our field is not exclusive; it simply takes the right lens to translate, comprehend, and respond to current events.  We need to demonstrate consistency, the continual reveal of the latest, the most inspiring, the experimental, the refined, the bad ass, the challenging, paired with the finesse that proves you're serious about creative endeavors.


GET INVOLVED!

We've taken a 720sf storefront on Commercial Street, and aim to transform this space into a refined canvas for the rigorous work of our arts community. 

To properly outfit our space, we need $50,000 to:

  • jump start our arts program
  • create a fund to support emerging artist exhibitions
  • undergo construction
  • offset start up costs
This will support yearly exhibitions, panel discussions, lectures, and special events.
In addition: If you appreciate our intention, and you find us to be a valuable asset to the arts community, please share! and follow!


OUR GIFTS

This is a space for the community, and we want everyone to know who was involved in making this happen.  Here are our tokens of appreciations:

  • Grand Opening Event - Tasting Room Access during first event
  • Limited Edition ELL Tote Bag
  • ELL Artist Publication - First Edition
  • Dinner at Mister Jiu's - the latest addition to the SF culinary scene
  • Friend's Signature - your name added to our SUPPORTERS WALL
  • Patron's Signature - your name added to our feature element: PIVOT WALL


OUR HOME

Having seen a lot of potential in the neighborhood surrounding this small pedestrian alley, we moved in on Commercial Street in 2015 with the newly founded, Chapel Hill Coffee.  This district has a strong mix of restaurants, shops, galleries, and is home to several design-centric professionals.  Commercial Street is closed to traffic everyday, allowing storefronts to take over the street and create a synergy with adjacent districts. We have Jackson Square to the north, and staples of Chinatown heritage to the west. The south side has the hustle of financial district, and Market Street, the only other San Francisco street with a perfect view of the Ferry Terminal Tower.  If we’re not in view, just look for Transamerica Pyramid, ELL | San Francisco is one block away.


OUR CHALLENGE

Our primary challenge is the fluctuating spatial needs and requirements for a diverse set of businesses, social networks, and artists.  Given our diverse team's ability to solve complex situations, the flexibility of our space plan and design features, access to the adjacent storefront for all events, and commercial street access, offers a diverse strategy to facilitate a wide array of program type, including:
  • exhibition
  • panel discussion
  • ﻿workshops
  • lectures
  • presentations
  • farmers markets
  • culinary pop-ups
  • fundraisers
  • photography staging|styling|shoots
  • receptions
  • film screening
  • listening parties
  • product demos

Help us bring a new space for the arts into our community!  Thanks for checking our project out, we definitely appreciate your time and interest!

and of course, Please share! and follow!

ELL | San Francisco

www.ELL-SF.com
story_txt:
PICTURE THIS:
An event that represents various fields - art, architecture, photography, culinary, film, literature, music, performance, fashion...all with one common thread.
The common thread is a conversation that we can all engage in, and subsequently, be exposed to disciplines we've always wanted to explore.
This begins in our new exhibition space on Commercial Street, and we're partnering with our 
neighbors to stimulate the San Francisco art scene.

SO WHO ARE WE?
We’re ELL | San Francisco, an arts collective,
formed from local artists, designers, performers, fabricators, architects,
curators, and alike. We're creating the next art and architecture movement in San Francisco, by developing a Cross-Disciplinary Gallery + Exhibition + Meeting Space for the arts and local business.  In effort of supporting emerging artists, and pushing the limits of exhibition, we've united local business and the arts community. We’ve designed this space to flex from a conference
 room, to a more communal event area, allowing additional revenue to fund the creation of rigorous work. The goal is to foster creativity in all forms, 
from and, more uniquely, for those in all statures of life. THE TEAM:Jason Campbell - architecture and photographyRafael Vizcaino - culinaryTajai Massey - musicFrancisco Fernández - filmHana Bittner - mixed mediaSam Holtzman - writingPeter Suen - emerging technologiesAndrew Manuel - fashion

story:
The Free Artists Network (FAN)

 

 

Every $2 That We Receive Builds a Course Website for One Art Teacher
( Including YOU )

We service educators in the Fine Arts, Design, Film, Performing Arts, Music, and Literature.

 

Update: NEW Rewards for Donors!

 

 


Why Should I Support the FAN Project?

Problem 1: Cuts to Education Have Left Arts-Based Programs Particularly Wounded, Leaving Many Students Without Any Education in the Arts

 

Problem 2: Students Are Not Being Prepared for the New "Creative Economy"

Cuts to arts-based education are happening at the same time that job rates in the creative sectors are seeing the largest numbers of growth than in any other sectors during the economic rebound. Job openings in the creative sectors grew by over 60% in just this year alone.

 

 

Problem 3: Even Well-Funded Arts-Based Programs with Many Course Options Run Into Problems With Meeting the Diverse Interests and Needs of Creative Students

 

What Will FAN Do With My Donation?

Goal 1: Establish an International Database of Arts-Based Lessons for Students

We aim to establish an international database of art lessons that contains art lessons in various media modalities. The lessons will be contributed by other art educators, industry professionals, and software developers and will offer creative students industry-relevant art lessons that meet their diverse artistic interests, ability levels, and special needs. Teachers can upload their own multi-media art lessons to this database to share them with art students and other art educators worldwide. Lessons

Goal 2: Build Free Course Websites for 25,000+ Educators in the Arts Nationwide

These course websites will have free built-in features and tool that are specific to arts education and that benefit the education of a broad range of creative students with various artistic interests, abilities, and special needs.

Such features will include . . .

1) Shared media galleries of student artwork with a built-in critiquing system
2) Recordable video and audio lessons with "translatable," closed-captions systems*
3) Multi-media lesson templates and rubrics specific to arts education
4) Classroom management services and tools for teaching art lessons online
5) An online database of shared art lessons in various artistic fields that art teachers can instantly add to their websites
6) The option for educators to share their arts-based lessons with students and other art educators for free or for a fee
7) Free portfolio-building tools for student artists
8) Career services for student artists following graduation
9) And other features suggested by art educators, art students, and creative professionals.

Goal 3: Offer Portfolio-Building Solutions and Career Supports to Art Students

FAN will offer free, easy-to-use tools to art students to assist them in setting up personalized, professional online portfolio websites for their work. Graduates will also receive free career supports and job connections through the site.

If you are an art, music, film, or literature teacher, and would like a free, personalized art course website from us once our project is complete, please either comment on or "like" our campaign. If you cannot contribute, you can still help our campaign by sharing our project through Facebook, Twitter and other social networks. Thank you!

What is The Free Artists Network and How Does It Work?

The Free Artists Network (FAN) is designed to modernize the field of art education, making art lessons more relevant to industry-standard skills and making content easier to access for a broader range of students worldwide.

The website will allow art educators from numerous domains—including Design, Fine Art, Film, Music, and Literature—to easily setup customized webpages for their art courses. The site will include easy-to-use online tools that will help art teachers setup and organize their art courses and art-based lessons through a digital format. Lessons can be streamed to students through live video or audio feeds, automatically recorded, and stored in an archive for students to view later. Teachers can also upload their own video lessons, podcasts, written tutorials, and other accompanying lesson materials to each online lesson.

All courses and individual lessons will be made available to students worldwide through an online database that students can use to search for art lessons and full courses that match their artistic interests, ability levels, and learning needs. Educators can make their art courses and lessons available to students for free or for a fee for the teacher. Students can choose to complete recorded lessons on their own, or they can opt to join live streaming lessons from educators with a teacher-student chatroom if they feel they need more direct support from an art teacher. Other art educators can use this database to find new lessons to share with their students or to use as a resource to better teach their students across a broad range of interests and needs.

Creative studios, industry professionals, and software developers can also use the website’s tools to create and contribute their own lessons to the online database to help students, new studio hires, and career artists learn industry-relevant skills and stay up-to-date with new versions of creative software.

Finally, students who enroll on the site will be provided with an easy-to-setup, customizable portfolio webpage where they can showcase all their work from cumulative lessons. When students graduate, they will have a personalized, online portfolio to show to colleges or clients.

 

[To learn about our free, easy-to-use services for art educators, please click on the image above to view that segment of our YouTube episode.]

 

[To learn about the free, customizable, online portfolio services that we offer to art students, please click on the image above to view that segment of our YouTube episode.]

 

 

Who Does FAN Benefit?

 

[Please click on the image above to watch the interviews.]

 

Art Teachers

FAN offers art educators easy-to-use, free tools that allow them to setup and organize personalized, professional webpages for their art courses. Course and lesson templates are offered in a digital format that allows art teachers to easily organize information and other materials related to each lesson, including videos, podcasts, written tutorials, downloadable files, links, discussion topics, online quizzes, class chatrooms, project information, assignment directions, rubrics, state content standards (if applicable), and albums for files and artwork submitted by students. All artwork and artistic media submitted to teachers by students will automatically display on the front end of the teacher’s course page in a shared gallery of student work so that educators can share their students’ work with others.

Teachers can stream their video or audio lessons in live time, or they can privately record their lessons for students to access later. Once setup, each individual lesson can be accessed and independently completed by students enrolled in that teacher’s course, or if it is a public lesson, by students and other art educators who can locate the lesson by searching for it in the public database of art lessons. Teachers can share their lessons with other art educators and can locate art lessons from other teachers to share with their students. Teachers can make their lessons publicly available for free or they can charge a fee for each lesson.

Art Students

Art students from various backgrounds—including Design, Film, Music, Fine Art, and Literature—will be able to freely search for individual art lessons and full courses that best meet their particular interests in artistic styles and their ability levels. Lessons will be contributed by trained art educators, industry professionals, and studios, providing students with both the educational supports they need and the modern content most relevant to the rapidly changing industry they desire. Students will also be provided with easy-to-setup, personalized, professional-looking online portfolios to promote their work to colleges and clients.

Special Needs and ESL Students

Studies have shown that students with English language struggles and other special learning considerations do well with a greater amount of educational options and differentiated instruction. Students will have the option of selecting lessons that suit their ability level and that deliver content using the type of media they most prefer to learn in, such as video lessons, audio podcasts, and written tutorials—or a mixture of these. Video lessons can be particularly beneficial to students with learning difficulties and students who are not yet proficient in English, as the content is delivered through a more visual modality. Such lessons can be rewound for students struggling with attention control or memory.

Career Artists

In the constantly and rapidly changing field of art, one never stops being a student. It takes regular learning to stay ahead of the curve and to be consistently up-to-date with industry trends and the newest versions of creative software. Rather than having to go back to school or to rely on their employers for this training, career artists can use the Free Artists Network to take control of their own education and to provide themselves with the necessary training resources to remain “hire-able” in the advancing industry. Artists can also utilize the lessons and courses they find through FAN to reinvent themselves and their styles at any time in their careers.

Studios

Wish all the new artistic talents that you hire were already fully trained in the systems and software your studio utilizes? Many studios often have to donate time, effort, and finances to on-the-job training for their new artistic talents, particularly those who are recent graduates. FAN’s database of searchable art lessons serves as a training resource that new hires can use to independently prepare themselves for work at any particular studio. This is also useful for experienced creative talent in the event that the studio they are employed for must suddenly change their processes or switch to a newer version of software. Studios need only direct their creative employees to lessons or full courses on the Free Artists Network without having to spend any time or effort to personally train these individuals.

Studios can also contribute their own recorded media lessons to the database of courses to store for all their future hires. Because they are allowed to contribute art lessons to the database, studios and other industry professionals are able to donate their knowledge and expertise of industry skills to art educators and art students, thus providing the field of art education with more industry-relevant lessons.

Information for Sponsors

 



 

 

[To learn more about our perks for sponsors, site demographics, and the site's growth potential, please click on the image above to view that segment of our YouTube episode.]

 

Founder’s Bio: Krisha Moeller

FAN was developed by Krisha Moeller, a credentialed Art Educator and ex-industry professional who currently teaches 11th grade Digital Art in the Los Angeles area. The idea for FAN came from her personal experiences as an art student, a career artist, and an art educator, and from input from numerous other industry professionals and art teachers from various institutions, ranging from elementary school to 4-year universities.

story:
the lil' drummer girl.


iNspiRiNg, iNNoVaTiVe iNdePeNdENCe dAY iDeA.


i hope to raise awareness, as i raise money. i hope to fly to africa with nickels. five cents. sweet. simple sense. 

cans can help.

drink soda for the sojourner, water for the thirsty, pop for the poor, beer for the brothels.


i wonder if you'd be interested, willing, able, to donate chocolate milk money-to send redemption money to help me help the trapped, trafficked, misused, abused. peddled for pennies. with bottled emotions. stuck in a gutter. dumped in a ditch. in a sticky situation.  


i remember the lil' lad with five loaves & two fish & the youngest child shepherd boy with five stones, a mustard seed of faith, and a strategic sling.


mY dReAM is tO cReATe cOMPaSsiONATe cOMMUnIty, iNCoRpORAtiNg hOLisTiC heALThCaRe, cAThARtiC aRTS, eXpLoRATiVe eDuCaTioN, aDVENTuRouS aThLetiCs & aUTheNtiC aGRiCuLTuRe.

mY viSiON is tO dEVELoP gREENhoUSeS, wHeRe cHiLDReN in viLLaGeS & sLumS wiLL noT siMpLy suRViVe, bUt tRULy tHRiVe, aS thEy puRSuE pURpoSe, peACe, pAsSioN & poTeNtiAL, eXPERiENCiNg fReEdoM, fAiTh, fRiENdShip & fAMiLy & gENuINe gRoWTh.

 

i aiM to fLy to aFriCa to wORk wIth giRLs rESCuEd fRoM sLaVeRy. 




the can plan. cans can help. 

GiRLS. girls in a gutter. 

STUCK. stuck in a rut. 

DUMPed. dumped in a ditch. 

STICKY SITUATION. 

bottled emotions. 

PEDDLED. peddled for pennies. 


reach out a hand. rescue. experience redemption. 

the can plan. cans can help. 

five cents. 

sweet. 

simple sense. 

"buy the truth & do not sell it." proverbs 23:23 




with love & life, hope & health, faith & friendship, truth & trust. 

& so much thanks. 


"well i've got a hammer. i've got a bell. and i've got a song to sing all over this land. it's the hammer of justice. it's the bell of freedom. it's the song about love between my brothers and my sisters, all over this land." 


arli. 

poet for the poor. 

plight highlighter.

"well i've got a hammer. i've got a bell. and i've got a song to sing all over this land. it's the hammer of justice. it's the bell of freedom. it's the song about love between my brothers and my sisters, all over this land." 

arli. 
poet for the poor. 
plight highlighter.

story:
Hi there! Thanks for taking the time to view our campaign.

First, a little bit about our school and program! The University of the Arts is one of America’s oldest universities devoted to the arts. It is located right in downtown Philadelphia, in Center City on the Avenue of the Arts. The MFA Book Arts/Printmaking Program is a two-year program in studio arts, focusing on the book as a vehicle of artistic expression and printmaking in the context of the narrative.

This trip will provide many amazing opportunities for students. Foremost, we will be participating as vendors at the Seoul International Artists’ Book Fair, as part of the Seoul International Book Fair. Immediately after tabling at the Fair we will be hanging a short show of prints at a nearby gallery associated with Hongik University. Later we will mount an exhibition of artists books at the Korean National University of the Arts.

In our free time we will also be visiting various galleries, museums, professional artists’ studios and other important cultural sites around Seoul. There will also be a tour of a nearby paper mill to learn about traditional Korean papermaking.

This trip is of enormous importance to all of our development as professional artists. Not only will we be participating in the Seoul International Book Art Fair as vendors and attendants but we will also be exhibiting work internationally. For many of us this will be our first experience in an international artistic forum, our first international gallery opportunity, our first time to any Asian country, and even the first time out of our own country period. It is almost impossible to begin to estimate the total educational and social value of this phenomenal opportunity.

Here's a quick break downs of costs for the whole trip for each person.

  • $1700 plane ticket
  • $800 housing costs
  • $300 transportation costs
  • $200 museum and gallery costs

That means that for each of the ten participants costs come to around $3000. This fundraising campaign is an attempt to lower total costs for the entire group.

We thank you for your interest and continued support, we hope that you choose to donate to this campaign and help us in our travels as professional artists.

**IMPORTANT NOTICE! Many of our perks offered are in limited editions. These limited editions will be purchased first come, first served. If you are interested in purchasing a limited edition item please respond to the confirmation email you receive IMMEDIATELY to secure it. If you have bid on a item whose limit has been reached we will contact you via email and either suggest another item or refund your money.

**Mailing Dates! All perks will be mailed no later than June 15th. You will be notified via email when your perk has been mailed. The only exceptions being the postcards and letters to be mailed from Korea and the "Korea Snapshot" to be designed and mailed after the trip.

story:
Flashback - Our first tour trailer from 2005!!!! (video above)

Moviemiento needs you!

We are reaching out to all of our friends, family, collaborators, fans, partners - basically anyone who knows us and has had a great time at one of our free public screenings or maybe even had the chance to participate, learn and grow as a part of one of our 11 international projects!

Our funding application was denied, but this is too important for us to give up.

The show must go on!!

Short Summary

Moviemiento is celebrating our birthday – 10 Years on the Road – from June 14-17, 2013.

Together we will build a 3-day Festival in our hometown: Berlin.

Our fundraising is specifically for the 3-days of Festival, workshops, and network building activities.

  • We aim to strengthen networks of creative cultural projects working for greater good
  • Old partners and potential new partners to learn and share with eachother.
  • We aim to build of skills in creating events with impact
  • We will work to build a festival which celebrates our work in this field

You are also invited to participate in these days of learning and sharing - just send a mail to getinvolved@moviemiento.org to see how!

What We Need & What You Get

We need this funding for:

  • Food
  • Materials for workshops and projects
  • Contribute to travel costs of participants who cannot afford them

Every cent helps, and we aim to raise €1,000 here!

What you get?...besides an amazing festival to attend at the end of the week.

  • Festival Tickets -get your pre-sale here!
  • Perhaps a night with our precious Kinomobilny!
  • A screening especially for you
  • Or how about a hug? :-)
With our minimum goal of €1,000 we will be well on our way with having the basics needed for the workshops and festival.

The Impact

This festival will be a celebration of the work and impact that creative cultural events can make. It will be a way for us to share our joy at having been doing this for 10 years!

It will also be a way to ensure that our projects continue on with new and old partners and collaborators!

Other Ways You Can Help

Help us to spread the word about this campaign!
Send us your stories of how Moviemiento has impacted you!
Share your photos of experiences with us!
 
If you would like to make a traditional donation - with a tax reciept - please contact:
Julianne@moviemiento.org

story:
Short Summary

I run my art classroom at Southwest Leadership Academy like a professional kitchen. It's a crazy idea, but it works. See my classroom environment is action when we were featured on WHYY Friday Arts: Art of Food.

In any restaurant, the family or staff meal is the pre-service dinner where all members of the staff sit down together and enjoy just before the restaurant's doors open for dinner. Chef Ferran Adria, of the world famous El Bulli, stated, “To cook well, you must eat well.” Even in our school, our students do not eat well. Poverty is a main factor as why students do not have access to nutritional meals nor do they sit down a share one with their families. Many parents work the night shift and many of our students are left with neighbors or their older siblings.

The idea of this project is based on ‘The Family Meal,’ when all restaurant employees sit down with one another and share a good meal before service. Even in my own family, I never had this luxury. Only when I worked in the restaurant industry did I experience this. 'The Family Meal' is also explained best through this video of Rene Redzepi, head chef of NOMA.

Through our partnership with Philadelphia’s Magic Gardens, we hope to create a mosaic tile mural around the notion of sharing a nutritional meal with family. The 8 panel mosaic told mural would encompass 8 different meals, from 8 different cultures with a description of the culture and meal. This would connect to our already in place ‘Rainbow Fish’ mural and the notion of sharing in our lunch room/ multi-purpose room.

The goal demonstrating the importance of sitting down a nutritional meal with family and that all households should, not matter what the dish or culture. The outcome is to change the notion of speaking in terms of ‘mine’ and speak in terms of ‘ours’.


What We Need 

  • Tile and grout materials
  • Paying for Magic Gardens teacher stipend


What You Get

  • Handmade household items by kids such as hand-built cups and pot holders.


The Impact

Our student population lives below the poverty line. More that 70 percent of my students receive free and reduced lunch. Making another mural about the idea of ‘sharing’ would have a huge impact on our school climate. Sharing does not come naturally to our student population because many do not have much. They fight for what’s ‘theirs’. With this mural, the message is to sit down and share a meal throughout all cultures and their food histories. Furthermore, the idea of sitting at a table and sharing a meal does not happen to many of our students with their families. I hope that seeing a visual representation of it will help our students find importance in it.

After last years success with Philadelphia's Magic Gardens, my students eagerly want to create another one to make an impact on our school and give back in this civic engagement opportunity. Civic engagement is a core philosophy of our school and promotes our Leadership model.


Other Ways You Can Help

Public school funding is being cut all across America. Art programs are one of the first things to go. Donate directly to Southwest Leadership Academy art program here.

Check out my classroom on WHYY Friday Arts.

Check out my website: devawatson.com


Credits:

Audio/ Music production by Charlie Patierno: http://CharliePatierno.com

story:
CUPSI 2014

To our Generous Potential Campaign Backers:

Welcome!

We would like to share about our struggle to get to the College Unions Poetry Slam Invitational in hopes that you will do what you can to help.

Slam poetry is a form of performance/spoken word poetry that occurs within a competitive event, called a “slam,” at which poets perform their own poems that are judged on a numeric scale by randomly selected members of the audience. 

Slam Poetry provides an opportunity for poets to express themselves in a free and open environment. Slam poetry is a means for those who have been deprived of voice to connect to the world and fellow poets in a real and meaningful way, all while being emotionally validated by random strangers.

Each year, Associates College Unions International (ACUI) produces the College Unions Poetry Slam Invitational (CUPSI) offering an opportunity for campuses with new or existing Poetry Slam programs to compete for top honors and to share their artistry and voices. Participants are enriched by sharing poetry, embracing the value of inclusivity, and supporting a program in which “Everyone’s voice is welcome.”

Last year the competition was in New York, which made it relatively expensive to attend. Not to mention an extremely generous donation asked for registration. This year we still haven't been so fortunate. The competition is in Boulder, Colorado which surprisingly  will call for just as hefty travel expenses.

Because slam poetry and S.P.E.A.K. (Spoken Poetry Expressed by All Kinds, the on-campus spoken word organization that sends the team) is very new to the San Francisco State community, the opportunities for funding are extremely limited. The school won't even pay our registration. That's where you, our family, friends and colleagues, come in.

Not only do we want to raise money for our trip, we also want to demonstrate to the San Francisco State community how prevalent Slam/Spoken Word is in the Bay Area and that they should provide the funding to include Slam/Spoken Word in that community.

We have been the first San Francisco State organization in the history of the school to send a team to this event and one of the first California State Universities (CSU) to ever attend CUPSI.

Feel free to ask whoever gave you this letter how you can donate to our other expenses as well. We are poets, starving artist, starving students, and most importantly loving human beings chasing our dreams and what we love to do. We will take whatever you can share. Every single dollar, kind word, and good vibe counts.

If you have any questions or other ideas about how to raise money feel free to email us at speak@mail.sfsu.edu.

Thank you for listening.
That's all we ever really needed.

The S.P.E.A.K. Team 
San Francisco State University Slam Team 
CUPSI - College Unions Poetry Slam Invitational 2014
University of Colorado, Boulder, Colorado
March 12, 2014

Budget for seven (6) team members attendance 
(5 Poets, 1 Slam Coach) 

Unit Cost Quantity Total Cost
Registration Fee (poets only) : $550

Airfare (round trip estimate) $2,200.00

Hotel (two rooms x 5 nights) $2,000.00

Ground Transportation $400.00

Total Estimated Expenses $5,150.00

story:
Announcements - Postcard images are now in the gallery
With only a week left, I'm going to throw in a batch of stickers with every perk!

What is Zodion?

Zodion is a line of illustrations by Tori Meader which reimagines the characters of the Western Zodiac as bionic creatures; a mesh of organic and synthetic tissue constructing beastly vessels for the embodiment of these celestial personalities.


Why do I need your help?

This kickstarter is to fund the launch of Zodion Graphics. I am just about to graduate college and need a little help getting up on my feet! The money will go towards the following:

  • Advertising/Promotion for Zodion
  • Maintaining websites & The Store
  • Ordering products featuring the illustrations - stickers, magnets, prints, accessories, etc

Advertising costs are based on exposure, for example I can buy an ad for $20 that gets 10,000 views. That sounds like a lot, but a view counts as it having loading on a page, not an actual click on the ad. Because I am such a new, unknown business I will need to buy several ads on many different websites and that will run up my costs quickly, especially if I want to renew any advertisements.

It costs $200 annually to maintain a website that supports a in-built store. Store hosting websites such as etsy.com and storeenvy.com have listing fees per item, which means I have to pay money to even show my item for sale in my store.

Minimum orders of custom designed products are often 50+ items and I would love to offer a variety of products, meaning that I have to place orders that costs a little bit more than if I were to order a huge bulk of one item. I also have 13 separate designs meaning that I have to make a lot of little orders. For example when I was ordering the bookmarks I'm offering as perks, I had to place 12 separate orders of 25 bookmarks each, costing me $77 versus ordering 500 bookmarks of a single design for $25! 

This business is all about offering variety and, unfortunately, that means investing a lot more initially than if I were offering only one product.

Be a part of the launch and receive the FIRST editions of these products and also the undying gratefulness of an artist jumping feet first into the business world! 

See the Illustrations!

Shipping for Christmas & Internationally

I will do my absolute best to get all the products out for Christmas, it will be easier for me the sooner you donate. Shipping is free but not guaranteed delivery in time, if you really, really want your perk reward in time for Christmas, please contact me and we can figure it all out!

I WILL ship internationally, but they won't be out before Christmas, unfortunately.

I will  be receiving the products I have available for the perks on roughly Dec 10th.


More About Zodion

Zodion is about changing the perception of this misunderstood concept. The Zodiac is common knowledge but ridiculed for being too fantastical, especially for the new values of the modern world. Zodion proposes a new futuristic take on the Zodiac; converting all the characters to genderless beasts in order to reduce any sense of bias or stereotyping between each character. Each character is a bionic hybrid of organic and synthetic tissues, making them ageless and in line with the trend of scientific developments of today’s society.

The illustrations are designed to be subtle embodiments of the Zodiac signs, allowing the art itself to be the most important thing. The Zodiac elements are supposed to be read second, even third and fourth. The attempt to shed the previous notions and misconceptions about the Zodiac is only possible if the viewer does not see the Zodiac first; but instead is grabbed by the artwork and allowed to make their own ideas. The lack of explicit labeling also means that the viewer can feel free to own images that are not of their own sign, but of whatever character, or characters, they enjoy the most.


About the Artist

Tori Meader is a young, somewhat overly enthusiastic, illustrator who loves designing and creating creatures and characters. She crafted Zodion from her love of not only the Zodiac, but of the mystical nature of ancient practices. Inspired by what she imagines must have been a life of fearful mystery and hopeful awe, she struck out to replicate these feelings in her work; to share the magic of believable fantasy.


Thank You, Thank You, Thank You

You are the absolute best! It is so nerve-wracking trying to launch from nothing and I appreciate and love all the support I get!


Share!

Please share! Even if you can't donate, tell your friends and spread the word, a couple of the perks offer two signs, maybe you can convince them to get one for you too, winkwink ;)

story: La Clemenza di Tito is a story of sacrifice, and of love. Set in Ancient Rome, we follow the epic story of betrayal and love in the tumultuous empire.  Manitoba Underground Opera is thrilled to present for its tenth production this incredible selection from the Mozart repertoire. The production will feature recent alumni from the University of Manitoba opera program Jan Nato, Vania Margani, Melanie Nicol, Susan Watkins, Laurelle Froese, and Stephen Haiko.  We are also thrilled to be including in our production a number of local community members and as well as other past and present University of Manitoba alumni.  Spearheading this project is director Brenna Corner and conductor Brendan McKeen.  The shows will take place at the Cathédrale de Saint-Boniface, on the 22nd of August at 7:30 pm and 23rd of August 1:30 pm.
story_txt: La Clemenza di Tito is a story of sacrifice, and of love. Set in Ancient Rome, we follow the epic story of betrayal and love in the tumultuous empire.  Manitoba Underground Opera is thrilled to present for its tenth production this incredible selection from the Mozart repertoire. The production will feature recent alumni from the University of Manitoba opera program Jan Nato, Vania Margani, Melanie Nicol, Susan Watkins, Laurelle Froese, and Stephen Haiko.  We are also thrilled to be including in our production a number of local community members and as well as other past and present University of Manitoba alumni.  Spearheading this project is director Brenna Corner and conductor Brendan McKeen.  The shows will take place at the Cathédrale de Saint-Boniface, on the 22nd of August at 7:30 pm and 23rd of August 1:30 pm.

story:
I’m Jerrod Jordahl, an artist living and working in Des Moines, and I need your help.  In September 2014, I received state funding from the Iowa Arts Council, a division of the Iowa Department of Cultural Affairs, to support the production of my original theatrical work, Pointland: A Play for Audio.  My team and I successfully completed the casting, recording, scoring, and mastering of the play, but we need your financial support in the final stage of this project.  

Pointland is play in two acts: we follow an unnamed recluse and his personal staff in the days leading up to their mysterious departure from his family estate. 

The audio recording of Pointland will be released this summer on vinyl record, complete with an original soundtrack, in partnership with Maximum Ames Records.  Collaboration with other Iowa artists was a major focus of the project for me.  I wanted to share my artistic vision with a discerning audience while showcasing local talent.  In an effort to further increase the impact of this project on the arts in Iowa, all the proceeds from the sale of the vinyl record will be donated to RunDSM, a Des Moines Public Schools program that uses performance-based art to support and empower students on their journey to becoming community-based activists. 

The entire process has been so rewarding: our auditions yielded an outstanding cast of ten actors who gave voice to my characters; three musicians composed and performed original songs for the soundtrack; our very patient and gifted sound engineer put all the pieces together; and a visual artist created stunning and starling images for the record album cover and liner notes.  Your dollars ensure that we can fulfill our commitment to the Iowa artists who brought this play to life.

I’m asking for your help in raising the final $2,500 necessary to complete this project.  Make a donation and you’ll receive a “perk” AKA  a cool gift specific to the production of the play -- check out the giving levels and the associated perks along the right of this web page. Please give what you can and help spread the word!

Many thanks for your support of Pointland and for helping maintain a vibrant and active community for the arts in Iowa.

Jerrod B. Jordahl


Written and directed by Jerrod B. Jordahl.
Produced by Bryon Dudley, Jerrod B. Jordahl and Chris Lyng

Andrew Nyberg...............The One
Joseph E. Smith II...........Lando

Shane Donegan...............Lewis
Devin Preston..................William
Barbara Briggie-Smith...Espisosa
Mark Bovenmyer............Dylan
Anette L. O’Shea............Young German Woman
Rachel Dakarian.............Woman’s Voice

Artwork and Design by Devin Walker
Recorded at The Chapman House Collective, Des Moines, IA
Mixed at The Spacement, Ames, IA

story:
COOKED AT BATLEY SCHOOL OF ART, SERVED IN LONDON.

We are BA(Hons) Fine Art for Design soon-to-be graduates at Batley School of Art, raising funds to take our degree show down to London (Free Range 2017).

We’ve spent the last three years in our little corner of Yorkshire, quietly working away on our art, design, sculpture, illustration, animation, photography and film and now that we’re all fully cooked it’s time to take it out into the world.

To date, we’ve held bake sales, set up shops, put on exhibitions and generally wheeled and dealed our way into raising money for Free Range. This is just the last push we need to cover our venue costs and promotional material.

BA(Hons) Fine Art for Design have exhibited at Free Range for over 14 successive years and the feedback from industry professionals, creatives and the public has been overwhelming. We believe this is an invaluable opportunity to kickstart our creative careers.

Aside from donating to our project – which we are very thankful for! Sharing this campaign with your friends would be a massive help in order to help us achieve something we have thought about since the first day of our degree in 2014. Thank you!

story:
The Design

The glove design was hand drawn by queer hockey fan @HockeyBabbler (that's me!) and colored to reflect various pride flags. The initial funding goal covered the traditional rainbow LGBTQIA+ pride flag. We blew past our original goal during the pre-order window and have z total of three designs available to choose from: The traditional rainbow, trans pride, and bi pride flag designs!

What We Need & What You Get

Here is what you'll get for backing this project:

  • High quality hard enamel pin with rubber back.
  • Free shipping to the US for up to three pins! Unfortunately once you get above three pins, the weight adds up, so we do have to charge a nominal amount for shipping. International customers, we've tried to keep the shipping costs low for you.
  • The warm, fuzzy feeling of supporting an independent artist!

What your money goes towards:

  • Cost of manufacturing a minimum of 100 of each pin design
  • Cards for mounting pins on
  • Fulfillment labor
  • Packaging materials
  • Postage
  • Indiegogo & credit card processing fees

The Impact

This is a passion project for me. It began as an idle desire for a pin to decorate my jacket and blossomed into something awesome. I am a freelance cartoonist and writer who is currently between full-time gigs, so your money also goes towards helping me keep my cats in cat food!

Risks & Challenges

I'll be 100% upfront - I've never had pins made before and this is all a little daunting. But my chosen manufacturer comes recommended by artists who have used them before, and this is not my first fundraising campaign. As long as we reach the initial goal, I'll have enough money to manufacture and fulfill 50 pins. I've carefully considered my stretch goals to reflect the additional cost of manufacturing more than one design. From what I understand, order fulfillment is often the hardest part of these campaigns. If the campaign is extremely successful, I may outsource help for fulfillment, otherwise I have done lots of research into the expenses of making, selling, and shipping enamel pins and feel confident that I can handle this.

The Timeline

  • September: Campaign starts!

  • October: Campaign ends! Surveys sent out to determine final count of each design, if multiple designs get made.

  • November-December: Pins get manufactured and packages get assembled!

  • January: Pins get shipped to you! Woohoo!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford a pin right now, that's okay! But maybe you'd be willing to help share word about these pins throughout hockey fandom by sharing the campaign on social media? That would be swell! I also hope to have extra pins (if any) available for sale after the Indiegogo pre-sale, so keep an eye on my social media feeds for updates on that front.

story:
Suomenkielinen versio löytyy englanninkielisen alta. (In Finnish below the English)



The Unseen Art project - a new way to experience art with touch, for the blind and for everyone. 


Have you ever been touched by art?  Have you had an emotional reaction while viewing a painting, have you gotten a different point of view, or learned something about the world or yourself?

Have you ever touched the work of a great artist?  Have you ever wanted to get up close and personal, and experience the art with your own hands?

You can experience art in a new way, and open art to others for the first time.  There are many people in the world who have heard of classical artworks their whole lives but are unable to see them. 

The project is involving people from all over the world to recreate classical art We are creating a new opportunity for people in the world to experience art.  The project is involving people from all over the world to recreate classical art paintings in 3D so that they may be touched and felt, both in exhibitions and in people's homes. 3D models of the paintings are free and printable anywhere in the world where there's access to a 3D printer.

"It would be a revolution to get blind people going to art galleries, people hate them because there is nothing there to touch!"




Your contribution will give people the opportunity to experience paintings for the first time in their lives. 

Many people around the world have heard of many classical artworks but never been able to see them.  Very few in the world have ever touched any of them. 

If you love art, supporting the campaign will give you a beautiful rendition of a masterpiece of art you can touch, experience different light and shadows, and display as a unique part of a home or office.

If you love technology or 3D, backing the campaign will help push the technology and awareness higher, and give new opportunities for virtual 3D art to become tactile, concrete, and physical.

If you know or love a blind or visually impaired person, you can give them a piece of art to experience for the first time, and make it more accessible for everyone around the world.

If you work in an office or own a business, a striking and unique artwork can impress and show philanthropy to your customers and partners.

A small contribution and a referral to your friends will make a great difference in people's lives.  

Anyone will be able to experience them for the first time through touch, and create their own impressions and opinions. Make a global impact together with us allows blind and visually impaired people and anyone interested in art  to personally experience the inspiration, education, and thought-provoking feelings that meaningful art creates.



Creating equal access for art globally is our passion and goal.

By backing our campaign we will be able to approach 3D artists to contribute their interpretations of 3D art, and anyone in the world can download them for free and print them anywhere there is a 3D printer, such as many libraries, Universities, in their homes, or from a local business.


We cannot do it without you!

Backing this campaign will help at any level.  All perks will be sent out regardless of the amount raised.  We believe in creating connections of people and making the world's art freely available.  


Featured in:


Evolution / Behind the scenes


–
In Finnish

Unseen Art -projekti


Yhdessä Sinun kanssasi annamme sokeille ja näkövammaisille täysin uudenlaisen mahdollisuuden kokea taidetta. Ihmiset ympäri maailmaa voivat osallistua luomaan 3D-mallinnoksia klassisista taideteoksista, jotta niitä pääsee koskettamaan niin näyttelyissä kuin ihmisten omissa kodeissa. Maalausten 3D-mallinnokset ovat ilmaisia ja printattavissa missä päin maailmaa tahansa, mistä löytyy 3D-printteri.

Päämäärämme ja intohimomme on luoda kaikille yhtäläinen mahdollisuus kokea taidetta. Maailma on pullollaan ihmisiä, jotka ovat koko ikänsä kuulleet klassisista taideteoksista – niin sanotuista taiteen peruskivistä – joita he eivät kuitenkaan ole koskaan itse päässeet näkemään.

Tarvitsemme apuasi.

Tukemalla kampanjaamme autat meitä lähestymään 3D-taiteilijoita, jotka voivat tarjota maailmalle tulkintansa klassisista taideteoksista 3D-muodossa. Kuka tahansa; missä päin maailmaa tahansa, mistä vain löytyy 3D-printteri; voi ilmaiseksi ladata 3D-mallinnoksia ja printata niitä esimerkiksi kirjastoissa, yliopistoissa, omissa kodeissaan tai paikallisissa liikkeissä.

Sokeille, näkövammaisille – ja sinulle

Miljoonat ihmiset ympäri maailmaa ovat kuulleet monista klassisista taideteoksista, mutteivät ole koskaan voineet nähdä niitä. Aniharvoilla on ollut mahdollisuus koskettaa niitä. Nyt kuka tahansa voi kokea nämä taideteokset ensi kertaa kosketuksen kautta, ja luoda näin oman näkemyksensä ja mielipiteensä niistä. Tehkäämme tästä yhdessä maailmanlaajuinen ilmiö, jotta sokeat, näkövammaiset ja ketkä tahansa muut taiteesta kiinnostuneet ihmiset voisivat kokea henkilökohtaisesti ne inspiroivat, sivistävät ja ajatuksia herättävät tunteet, mitä merkityksellinen taide meille antaa.

Auta meitä!

Apusi on meille todella tärkeä, valitsit minkä hintaisen vastalahjan tahansa. Kaikki vastalahjat hoidetaan perille vastaanottajille huolimatta siitä, minkä summan saamme kasaan. Uskomme, että luomalla yhteyden toisiimme saamme taiteen kaikkien ulottuville.

story:
Picture This: Jason playing Take the A-Train on an instrument as tall as he is.

Jason has a dream of owning and playing a stand up bass.  He has always loved the music of Charles Mingus and although we could not agree on naming either of our kids Mingus, it would be so joyful to see a beautiful bass in his loving arms.  

  • A little research shows that a plywood built stand up bass has better humidity tolerance for our weather, as it is not as delicate as a carved bass's.  A good quality plywood bass runs between $4000-$5000.
  • Jason would like to give an artwork from his recent show to every person who donates $200 to this dream (see gallery link above for images) . The artwork includes artist bio, crystal sleeve, archival image mounted and matted with vintage book cover, ready for your frame of choice.
  • G has offered to sew a doll in the likeness of you or a loved one for all donations in the $100 realm.
  • All funds will go 100% towards the purchase of a Bass, and we will continue to think of fun ways to make art and raise money to see it happen in this 40th year.

Other Ways You Can Help 

  • Contributing whatever feels right.  There are so many ways to celebrate this amazing person in our lives.  This campaign idea is but one fun idea.
  • Send birthday wishes to papasbell@gmail.com. 
  • Spread the word!

story:
Art in the Park: Los Angeles is a monthly event in which several artists take art supplies to inner city parks and mentor the youth through hands on activities. The purpose is to create a space for open expression and dialogue, building rapport and raising moral in the community.

The funds from this campaign would pay for supplies, including but not limited to canvases, easels, paints, paint brushes, aerosol paint, large boards, crayons, markers, clay, pencils, chair and table rentals, paper, etc. We will save and recycle as many supplies as possible. Art in the Park is a reoccurring event, so material donations are welcome. We also welcome you to show your support by spreading the word about this campaign to your friends and family. If you'd like to donate materials please contact us at GaKnew.r@gmail.com.

Thank you for you time and consideration!

#PowerToThePeaceful

#Repair

story:
The line between information & too much information is much shorter than the line to these porta potties.

The Other Singularity group creates interactive works of art examining the line between humans and technology. We deploy experiences that provocatively ask the question when should technology be deployed. 

The Augemented Reality Porta Potties (ARP) are a great example of technology showing up in unexpected places. The information is simultaneously useful and yet intrusive causing us to ask if this is really a good use of technology while enjoying the benefits of its existence. 

Deep playa is an austere environment that celebrates the art of Burning Man more than anywhere else in Black Rock City.  And then amongst that art there are the porta potties. Placed out of necessity they are jarring and we feel they could be more participatory. The ARP will be that blend of art & necessity.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Your funds will turn potties into interactive deep playa art

The ARP exist.  We will use your funds to make them aesthetically worthy & mechanically robust enough to work on the Playa.  We have already arranged for a bank of Deep Playa Porto's to convert. We have the funds for travel, prototyping & to put 1 unit in place.  The supporting solar power infrastructure will cost $2,100. For each $1000 we raise we can augment another unit.  Our goal is 10, but all funds over our goal will become another augmented potty!

What is a playa worthy ARP?

First we will wrap them in matte white vinyl so they take on the austere flatness of the playa.   At night we will up light them using a warm white light.  From a distance they will appear to float on the surface of deep playa.

Each unit uses low resolution sonar sensors to measure the distance from door to anything occupying the space. These sensors are hidden and are not capable of producing imagery. With them we know if a unit is occupied and if the occupant is standing, sitting & how long they have been in there. 

Projection on the playa is tough and only works at night.  So we are converting the projection to scroll signs which will work day and night.  Each sign will have its own printed canvas with ten unique styles of imagery for indicating open, sitting & standing.

Your gift of money will become a gift of playa art

The Other Singularity group has been creating and deploying activations world wide for a decade.  This will be our first playa project but not our first time on the playa.  We have activated at many other large festivals or events.  You can trust that we will convert your pledge into a working piece of art that you will be proud to have supported!

There will be a life after burning man

We will be bringing the electronics home and will be able to activate these at other events.  This is not a one and done that only burners will see. Your money will create multiple activations and help provoke many people into thinking about their relationship with technology.

You are funding art, not our trip!

We have tickets, we have our equipment, we have our travel covered. We are already prototyping the final build. Your funds will go to materials and every $1000 raised equals more Augmented Porta Potty's.  Scale will really help the impact of the activation.  We would like to do as large a row as possible!

What is a Roll Blind Sign?

Made famous by the London Busses & NYC Subway these signs have a banner behind glass on two rollers.  By turning the rollers you can change the sign.  We are making our own custom large format version of this kind of sign.  We will be printing out the sings on a plotter allowing us cool high resolution graphics.  Here is a video of the prototype:

 

The Original ARP!

We talked the regional rep into dropping this off at my house for 6 months so we could create the first ARP.  Here it is at Hello World.

 

The ARP at SXSW in 2011

We deployed these at the infamous frog party for a few years. The party was at night and the registered projection worked well.  The  roll signs we have planned for Burning Man will work day & night while surviving the dust better than projection. Plus they will just look and sound better!

 

ARP II

For a conference in Toronto we created a the first gorilla ARP unit.  Powered by battery and using EL Wire the ARP unit could be attached with straps and be deployed in minutes to any Porta Potty. We actually brought a porta potty on stage for a presentation and had an audience member come up and sit in it.  This was the beginning of the door mounted version that confirmed leaving projection works well and that a low power Micro Computing Unit can control the ARP just fine!
story_txt:
The line between information & too much information is much shorter than the line to these porta potties.
The Other Singularity group creates interactive works of art examining the line between humans and technology. We deploy experiences that provocatively ask the question when should technology be deployed. 
The Augemented Reality Porta Potties (ARP) are a great example of technology showing up in unexpected places. The information is simultaneously useful and yet intrusive causing us to ask if this is really a good use of technology while enjoying the benefits of its existence. 
Deep playa is an austere environment that celebrates the art of Burning Man more than anywhere else in Black Rock City.  And then amongst that art there are the porta potties. Placed out of necessity they are jarring and we feel they could be more participatory. The ARP will be that blend of art & necessity.

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
Your funds will turn potties into interactive deep playa art
The ARP exist.  We will use your funds to make them aesthetically worthy & mechanically robust enough to work on the Playa.  We have already arranged for a bank of Deep Playa Porto's to convert. We have the funds for travel, prototyping & to put 1 unit in place.  The supporting solar power infrastructure will cost $2,100. For each $1000 we raise we can augment another unit.  Our goal is 10, but all funds over our goal will become another augmented potty!
What is a playa worthy ARP?
First we will wrap them in matte white vinyl so they take on the austere flatness of the playa.   At night we will up light them using a warm white light.  From a distance they will appear to float on the surface of deep playa.
Each unit uses low resolution sonar sensors to measure the distance from door to anything occupying the space. These sensors are hidden and are not capable of producing imagery. With them we know if a unit is occupied and if the occupant is standing, sitting & how long they have been in there. 
Projection on the playa is tough and only works at night.  So we are converting the projection to scroll signs which will work day and night.  Each sign will have its own printed canvas with ten unique styles of imagery for indicating open, sitting & standing.

story:
Short Summary

Get your hands dirty and your mind blown at the Sierra Squish.  This event is a large-scale relief print project involving many participants including Sierra Nevada College students, area school district students, independent artists, and community members of the Tahoe-Reno Area. Participants will gather to print their large-scale woodcuts using an industrial-steamroller on April 22nd. The general public is invited to the event to observe the printing process and participate in hand-on activities. 

You will be supporting the purchase of art materials and the rental of a steamroller.
