story:
I've been invited to show my art at the 2014 WAV Exhibit in Madrid, Spain. But it's expensive! So, I'm sketching my way there!

Here's the gist of why I want to go:

Exposure, exposure, exposure

The real spirit here is to show support for an artist. As many of you know, I have been struggling as an emerging artist. It just takes getting it out there and I feel this is the right opportunity.

It really takes your support! In return, I'll sketch a portrait of you or a loved one!

You send me, via email or snail mail,  a photo of yourself or loved one (Yes! Pets are loved one's too), and I'll send you a sketch. All sketches are single subject. Take a look at  the Perks list to decide what size. I'm even offering up some original paintings! 

The Impact:

Your contribution will make my art visible to thousands of collectors, galleries,  and art lovers.

The Plan:

I am giving myself a deadline of three months to complete the sketches. I will start after the holidays. I will do one a day for 90 days. Once a month, I will gather up 30 sketches and send them off to you. It will be on a first come, first drawn basis and I'll keep everyone informed of where they are on the list. If you decide on purchasing the Original Oil Paintings, they will be shipped 3 days after funds are all cleared from Indigogo (Approx. 14 days after end of campaign). If you are choosing an Original Oil Painting from a photo you sent in, that will take approximately two months to complete, including drying time. 

The Event Cost Breakdown:

  • The participation fee:  600 Euro ($814 USD) ( Most art exhibits here in the US can be from $800 + for just a weekend)
  • Hotel : $99 + tax, vac fee + so approx. $130 for 5 Nights ($650) I'm only going to be there a week though the show is for 6 weeks. ( I found a great one on Trip Advisor - http://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g187514-d3167750-Reviews-Artrip_Hotel-Madrid.html )
  • Shipping: Approx $520 for 2 Paintings RT. 
  • Airfare: Round Trip $1200 (as of now) Most of you know that I usually can fly as Gibson's Pass Rider (Stand By) but with something so timely as this, I think it's super important to actually make sure I am there - on time...

Adds up to $3,184 US of A dollars! If I don't reach my monetary goal, I'll still go even if I have to stand on a street corner and peddle my art. SO YOUR PARTICIPATION AT EVERY LEVEL WILL HELP.  If I achieve higher than my goal, that will go go towards more art supplies and future events. Gibson will be thrilled!!!! 

This is what they sent:

"After the success of the first edition of WAV Party Madrid 2012, once again we decided to organize an event to promote the art of a group of artists during La semana del Arte (art week in Madrid), coinciding with ARCO and other important fairs.

This year, in addition to public relations activity for artists, we invite you to participate in a six-week exhibition in the "Centro Cultural La Vaguada".

The main event during these days of PR, dedicated to the promotion of your art, will be a party, WAV Party, where will be invited gallery owners, journalists, art critics, art professionals and people of the world of culture.

In the days before the party we will visit all the fairs introducing the WAV artists’ group to galleries. Participating artists also can visit the fairs and collateral events inviting dealers and collectors to see their artworks exhibited at the "Centro Cultural La Vaguada".

Once again we will work with the press and in particular Llei d'Art and Art & Artworks.

The participation fee is 600 euros to exhibit two medium size works for six weeks, benefit from the promotion and participate in the great event of the WAV Party, which takes place on February 22, 2014. The exhibition will take place from mid January to end of February 2014 in the "Centro Cultural La Vaguada" in Avenida Monforte de Lemos, 38 - 28029  Madrid Spain.

It's not necessary to attend the whole exhibition, but we recommend - if you decide to come - to be there from 19 to 23 February."

--
Studio Abba

Via di Santa Maria a Marignolle, 30b - 50124 - Firenze - Italia
tel +39 055292082

skype: studioabba
www.studioabba.com

SKETCHES:





PAINTINGS:

$700 PERK: ABUNDANCE 32" X 40" OIL ON HAND-STRETCHED FINE BELGIAN LINEN, GALLERY WRAP


$1,000 EACH OR BOTH FOR $1,800 - PLEASE SPECIFY WHICH ONE YOU WANT. THE RED & WHITE WINE IS CALLED, "DELIGHTFUL DUET" - THE WHITE WINE IS CALLED "CRAVING LA CREMA". BOTH ARE 6FT X 3FT OIL ON HAND-STRETCHED FINE BELGIAN LINEN, GALLERY WRAP


RED & WHITE: "DELIGHTFUL DUET"

WHITE WINE: "CRAVING LA CREMA"

$1,500- "THE PARTY" 3FT X 6FT, OIL ON HAND-STRETCHED FINE BELGIAN LINEN, GALLERY WRAP


Other Ways You Can Help

It is understandable if you can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:

  • Share this on all your social networks
  • Remember to use Indiegogo share tools! That will help with my ranking on here and will put me on the "popular" list. 

And that’s all there is to it.

Airfare: Round Trip $1200 (as of now) Most of you know that I usually can fly as Gibson's Pass Rider (Stand By) but with something so timely as this, I think it's super important to actually make sure I am there - on time...
Adds up to $3,184 US of A dollars! If I don't reach my monetary goal, I'll still go even if I have to stand on a street corner and peddle my art. SO YOUR PARTICIPATION AT EVERY LEVEL WILL HELP.  If I achieve higher than my goal, that will go go towards more art supplies and future events. Gibson will be thrilled!!!! This is what they sent:"After the success of the first edition of WAV Party Madrid 2012, once again we decided to organize an event to promote the art of a group of artists during La semana del Arte (art week in Madrid), coinciding with ARCO and other important fairs.This year, in addition to public relations activity for artists, we invite you to participate in a six-week exhibition in the "Centro Cultural La Vaguada".The main event during these days of PR, dedicated to the promotion of your art, will be a party, WAV Party, where will be invited gallery owners, journalists, art critics, art professionals and people of the world of culture.In the days before the party we will visit all the fairs introducing the WAV artists’ group to galleries. Participating artists also can visit the fairs and collateral events inviting dealers and collectors to see their artworks exhibited at the "Centro Cultural La Vaguada".Once again we will work with the press and in particular Llei d'Art and Art & Artworks.The participation fee is 600 euros to exhibit two medium size works for six weeks, benefit from the promotion and participate in the great event of the WAV Party, which takes place on February 22, 2014. The exhibition will take place from mid January to end of February 2014 in the "Centro Cultural La Vaguada" in Avenida Monforte de Lemos, 38 - 28029  Madrid Spain.It's not necessary to attend the whole exhibition, but we recommend - if you decide to come - to be there from 19 to 23 February."--Studio AbbaVia di Santa Maria a Marignolle, 30b - 50124 - Firenze - Italiatel +39 055292082skype: studioabbawww.studioabba.comSKETCHES:


PAINTINGS:$700 PERK: ABUNDANCE 32" X 40" OIL ON HAND-STRETCHED FINE BELGIAN LINEN, GALLERY WRAP$1,000 EACH OR BOTH FOR $1,800 - PLEASE SPECIFY WHICH ONE YOU WANT. THE RED & WHITE WINE IS CALLED, "DELIGHTFUL DUET" - THE WHITE WINE IS CALLED "CRAVING LA CREMA". BOTH ARE 6FT X 3FT OIL ON HAND-STRETCHED FINE BELGIAN LINEN, GALLERY WRAPRED & WHITE: "DELIGHTFUL DUET"WHITE WINE: "CRAVING LA CREMA"$1,500- "THE PARTY" 3FT X 6FT, OIL ON HAND-STRETCHED FINE BELGIAN LINEN, GALLERY WRAPOther Ways You Can HelpIt is understandable if you can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean you can’t help:
Share this on all your social networks
Remember to use Indiegogo share tools! That will help with my ranking on here and will put me on the "popular" list. 
And that’s all there is to it.

story:
PIECES is a young not for profit visual & performing arts organization that serves young adults, ages 18 through 24. We have been working with young artists in our community, since our birth, a little over one year ago.

What we do is nurture individual artistic talents and help young artists discover new ones by providing the tools, support and education. We work towards helping our members acquire skills that can become professions and businesses in art related fields.

An organization like PIECES is needed as young adults are no longer eligible for similar programming after the age of 18. We also know that many are often still in need of guidance in life, as well as easily available opportunities to explore and grow artistically.

Take a glance at our web pages to see what we are up to! Look at what our amazing artists are already accomplishing!

As a young organization that has just recently received 501(c)(3) tax exempt status, we are in need of funding. Since it's start, PIECES founder and co-founder Lalo Marquez and Monica Moreno have been personally funding and running PIECES programs. It is now important that PIECES receives the public's assistance. 

How Your Contributions Will Help:

This particular Indiegogo fundraiser is designed to help us raise the amount needed to pay for the space we need in order to keep our music, creative writing, visual arts and recording arts programs running. The $6000 will help us stay at this location for one year. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

  • Help spread the word! Share our Official Website. LIKE and share our Facebook page. Share our Indiegogo campaigns.

  • Make an in-kind donation! Computers, paints, canvasses, musical instruments, audio recording tools and equipment, dance class supplies (flooring and barres), ect.

  • Become a volunteer! Teach an art related class, resume' writing and interviewing skills. Assist us in reaching potential donors and organizing events.

  • Provide a space! Host an open mic, art show, fundraiser or dance concert at your location. Provide your space on a regular basis for one of our art programs.

  • Provide professional help! Provide legal advice and services. Provide bookkeping and accounting advice. Share marketing or fundraising strategies. Assist in writing grants.

Our artists and founders thank you in advance from the bottom of their hearts for your help. And in advance, we love you to PIECES!

story:
Short Summary

Me:

 

I'm a photographer from Argentina graduating from School in Colorado in April of 2013.You can look at my work at: www.guadalupelaizphotographer.com

The project:

From Colorado, I would like to travel to several of the Western States in my car looking for interesting man-made locations. I plan on doing quite a bit of investigating and research before I leave home is search of these hidden or forgotten locations, whether they be antiquated buildings, or old historical sites, or basically what looks like the ruins of our constantly changing civilization. I have had success asking local small town shops to help supply clothing and accessories, so I should be able to use both local clothing and local models.

 

They will certainly be unconventional photographs, but they will explore the landscapes in a way that glorifies them. I hope to get at least six strong and unique images from each location, and hope to travel to at least five locations, perhaps in different states like Wyoming, Oregon, Utah, Nevada, and New Mexico. Much like photographers take pictures of Americana that litters old route 66, I plan on finding the even more forgotten relics of the Western American landscape. 

 

 Some of this hopefully month-long trip will be about the exploration of the forgotten American landscapes, and some of it will be about re-envisioning these landscapes through the use of models and digital photography. Though it is not fashion oriented, it will include fashions that will compliment the emotional truth I'm trying to convey. These will not be contrived costume shots. I want to create pieces that beg questions of the viewer through the narratives they create, so that they can exist on multiple levels, and be pleasing to observe, like great paintings. 

 

 I would like this project to culminate into a unique book-length collection that I will work to publish. The book will ideally have five shots from each location, each conveying that emotional intensity I'm going for. Each location will have a short narrative explaining how and why I chose it, to help the reader fully understand its importance. 

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Why i need your help:

  • I will need your help in order to first, stop working in order to travel.
  • Cover gas expenses and small expenses such as food and a place to stay, if there is a night or two that I can't find a place to camp out.
  • Help cover any expenses related to photography such as batteries/printing,etc
  • Print and publish the book. 

 

Why the project is so important to me:

 

I believe it will have value for several reasons. For one, I think I can capture these pieces of forgotten America in ways that will retell their history and maybe reshape their present. Imagine seeing very telling photos of abandoned houses, office buildings, ghost towns, mining cabins, all portrayed in unconventional light and color, with models who convey an intensity of emotion that changes the way the landscape is viewed. I think documenting these locations is important, before they disappear forever. I also think it is important to push the boundaries of the genres of photography. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can’t contribute, but that doesn’t mean they can’t help:

If you can contriibute with money:

 

Please pass the word to as many people as you can!! That will be a great ! great! help!

 

Thank you!

story:
The last supper meets goon......

We live in a society on the brink of cataclysmic changes to the base structure of our societal fabric.  Mankind has become its own worst enemy.  It constantly finds ways to make life better as well as new and inventive ways to cause our extinction in the blink of an eye.  These themes find their way into a large percentage of my photographic work.

I was born Robert Gouner, but most people know me as goon.  Robert is a supervisor who works 9 to 5 to support his family.  goon is who lives outside of those hours. I discovered this part of myself when I bought my first camera.  Until that point, I had hobbies.  I worked a day job that provided the basic needs for myself and my family.  There was always something missing from that "other" side of me. The less practical part that had thoughts and ideas outside the mundane world of corporate America. Photography gave an avenue to express those thoughts and changed my entire life. It allowed me to explore ideas and turn what was in my head into art.  I was surprised by the number of people who not only shared my vision, but collaborated, supported, and helped make the art possible. 

In today's society too many people find themselves where I once was, working day in day out just to exist, without joy, without passion. They lack the drive or determination to seek an artistic outlet or to find the beauty in our fragile society.  I decided, with those first shots and projects, I will no longer be one of those people. I have been seeking new challenges ever since.

I have always had an appreciation for the abandoned landscapes. Seeing nature taking back an old building, park, or even sidewalk has always appealed to me.  I had a camera, some friends, an abandoned hospital and free Saturday ahead of me. Having previously scouted the location and noticing mold creeping up the first floor walls, we brought in resporators and gas masks purchased at an army surplus store. Deciding it was safer for the model to keep the gas mask on during one of the shots, a whole new era of photography was born to me.

Here are some examples of my gas mask concepts:

 

"Valentine"

 

 

"East Side Gothic"

 

and:

"The Intersection"

 
check out the behind the scenes video here: http://youtu.be/fXxbf2_gL1s

This project will be a modern interperation of "the Last Supper" with a grungy, urban, post apocalyptic flair. It will also involve moving 13 models, set elements, and lighting into and out of place in a short amount of time. I have the plan in place, and a group of models and assistants willing to face this incredibly daunting task, but I need assistance with the hard costs. To make this project happen I will need the following items:

 

  • additional gas masks. Estimated $350
  • rental truck to transport props, lighting. Estimated $250
Each and every cent raised for this project will go towards creating this image.  Everyone involved is a volunteer, from the person moving lights to the models and makeup artists.  The only team members missing are those to provide the funding for the hard costs of props and logistics to make this happen.

story:
On behalf of all the Art as Action Artivists, I want to thank EVERYONE who contributed to our annual fundraising campaign.  With your help, we raised $4,225!  To have our community rally around us and support the valuable work we do is an Artivist dream come true! 

We are still accepting donations if you missed the deadline: http://artasaction.org/join/donateNow.html


Ar·tiv·ist: a person who changes the world by penetrating the collective consciousness through art and collaboration. 

Make Art as Action possible with a tax-deductible donation today!

Art as Action performances and programs nurture and cultivate a wide range of Artivists: from veteran performers experimenting with a new genre to closet artists just discovering their creative potential; from people with Parkinson’s who uncover their inner dancer to at-risk youth finding a safe space to explore their place in the world.

Do you want to help homeless youth discover an artistic outlet? Or help families with Parkinson's Disease reconnect with each other and their bodies? Or help a community of collaboration and creativity? You can support all of these causes with one donation!

Break Open – November 8 & 9 at The Dairy in Boulder

Art as Action’s exceptional collective of dancers, poets, musicians and aerialists presents Break Open, an original, multi-disciplinary performance exploring the power of openness and vulnerability in an increasingly tumultuous world.  This performance will be the product of Art as Action’s one of a kind collaborative framework: The Artivist Process.

The Artivist Process is a series of monthly brainstorming sessions and in-progress showings that bring artists together, encouraging collaboration and providing an empowering and supportive environment for artists to produce entertaining, powerful and socially relevant work. 

The Artivist Process distinguishes Art as Action from other performing arts organizations; the work that comes out of our unique method is unlike any other.  In addition to enhancing individual pieces, these sessions create a collective consciousness among the Artivists on how to impact the community, support each other and represent the diverse aspects of the show theme.  The passion and dedication of our Artivists is the essence of what makes all Art as Action productions successful and the unparalleled 2013 cast will make it our most innovative and impactful season to date.

Young Artivists Performance Lab

The Young Artivists Performance Lab (YAPL) is an opportunity for at-risk teens to find their artistic voice and work with experienced Artivists. YAPL provides participants the chance to explore a variety of art genres, methods of expression and where they intersect. More than just lessons in specific disciplines, the YAPL promotes artistic experimentation, creation and communication with others. Art as Action’s Artistic Director, in collaboration with Artivist Mentors, facilitates Weekly Artivist Sessions at Attention Homes’ Runaway and Homeless Youth Shelter.  Read the Daily Camera article  

Reconnect with your Body Dance Classes

Reconnect with your Body classes explore the power of dance, creativity and artistic expression and enable participants to discover new ways to move their bodies. Dance has the power to transform and heal - plus it’s fun!  Participants explore movement & music in ways that are enjoyable, stimulating & creative.  Reconnect with your Body is beneficial for all bodies, including people with Parkinson’s Disease and Multiple Sclerosis.  (Based on the Dance for PD® model originated by Mark Morris Dance and Brooklyn Parkinson Group.)  Art as Action Artistic Director and lifelong dancer Sarah Leversee teaches the classes. 

Join the Artivist Movement

From fundraising, marketing and accounting, to artistic and technical direction, AaA is Artivist-run and supported.   Your donation makes our Artivism possible and contributes to our $27k annual budget.  Your gift helps cover expenses such as:

  • Production expenses such as promotional materials, lighting design and equipment rentals
  • Performance, class and rehearsal space rentals
  • Behind the scenes coordination and facilitation of our programs and performances

From the bottom of our Artivist hearts, THANK YOU for joining the ARTIVIST movement and supporting Art as Action!

story:
I've been selected to present at the 2013 American Art Therapy Conference in Seattle! Please help fund my trip!

I am a licensed art therapist and substance abuse counselor at a city hospital in Brooklyn, NY. I work in an outpatient program for adults who are dually-diagnosed with severe mental illness and chemical dependency. My job involves facilitating art therapy groups – groups where patients create artwork to address treatment issues relating to mental health, substance use, recovery, goals, and relationships.

This year, I have been selected to present a half-day course at the American Art Therapy Association’s National conference (http://www.arttherapyconference.com/), where art therapists from all over the world gather to learn and grow in this field. My course is called The Mural Connection: Exploring attachments through collaborative art-making. Each week, I run a mural group, where patients work together to create large-scale pieces of art. Research has shown that developing healthy relationships is a crucial part of addiction treatment and recovery. Collaborative art making encourages support between group members by offering creative non-verbal activities where patients can interact through the materials as practice for peer interaction, problem-solving, and sober socialization.

Substance abuse treatment, and specifically treatment that addresses both substance abuse and mental illness, is crucial in the world of behavioral health. Among people diagnosed with severe mental illness, there is a high prevalence of substance abuse, which can increase the likelihood of violence, non-compliance with treatment, and increased hospitalization and incarceration.

For the course, I will give a lecture, with examples from my work with patients, and then participants will work together in small groups to create murals, in order to experience the work in practice. This course provides information that is important for the treatment of substance abuse and mental health, and will give other art therapists an opportunity to explore this important topic and develop some skills to take with them into their own work.

The issue is that the conference is in Seattle, WA. And in order for me to present my course, I’m going to have to get myself to Seattle, and then get a place to stay. This is where you come in. Any donation, big or small, will be greatly appreciated. This is a big opportunity for me, and a big move in my career as an art therapist and substance abuse counselor, and my hope is that, with your help I can make it to Seattle to take advantage of this great opportunity.

Thank you!

story:
just call me "KEEBS" 

My name is Makeba, but you can just call me "KEEBS." I have 2 upcoming exhibits this Spring featuring my signature Digital Portraits (take a look at my site for examples: www.JustCallMeKEEBS.com) 

This indiegogo campaign is to help cover part of the production costs for these two exhibits, specifically the costs of large-format printing and framing.

Without your help, I will not be able to participate in either of these shows. Gallery exhibits are important because they put my work in direct contact with serious art collectors and contribute to a large portion of my income...of my livelihood. 

the budget

Printing: $1026

Framing (glass/matts/backing): $425

total: $1451

 

the Impact

A little over a year ago I quit my full-time job to pursue a career as an artist. There have been many low points, but many more high points and I have honestly never been happier.

This past year I have met and collaborated with many talented creatives who, like me, believe that the art we make must have a purpose; it must achieve something positive and have an impact on those who experience it.

The purpose of my art is to bring attention to those that I work with who are going change the world. Therefore, most of my portraits are of people that I know who are doing amazing, life-changing things with their talents. 

At both of these exhibits, my work is being dispalyed alongside a photograph of the subject taken by some of the many talented photographers that I know, and an excerpt from an interview that I've conducted with the subject. This sort of display achieves two things, 1) I get to share my space with other talented individuals, and 2) the audience gets to experience a new and unique way of viewing a comprehensive collection of work that is both visually pleasing and informational. 

other ways to help

If you don't have the "KASH 4KEEBS" right now, that is OK. If you like my work, please share this campaign using the Indiegogo share tools. GRACIAS!

story:
Hello folks,

The 1Spot Gallery and I, Jaque Fragua, are trying this experiment of crowd-source funding for public art. In this campaign we are raising funds for a mural project, to bring more of an indigenous voice to the visual environment of Phoenix. Being a hub for Southwestern Native art and with a deep history of indigenous culture, it is imperative to continue the expression and relation of Native perspectives to the community of what is now known as Phoenix, or S-ki:kigk in the O'odham language. What better way than public art to create and expand the dialogue in current times? In return, by donating to this fund you get a beautiful mural you can look at anytime you want and know that you contributed to the improvement of this communities health and growth.

This fund we are starting will be an on-going donation box for Native public art in Phoenix and beyond. As for now, the immediate kick-off project will be a mural in downtown Phoenix, starting May 29th, 2013. We are looking at a cost of $1000 to pay for paint supplies, rental equipment such as lifts, ladders, spray-guns, and some basic necessities for the artists such as water, snacks, fruit roll-ups, etc. Any residual funding will go back into the donation box for future Native murals to be produced!

I myself have travelled extensively and have created public art in many environments and I have only seen positive outcomes from painting in the streets and in the country. Art should be accessible to all walks of life, especially art from a culture that is marginalized or oppressed. These stories need to be shared and heard so that we can all contribute solutions rather than unintentionally perpetuate problems. Whether it's this project or another, I strongly suggest you support your local public artists and help raise the bar for your community's quality of life.

We hope you donate to the cause! Please spread the word and share this with your whole "team". Oh and did I mention a free screen-print for anyone who donates $20 or more? Righteous.

Cheers,

Jaque Fragua

story:
“Chief executives believe that---more than rigor, management, discipline, integrity or even vision---successfully navigating an increasing complex world will require creativity. “ -IBM CEO Global Study

Sol-Via Modern Arts offers a 21st century solution to the creativity crisis through highly engaging, interactive, creativity workshops for organizations of all types.  

Workshops Include:

Professional Development for Educators

Innovation through Creativity for Businesses

Creativity After School Program (Grades 3-6) 

http://www.sol-via.com/workshops-1

Linked to 21st Century Skills:

  • Creativity and Entrepreneurial Thinking 
  • Innovation 
  • Critical Thinking
  • Multidisciplinary and Open-ended Problem Solving 
  • Interdisciplinary Approach to Unit Planning (Educator Workshop) 

*These skills are taken from the: 21st Century Skills, Education & Competitiveness, A Resource and Policy Guide, Partnership for 21st Century Skills, 2008

Sol-Via Workshops are thoughtfully developed by our Executive Team using the most up-to-date research; designed in collaboration with master artists; and delivered in a highly interactive and productive platform. 

Sol-Via needs your help to get our Creativity Workshops off the ground! 

We are raising funds for:

  • Class Set of African Hand Drums
  • Visual Arts Supplies 
  • Portable Digital Piano 
  • Marketing Materials
  • Scheduling Software Subscription
  • Facility Rental Fees and Insurance 

Perks: 

Bumper Sticker:

"Winter Steam" by David M Dunda:

story:
Summary

"Stairway to heaven" (“Un escalier vers le ciel” in French) is an art installation created by French Burners, the French Burning Man regional group. The French burner community already has much experience creating burner-friendly and Burning Man themed events in France, and now we are ready to bring a touch of French flair to the playa this year as part of the Circle of Regional Effigies (CORE). Keeping in the spirit of radical inclusiveness, our team consists of not only French burners, but also several participants and collaborators from Italy, Spain, the United States and Canada.

 

1/ BURNING MAN CORE: what is it?

CORE is the acronym of "Circle of Regional Effigies", which is a group of art installations created by various regional Burning Man communities around the world. The regional effigies, which are placed in a circle around the Man, illustrate how global communities of burners work year round to bring the culture of Black Rock City to the world at large.

This year's configuration will see 4 circles of six effigies placed around the base of the Man that will burn together on Thursday night to create the world's largest intentional simultaneous Burn!

 

Our CORE Project for Burning Man 2013: Stairway to Heaven 

"Stairway to heaven" is a road to the unknown, a vertical adventure with no other purpose than the experience itself. Excitement for new knowledge, exploring the unknown, curiosity about different people and being present for new experiences: this is our vision of a Cargo Cult.

The stairway is a spiral, ascending to a place where it is impossible to say what lies ahead. As in life sometimes, the participant follows an indirect path, getting closer to the center at each turn, closer to the heart. There is no clear, direct path to ascend towards the center. You learn from the path as you move forward and up, and the meaning comes from the experience. The journey itself is the reward.

Picture yourself 6 meters above the ground, taking a deep breath and enjoying the view of the playa, relishing the immediacy of the experience. Drink some wine at the summit and celebrate the gods of the playa, enjoying it like a prasad, a treat offered at the end of a hindu ritual. This experience of collaboration and artistic expression rising towards the heavens is a journey not only above the ground, but also within our selves.

 Visit our blog www.frenchcore-burningman.com to keep track of our project, and to discover cool content - for example, can you connect Serge Gainsbourg and Cargo Cult?

 

Why 4,000$? What do we need your contribution for?

Stairway to Heaven is a big installation entirely funded by our team. We had support from the french Burners community and organization, and also organized a few fundraising parties in Paris (and one unsuccessful online fundraising on KissKissBankBank), and now a large part of the project budget is covered, but we still need your help! The project budget does not include the travel costs of the French CORE crew or tickets to the event, those costs are the responsibility of the individual members of our team.

After raising the money to buy all the building materials and to secure a working space in Reno, we still need about 1,500$ for transportation, in order to be able to move the structure from the pre-build space in Reno to the actual build site on the playa. Add a little above 1,000$ for power tools and safety equipment for the burn. And then we need 1,500$ to plant new trees in Nevada.

 

Help us plant trees in Nevada to offset our carbon footprint!

We understand the impact on the environment that we produce by traveling all the way from Europe, building and burning the playa structure, so we decided to calculate our carbon footprint in terms of CO2 emissions, and to offset it by planting trees where we produce the most of the impact, in Nevada. According to Cooling Man, our playa project will produce about 30 tons of CO2. 5 trees are needed to offset each ton of CO2, so we'll be planting 150 new trees in Nevada! Can you help us?

We know crowdfunding supporters love to get swags, so we got some stuff ready to say thank you to all the supporters to our fundraising: patches, tshirts, even Stairway to Heaven customized EL-wire and DIY construction kits to build your own Stairway to Heaven scale model! But we also ask you to help reach our goal of planting enough trees to offset our carbon emissions. We promise you that if we go above our fundraising goal, we will use ALL the excess donations to plant more and more trees, so we can help offsetting the overall impact of Burning Man 2013.

 

Contacts

Are you inspired by this project? Please join us if you can, we also look for new playa friends who want to volunteer for building, running, burning and LNTing at Stairway to Heaven!

Write to us at core@frenchburners.org and visit our blog www.frenchcore-burningman.com our our Facebook page to support our Burning Man 2013 project, and to help financially and logistically to make this project a reality!

Don't forget to donate here on Indiegogo, and to share your support to our project with your friends! Thank you! Merci! 

)°(  <3

story:
Metaldudes + Cats Book

 

PUBLISHING THE BOOK

FINALLY!  I have come to the stage in my two years of work on the Metaldudes Cats Book where I am ready to publish! 

My name is Alexandra Crockett and I began the project Metaldudes Cats Book back in 2010.  I had just been talking with my roommate at the time about how interesting - and cute - it was that alot of guys in the metal scene seem to have pets, and particularly cats.  I decided to do a little experiment and contact as many of my metaldude friends as I could at that exact moment and ask them what they thought of this concept as a photo project.  Reaction:  EXCITEMENT and DELIGHT!  This reaction made my mind up to go ahead and start the project itself by setting up model release forms and photoshoots.

The metal scene has long been thought of as a culture of people who are into dark, depressing, even disturbing imagery and ideas.  I believe that in alot of ways, these portrayals have spilled over into judgments over people's character as well. In general these judgments are not only negative, but also incorrect most of the time.  This, of course, can also be said of the portrayal of men in our society.

Metaldudes Cats Book challenges stereotypes of masculinity and the metal culture in general.  Now... I think we can all agree that cat photos and videos are a pretty integral part of the internet these days, so it feels a little pointless to describe why you might want to look at more cute cats.  DUH!  However: Metaldudes Cats Book combines three loves that have a global reach:  Kitties, Metal, and Duuuudes.  A love of kitties binds together the entire world together, even tough guys and those who listen to brutal harsh music.

Contributing to this project will, in essence, allow me to publish the book itself.  I am a lone person here, working on a huge project.  Publication means that all of my hard work will finally come to fruition, and that I will be able to give something back to the metal scene which I grew up in!  I've done over 110 photoshoots in person up and down the West Coast (and yes, I drove to all of them myself, usually alone), have collected over 300 submitted photos from all over the world, and have put on metal shows to benefit no-kill cat shelters in my book's name.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The book will cost, on average, $9000-14000 to publish and produce a short-run of a couple hundred books of the size and length necessary.  My unique perks for contributors include handmade prints of my artwork, handmade custom jewelry, and candles or blankets with prints of photos from the book.  I also have shirts and pins that will go out to contributors of lower amounts, as I am SO SO SO appreciative of anyone who is willing to help this project move forward.

If I do not reach my entire goal, all of the funds raised will still go towards publishing, and I will simply have to find some other way to raise the rest of the money: either through a personal loan or selling my own belongings (I am more than willing to do either!  I'm seriously that much of a crazy cat lady.).

Once the book is published and available for purchase, I will be donating 40% of the proceeds from sales to local no-kill cat shelters ("local" meaning one shelter per city in Seattle, Portland, Oakland and Los Angeles).  Therefore, your help in publishing this book also helps to keep no-kill shelters on the West Coast up and running.

* EVEN CONTRIBUTIONS OF $1-$5 ARE INCREDIBLY HELPFUL *

I realized that if everyone on my fanpage and everyone on my facebook contributed $2 each I would surpass my goal.  That's crazy!!  But it shows how people can come together to make a difference.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

IF you are unable to contribute monetarily, you can still help me get published by sharing This Campaign, as well as my facebook page (www.facebook.com/MetaldudesCatsBook) * !  It's incredibly helpful to get the word out to anyone and everyone you know, whether it's friends or family, metal fans, cat fans, or simply people intrigued by the strangeness and fun of the project.

*To do so you can use the indiegogo SHARE tools.

THANK YOU SO MUCH to everyone who has contributed and is contributing, and also to everyone supporting my work on the Metaldudes Cats Book project!  The past two years have been an amazing if not crazy ride, and I am so excited to share this final product of an actual published work with everyone.  <3 <3 <3

story:
My Project

My project is titled Art Out(side). It will take place between January 15th and April 20th, 2012 at the ART342 residency in Fort Collins, CO. At Art 342 I will have 14 weeks of undivided time to spend on this project. I plan to make a series of temporary sculptures outside of the gallery structure in places like public parks, forests, empty commercial spaces, and any where else I can. Each piece will be altered throughout its set duration from the weather, viewer interaction, and the changes I will make in response. It is important to me to bring this work into an environment where external forces can play as large a role in the works creation as anything I do.


The Impact

I feel it's vital to bring art to places where people can have the opportunity to encounter it during the course of their daily routine. I'm hoping to reach a broader audience by bringing this work out of the gallery and into the every day. In this economic climate of drastic budget cuts, it's especially critical to let people know why art is important and why it should be funded. Art isn't just for the art educated, it's for everyone.


What I Need & What You Get

My fundraising goal is $1000, though my expenses will far exceed that amount. I will primarily be using my own money and the $100 a week stipend for materials that Art342 generously provides. If you are excited by the project and have the means to donate, please do. Every donation will receive a gift, or perk, as a thank you. You can read more about the perks offered on the right side column of this page.


I will use the money donated for materials, printing, travel to and from Ft. Collins, CO, and any other expense related to the project. If I don't raise my goal amount the project will still go on, but not at the scale that it could reach with these additional funds. I am a recent MFA graduate with student loan debt after all.


More Information:

To see more of my work, visit my website: www.michelledickson.com

For updates on the project, including weekly updates during its creation, visit my blog:

http://art-out-side.blogspot.com

Art342's website: www.art342.org


Thank you!

Thank you for your interest! Anything you can do for the project is greatly appreciated, whether it's a monetary donation or just spreading the word. I can only reach so many people on my own, so please share my project with your friends and family.

The Impact
I feel it's vital to bring art to places where people can have the opportunity to encounter it during the course of their daily routine. I'm hoping to reach a broader audience by bringing this work out of the gallery and into the every day. In this economic climate of drastic budget cuts, it's especially critical to let people know why art is important and why it should be funded. Art isn't just for the art educated, it's for everyone. 


What I Need & What You Get
My fundraising goal is $1000, though my expenses will far exceed that amount. I will primarily be using my own money and the $100 a week stipend for materials that Art342 generously provides. If you are excited by the project and have the means to donate, please do. Every donation will receive a gift, or perk, as a thank you. You can read more about the perks offered on the right side column of this page.

I will use the money donated for materials, printing, travel to and from Ft. Collins, CO, and any other expense related to the project. If I don't raise my goal amount the project will still go on, but not at the scale that it could reach with these additional funds. I am a recent MFA graduate with student loan debt after all. 

More Information:To see more of my work, visit my website: www.michelledickson.comFor updates on the project, including weekly updates during its creation, visit my blog: 
http://art-out-side.blogspot.comArt342's website: www.art342.org



Thank you!

Thank you for your interest! Anything you can do for the project is greatly appreciated, whether it's a monetary donation or just spreading the word. I can only reach so many people on my own, so please share my project with your friends and family.

story:
The Liberty Project is a six-month painting and mixed media art project that I began working on in late December 2013. It explores the philosophy of liberty and the hot topic of immigration in the US with the Statue of Liberty as the central symbolic figure as subject. The project is partly inspired by my own experience as an expat living in another country and even moreso by my own grandparents' immigration experience to the US where they were welcomed and greeted by the towering statue during the early part of the 20th century.

Using oil, acrylic and sometimes encaustic painting techniques, newspapers and other printed materials (including printed screenshots of some current events) to create a total of 5 very large paintings and approximately 30 finished smaller works of varying sizes which will complete the series. Also there will be a number of other studies (paintings, pastels, charcoal drawings) that will be documented and posted on line as well.

Here are my first three initial studies in paint of the statue itself:

It is my hope that the narrative created through the visual works for this project will prompt people to consider their own heritage and experience, as well as, others' experiences. The art asks the viewer to examine what liberty means to them in their own lives and to contemplate how these same ideas of liberty apply to others. people, Does every person have the rights to the same freedoms.

Exhibition and Website

The works will be exhibited this summer either in a gallery in Assisi, Italy or in my home city of Cluj-Napoca, one of the largest cities in Romania. I hope to exhibit the art in both locations and have begun a dialogue to this end. I need your help to make it happen. I will update the project as more information becomes available and a location is confirmed.

The works will be accessible to viewers worldwide though the development of a website dedicated to the project. The website will include a blog portion in which I hope to engage the communitry through commenting and encouraging others to share their own opinions and stories.

Personal History behind the Project: Three Generations

This project in its simplist form started as an idea in early 2013 when thinking about the promise of freedom and liberty through three generations. 

The promise of freedom was thrust upon my maternal grandmother who unwillingly came to the US. Tragedy changed my grandmother's destiny and brought her alone and scared to an unknown place, changing her life forever. My paternal and maternal grandfathers came before her from Germany and the Austro-Hungarian Empire.

Both of my parents, first generation americans, embraced american life and culture. My father was a photojournalist who embraced the american way and pursued and fulfilled his own american dream. He was assigned to shoot the Statue of Liberty in the 1970s; the statue was nearly 100 years old. The series of b&w images that he took of the Statue of Liberty are part of the reference materials I am using to create my paintings and mixed media pieces.

I, a second generation american as an expat, am pursuing my own artistic practice in a land closer to my grandmothers origin, in a time where the dream no longer seems possibile in the US.

How the funds will be used:

Materials - Wood Panels, Cardboard, Stretcher bars, Fabric, Rabbit Glue, Gesso, Pigments, Mediums, Brushes, Charcoal, Tape, Beeswax, Linseed Oil, Turpentine, Sketchbook, Other misc supplies.

Studio Space -  6 month rental - Studio space is essential to completion of this project since I live in a 1 room efficiency apartment + two dogs. While I can sketch, it is impossible for me to create larger works and is difficult to use oil as a medium in such a small space due to the fumes.

Project Printing -  Historical images and other digital items must be printed for use in some of the multi-media pieces.

Exhibition Costs  - costs for the exhibitions include matting and/or framing of some of the small works to be exhibited, as well as, transporting the works by courier. Many works will not require matting and framing (i.e. stretched canvas, unstretched canvas with grommets, etc.)

Website  - costs related to purchasing a domain name and hosting the site. I have worked as a front-end developer and will create and update the site myself.

Perks Printing Costs - Limited Edition Prints, Liberty Project Catalog, Postcards, Vinyl Stickers.

Perks Shipping - includes a bulk package from Romania for any items larger than letter sized envelopes of project rewards which will then be distributed from the NY area - all materials will be sent certified to verify receipt of the rewards. This is the most economical way to ship rewards to North America. Rewards shipped to other areas will be send via the Romanian Postal Service certified.

Basic Living - a portion of the funds will cover some of my own basic expenses during these months (food, basic utilities) as I am dedicating myself entirely to this project and will not be accepting any other outside work during this period.

Indiegogo fees - If my goal is met Indiegogo takes 4% of the total amount funded. If I do not reach my goal 9% of the project funds go to Indiegogo. 

The Liberty Project Perks

When you fund this project, based on your contribution you can receive any of  the following:

  • a set of 5, 10 or 15 full colour postcards from the project
  • A set of 5 vinyl stickers of selected works
  • a digital PDF full colour catalog of all of the works and/or a printed version of the catalog
  • A high resolution digital download version of one of the paintings, so you can have the work printed and/or framed locally.
  • A full colour signed and numbered limited edition giclée print (size A4) on acid free 300g archival paper of 1 of the works. The selected work for a specific perk or  reward will not be available as a digital download in other rewards and will be limited to 25
  • A limited number of original art paintings, mixed media assembleges and sketches from the project will be available.

Of course every backer will be listed on the patron page of the project website.

Perks and other shipping information

All perks/rewards for US will be shipped insured with a tracking number in bulk to the US, then shipped via an intermediary via the US Postal Service Certified and/or UPS Ground.

International and domestic shipping excluding the US:

1. For all other locations the perks/rewards will be shipped insured with a tracking number via the Romanian postal service.

2. Shipping within Romania for small parcels via the post office, larger items will be shipped via Fan Courier.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you like this project but can’t contribute dollars, you can still help me make this happen. Please spread the word and distribute the project on facebook, twitter, pinterest, wherever you can, make some noise! You can share the project with Indiegogo share tools too.

Thank you for your support, it means the world to me and it will help me to share my gifts with world.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Professional Experience

I am an american artist living and working out of Cluj-Napoca, Romania. I moved here at the end of 2005 in order to pursue a career as a professional artist. In 2008 I was awarded a MFA degree in Painting from the Academy of Visual Art "Ioan Andreescu." You can check out my website to learn more at http://amymarieadams.com or at http://amymarieadams.info.

----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

story:
**WE MADE IT! THANK YOU ALL SO MUCH.**

Hi there!

 My name is Skylar Urbaniak and  I live in Saskatchewan, a small not very well known province in Canada. I spend my free time cosplaying and doing artwork just to make it by. I've had my sights set on selling at conventions for about 4 years now, but the funds just have not been there to commit to doing it. I would love to create some charms, buttons and stickers to travel and meet people at conventions this upcoming year. The cost to get high quality charms and prints done is quite high, but it is something I have been passionate about for years and want to pursue. Charms would be made in over 25 different designs! Thats a lot of charms and variety. I really want to kickstart a traveling art career, but it is a lot of work! So I'm turning to you! With your help, I will make this happen!

My first convention I would like to sell at is Calgary Comic and Entertainment Expo. The cost covers the cost of getting the charms created, the batch of prints done, the fees from the website, and the cost of the table at the Calgary Expo. I hope to achieve this goal by January 2013. My hope is to sell the charms and with the funds be able to afford to travel across Canada and meet others at Anime Conventions while doing this.

So why $1,100?

-To get the charms made it will cost $724.00.

-To get the stickers and buttons made it will cost $254.00. This is 10 designs.

'But thats $978.00?..'

Indie Gogo takes a big chunk in fees, and so with the $1100 it averaged out to about $1192.00. /closeenough.jpg

It has also been brought to my attention an artist table at the Calgary Expo is $300+ dollars alone.

 

What are charms? Why charms?

 

The charms would be 1 inch acrylic laser cut charms. I want to create cute, high quality acrylic charms to hang on your cell phone, your Nintendo DS, add the charm to a necklace as tons of other things! Just for everyday cuteness!

 

Well I don't like MLP- how does this appeal to me?


I will be making plenty of other designs! There will be a bit of cuteness for everyone!

story:
OUTDATED ALIMONY LAWS

Short Summary

Perhaps you know someone who has been "taken to the cleaners" by an ex-spouse or perhaps you have been in the situation yourself.  Stunned by an 18 month (so far) process of determining spousal support, I've spent this time exploring the loopholes that allow California's outdated marriage and divorce laws which can be exploited by anyone in the know.

Artist, Photographer and Writer, I want to illustrate a story of Schmoe in various situations with a satyrical eye for citizens who are perplexed by the Kafkaesque nature of family law in the country.

Schmoe is a good guy who believes in doing the right thing.  He pays his bills on time, cleans the house when he gets home & supports his wife in her artistic endeavors so that ultimately, they can operate as independent artists.  What happens from there, one can only imagine.

What We Need & What You Get

I am setting a goal of $43,200 (based on the 4320 factors considered in determining spousal support in California), to write, publish and distribuite my book.

Perks range from a line on the "Wall of Claims" at the end of the book for any schmoe (male or female) who may have been financially ahnialated by the system (the case description i.e.  "Kramer v. Kramer, State of Califonia, 9th Circuit Superior court, 2012") to a personalized illustration of a situation you might be in to an autographed copy of the book sent to your ex served up by a legitimate service.

The Impact

Marriage laws in California are in desperate need of re-evaluation:

  • Let your voice be heard by donating to this cause
  • Already successful published writer, photographer & designer, I know how to make a project come to fruition and have done so in the past with no funding.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, you can help by getting the word out through social networks:

  • Tell friends in similar situations how they can contribute and be heard
  • Please use Indiegogo share tools!

story:
The Wasmuth Portfolio by Frank Lloyd Wright is a stunning collection of 100 gorgeous hand drawn lithographs that had a profound influence on 20th century architecture. This document set the course of modern architecture. It has had such an impact that the world surely would have looked different without it. 

Due to the tragic massacre of Wright's family in 1914 and the subsequent fire that destroyed his house and most of the remaining copies of the Portfolio, only a handful of copies still exist today. This project aims at recreating the portfolio online.

National Bank Building, Mason City, Iowa

As it happens I own one of the last remaining original copies of the Portfolio. My grandfather Alphonse Siebers, an architect, was acquainted with Wright and a copy has been in our family for nearly a hundred years. At the moment it sits in a safe place where, unfortunately, no one can see it. 

The aim of this project is to open the portfolio to the general public. Only on very rare occasions the public gets to see a number of the portfolio's drawings during an exhibition. For most part, it is a hidden treasure. Some reproductions do exist, including some online, but they can't compare to the amazing originals.

Concrete house for Ladies Journal


Where Does the Money Go?

The original lithographs will be remastered, rather than copied. Every single drawing will be scanned at high resolution. Using advanced digital techniques, the lines and colors will virtually be separated from the paper. This is a very time consuming process that takes an expert editor about 4 hours per image. But the resulting data will allow to reconstruct the images in high-quality digital format.

A bespoke and meticulously designed website will host the images. The website will allow visitors to zoom in and view all the details. For a fee, the website will allow visitors to download image files, from small size all the way up to 50 megapixels for print purposes.

In case not all the money gets raised, it may take a lot longer to remaster the images. The website may have to be downgraded to a simple template, which won't be as beautiful as the Portfolio deserves, but it will work. So in the end it will still wind up online in one way or another. But the more money is raised, the better the quality. I have a strong track record as a digital designer and project manager, so I'm quite confident that this project will work out well.

According to US law, the copyright is in the public domain. On the other hand, according to German law (where the portfolio was published) the copyright is still valid for a few more years. However, the current copyright holder, the Frank Lloyd Wright Foundation has approved of this project and has no objections.


What's In It For You?

Help preserve a unique piece of design history and contribute to the project. In return you'll get image files or prints of some of the gorgeous drawings of the Portfolio. Blow your artist and designer friends away by hanging a perfectly reprinted Wasmuth image on your wall. Check the perks for a contribution that fits you. 


Other Ways You Can Help

Get the word out and make some noise. Tweet, blog, post it on Facebook, anything. And please use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks in advance,
Igor Asselbergs

story:
The description of the class from the Pratt website that Brent is hopeful to take is as follows:

Glass has a plasticity and behavior which lends itself to sculpting, and this course will provide a freedom to explore process and the potential of the material. This is not a traditional glass sculpting class however, as we will be using various torches in the hot shop to create more detailed work. We will discuss the advantages and disadvantages of using a solid or blown form and explore various methods of color application. In this 5 day intensive we will be doing more explorative sculpting than making actual finished pieces. Sketchbooks are mandatory. At least two years hot glass experience required.  

 Brent will be offering a variety of glass sculptures in exchange for your generous contribution. Glass pieces will be signed by Orient and Flume Art Glass.

The money raised from this campaign will go towards :

*the cost of the class

* round-trip flight

*room/board/food/inner-city travel

Thank you so very much for your time and your contribution towards Brent's passion.

Thank you to Orient and Flume Art Glass for their permission and support for this campaign.

story:
My name is Kamil and I'm Freelance 3D Generalist, I'm from Poland and live in Gliwice. I was working for many companies over the World. My adventure with Computer Graphics, especially 3D was started about 10 years ago.

I learn all the things by myself from books, and mostly from tutorials. I'm planning to run a site with CG tutorials and that is why I'm starting an Indiegogo project.

Recently I'm on photogrammetry topic. I know it very well, from the beginning to the end. By end I mean realistic 3D rendering with PBR materials, which can be used in any type of projects. Games, animations, advertise, architecture, 3D printing and I believe many more.

My tutorial series will contain almost every step of creating a model in photogrammetry technique.
We will start with camera settings, building a small lighting studio, and off course shooting principles.
Don't worry if You haven't photo camera, My tutorial will also contain a chapter for using camera in Your Smartphone.

We will work on few projects, from simpler ones to more difficult to learn possibly most everything regarding the topic. 

I hope You will help Me to achieve this goal, so I can work further and teach people, which I like the most.
 

Funding will allow Me creating this tutorial series. Rest of it for creating a site with CG tutorials. But not as it is on many sites. I like to make a service where We will have whole projects. Simple projects, difficult, where We will use few software to creating it. 

Everyone who will fund My project. Will get whole tutorial series with project files. 

 

What the tutorial chapters will contain:


BEFORE WE BEGIN:
 

1. What photogrammetry is? 

  • A little intro to the topic

 

2. What We need to shot photos?

  • Camera vs Smartphone in the term of quality

 

3. Do I need professional lighting equipment?

  • How to build cheap, yet good lighting studio.

 

4. Shooting photos

  • Best weather conditions
  • Shooting principles
  • Camera settings

 

GENERATING MODELS:

1. Processing our photos for best results

  • Processing RAW data in Photoshop Camera RAW
  • Color correcting photos
  • Saving correction presets
  • Saving TIFF files
  • Making masks for later use in Agisoft Photoscan (studio lighting technique)

 

2. Agisoft Photoscan

  • Photoscan basics
  • Loading photos
  • Generating masks
  • Refining masks
  • Sparse point cloud data
  • Dense point cloud data
  • Generating high poly mesh
  • Merging chunks (optional, depend on object and shooting)
  • Exporting high poly model

 

3. Zbrush

  • Refining highpoly model
  • Dynamesh
  • Re-project detail
  • Export to OBJ

 

4. Back to Photoscan

  • Importing refined in Zbrush model
  • Decimate mesh to lowest possible
  • Export decimated mesh to OBJ

 

5. Blender

  • Importing decimated mesh into Blender
  • Retopology/remodeling (not always needed)
  • Proper UV's
  • Export to OBJ

 

6. Back to Photoscan (yes again ;) )

  • Import proper mesh with good topology and UV's
  • Generate texture
  • Export model and texture (low poly version)

 

7.Blender for second time

  • Importing model
  • Setting up right scale and orientation for both low, and highpoly model from Photoscan (Yes We still need that HP from Photoscan for fine detail)
  • Again export to OBJ

 

8. Substance Painter

  • Setting up the project
  • Texturing for Blender/Cycles.
  • Baking detail from HP to LP
  • Painting all desired textures for the object
  • Export maps to use in Blender/Cycles (PBR)

 

9. Blender – Shading, lighting, rendering

  • Importing data to nodes system
  • Using new “Principled” shader for the project
  • Lighting with HDR and mesh lamps
  • Denoise settings
  • Final rendering

10. Export for 3D printing

Extra content:

  • Abandoned train
  • Relighting textures in Unity. (if You are shooting outside and there is no way of getting flat lighting from the sky)

 

Content Summary:

All of the above will be used for 5 type of models. For studio lighting bunny figure and gas cylinder, For Outdoor lighting pavement, wall and abandoned train (extra content). Apart from all of that You will learn how to handle that type of projects. Project folders, naming etc.

As You can see, this isn't only something about something, but really complete series and rich in knowledge. 
I encourage You to fund this project, it is really worthy. That knowledge can be applied everywhere. 
Game industry, animation industry, monuments reconstruction, architecture, creating assets. etc. 

 

How long it will take to finish?

Everyone who contribute will have instant updates. Whole tutorial will be ready at the latest on first days of October. 

 

What if funding fails?

Because I'm on flexible goal funding. If funding will fail. Everyone who contribute will get the tutorial anyway. But the completion time of it may be longer. 

But let's go tell Your friends, spread the message. This will be the best tutorial on the topic. 

Last words

Tutorial will be also available after completion, but for much more, around 100$, with funding You have a chance to get it really cheap. I really hope You can help Me to meet my little dream of having tutorial service with creative content.
story_txt:
My name is Kamil and I'm Freelance 3D Generalist, I'm from Poland and live in Gliwice. I was working for many companies over the World. My adventure with Computer Graphics, especially 3D was started about 10 years ago.I learn all the things by myself from books, and mostly from tutorials. I'm planning to run a site with CG tutorials and that is why I'm starting an Indiegogo project.
Recently I'm on photogrammetry topic. I know it very well, from the beginning to the end. By end I mean realistic 3D rendering with PBR materials, which can be used in any type of projects. Games, animations, advertise, architecture, 3D printing and I believe many more.My tutorial series will contain almost every step of creating a model in photogrammetry technique.We will start with camera settings, building a small lighting studio, and off course shooting principles.Don't worry if You haven't photo camera, My tutorial will also contain a chapter for using camera in Your Smartphone.We will work on few projects, from simpler ones to more difficult to learn possibly most everything regarding the topic. I hope You will help Me to achieve this goal, so I can work further and teach people, which I like the most.

story:
Some Background

My name is Brittney Leeanne Williams and I am a Chicago-based visual artist originally from Los Angeles. My work revolves around questions of identity including Blackness, femininity and spirituality.

In early April, I was thrilled and honored to be accepted into the prestigious Skowhegan School of Painting and Sculpture summer residency for 2017 in Skowhegan, Maine.

But to be able to take advantage of this opportunity, I need your help.

For the past three years, I have been cultivating my studio practice and focusing on developing my work, while working as a studio assistant to support myself. Over the last year, I’ve been very fortunate to show throughout Chicago, at UICA in Grand Rapids, and have a show coming up at San Francisco’s Luggage Store Gallery. I am especially excited to be included in the Petty Biennial this spring at the Art Incubator, curated by Lakeisha Leek and Sadie Woods.

While I am grateful for these opportunities to show my work, I am at a point in my art practice where I need to focus exclusively on my painting, get intensive critical feedback, and incubate. Since I work 30-40 hours a week, I haven’t been able to devote extended periods of time to my practice. The Skowhegan summer residency is a rigorous program that would allow me to focus on my craft for nine weeks from June 1-August, in an uninterrupted studio space in the quiet of Maine. It will provide me with extensive opportunities for critique, and to meet other emerging artists from around the world. And it will help me broaden my community of colleagues and mentors.

This opportunity is especially important for me as I was forced to leave the School of the Art Institute BFA program after a year and a half due to lack of funds. The Skowhegan residency will positively impact my work, my career, and my professional network in ways that I wasn't able to realize after my short time at the Art Institute.  (This video by Skowhegan shows the possibilities).

Skowhegan is arguably one of the top programs in the US, and will not only help me improve my work, it will help me for years to come in the form of connections I will develop with other Skowhegan faculty and alumni. I am very grateful and excited to have been given this invaluable opportunity to further my education and development.

The Pitch

I have been fortunate enough to be able to support myself for the last few years through my commission and studio assistant work. But after the bills are paid, there’s not a lot left over. And even though I will be looking to pick up extra work in the next 2 months and applying for grants, given the short turnaround time from my acceptance to the start of the residency, I simply don’t have time to raise the extra money I’ll need for the Residency.

I am asking for $2,500 (less than a third of my budget) towards my Skowhegan expenses to help pay for materials, tuition, and to cover my roommate share in Chicago while I’m away. Here’s the breakdown:

Expenses

SKOWHEGAN Tuition            $6,000

Materials (paint, canvas, etc.)     $720

Round trip flight from Chicago to Maine  $500

Round trip ground transportation       $280

Chicago rent & utilities roommate share  $1300

Incidentals/travel expenses    $300                                                                         

Indie Go Go campaign fees estimate    $200

TOTAL:    $9,300

INCOME

SKOWHEGAN tuition subsidy: $5,500

Brittney tuition/incidentals contribution: $1,300

TOTAL CAMPAIGN FUNDS SOUGHT: $2,500  

 

The Goodies

I am deeply grateful for any contribution you are able to make to help me get to Skowhegan this summer.  Thanks! All contributors get a shout out on all my social media.

Given my time constraints, the perks are a bit limited. If you’re able to give at $100 or above, I am offering a few pieces of my work as rewards for your support. You can find images of the perks in the gallery above.

Thanks for your time!
